title: SAP Gateway and Simple Field Extensibility - does it work with append views?
text:
I read about the Gateway's [Simple Field Extensibility](http://help.sap.com/sa
phelp_gateway20sp10/helpdata/en/df/0ec1548617ed05e10000000a4450e5/content.htm)
and set up a small example with:

  * a database view on an existing table
  * a new OData Service based on the view with a single Entity Type and its Collection Type - i.e. the entity type is linked to the view structure
  * I implemented the get_entityset method in the data provider extension class with a simple SELECT * statement
  * when I execute a query on the Collection I get back the view data, as expected



So far, so good. Then I created an append structure for the underlying
transparent table with a single field and a view append for the view I use as
data source. When I then execute a query on the Collection I get back exactly
the same view data as before, i.e. without the appended field.



The SAP help documentation (like above) tells us that:



_At runtime SAP NetWeaver Gateway classes (model provider class and data
provider class) consider the fields in the extension includes in ABAP
Dictionary structures. That means that entity sets that are technically based
on ABAP Dictionary structures for which SAP provides the option to extend them
via append structures will automatically show new properties if the underlying
ABAP Dictionary structure has been enhanced by the customer. This process is
called Simple Field Extensibility (SFE). Properties that have been created by
using SFE contain the annotation sap:is-extension-field="true"._



I supposed that this works with append views as well, and am a bit astonished
that it doesn't seem to work with my example.



Does anyone have some experience with using the Simple Field Extensibility
feature?
author: Valentin Huber
Vengaiah Chowdary Pachava Chinna
text:
Hi Valentin,



You need to add your new field in the properties in Entity type. After adding
field in the entity type , do Generate runtime objects . So, your new field
will be updated in MPC. If have written the code in

method  get_entityset in DPC. In that case you need to write the code again in
the DPC. As per SAP best practice , please write the code in DPC_EXT.



Thanking you

Vengaiah
title:
Re:SAP Gateway and Simple Field Extensibility - does it work with append
views?

author: Valentin Huber
text:
Hi Vengaiah,



Thanks for your reply! As I understand it with Simple Field Extensibility it
should **not** be necessary to manually add the field as a new Property to the
Entity Type.



The scenario I'm interested in is that of product development: If we create a
new application and ship some OData Service implementations, will a customer
be able to add new Properties without having to redefine the Service?



Regards,

Valentin
title:
Re:SAP Gateway and Simple Field Extensibility - does it work with append
views?

author: Vengaiah Chowdary Pachava Chinna
text:
Hi Valentin,



I have created service and done redifintion of the define method in *MPC_EXT
Class and included a statement.



lo_entity_type->ADD_AUTO_EXPAND_INCLUDE( iv_include_name = '<yourAbap
Structure name>'

 iv_bind_conversions = 'X' ).

  

Now without changing the properties, my Model has been appended in the
service.

  

Please let me know if have any queries.

  

Thanking you

Vengaiah
title:
Re:SAP Gateway and Simple Field Extensibility - does it work with append
views?

author: Valentin Huber
text:
Hi Vengaiah,



Thanks to your proposal I was able to make it work as well. I assumed that
with the Simple Field Extensibility feature it is sufficient to just add the
append. However, one more step is needed, as pointed out by you.



To summarize: if a customer likes to enhance an Entity Type in a Service with
custom fields, the following steps are needed:

\- add a table or view append in the customer namespace (as usual with
enhancing tables/views)

\- take a look at the provided Service implementation classes

\- if the define method is not redefined in the model provider extension class
(as I would expect it in most cases), create an implicit enhancement on the
model provider class' define method to add code as last step in the define
method. Use the following code snippet as starting point:



method DEFINE.  
*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*  
*& Generated code for the MODEL PROVIDER BASE CLASS &*  
*& &*  
*& !!!NEVER MODIFY THIS CLASS. IN CASE YOU WANT TO CHANGE THE MODEL &*  
*& DO THIS IN THE MODEL PROVIDER SUBCLASS!!! &*  
*& &*  
*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*  
  
model->set_schema_namespace( <technical service name> ).  
  
define_loss( ).

  
""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""
"""""""""""""""$"$\SE:(1) Klasse <model provider class>, Methode DEFINE,
Ende
A  
*$*$-Start: (1)---------------------------------------------------------------------------------$*$*  
ENHANCEMENT 1 <your enhancement impl. name>. "active version  
  
 " Configure the Entity Type such that it automatically includes  
 " the fields from the append <name of your custom append
structure>. The Entity Data  
 " Model in the Service Builder doesn't show the new field.

 " The metadata document will, however, show the new fields.  
  
 DATA(lo_entity_type_to_extend) = model->get_entity_type( <the
entity type name> ).  
  
 lo_entity_type_to_extend->add_auto_expand_include(  
 iv_include_name = <name of your custom append
structure>  
 iv_bind_conversions = abap_true  
 ).  
  
ENDENHANCEMENT.  
*$*$-End: (1)---------------------------------------------------------------------------------$*$*

  
 endmethod.

  

  

\- if the define method is redefined in the model provider extension class,
add an implicit enhancement in the redefinition
title:
Re:SAP Gateway and Simple Field Extensibility - does it work with append
views?

author: Vengaiah Chowdary Pachava Chinna
text:
Hi Valentin,



If you want to put your code in MPC rather than MPC_EXT. Then Customer should
not regenerate the runtime objects for the service.



Thanking you

Vengaiah

author: Gajanand Gupta
text:
Hi I am also facing the same problem and believe in the solution by gal that
due to heavy data query it is giving time out we need to edit the code for top
5 rows of flight data.



_Hi Gajanand,_



_Not sure what the problem is exactly as java.net.SocketTimeoutException can
be caused by a few reasons._

_You may want to try to filter or use the top system query option in order to
reduce the number of entries retrieved. I've seen cases where Android (at
least in the default config) cannot deal with a very large number of records
and throws this exception as a result._

_Another suggestion I have is to clear the AVD or create a new AVD instance
and see if the problem persists there._



_Best regards,_

_Gal_



I am creating my own NW gateway server and working on code also so that i can
do all changes at my level at server as well as code.



Regards

Gajanand Gupta
title:
Re:I cant loggin an application(android) using the sap netweaver gateway DEMO
credentials

author: Guido Falcucci
text:
**_Gaja__nan__d_**,



That was exactly the problem. In order to check it I debug the URL of the
query.

You can obtain this URL by debugging the sentence:



**String url = getIntent().getStringExtra(RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT_2Application.NAVIGATION_URL);**

**  
**

This sentence is found in the Page1ListActivity.java in the method onCreate().

If you copy the URL on the browser you will see that there is no response. If
you add to this URL the following text: ?$top=3

(Top System Query Option as Gal suggested), you will see you get response.

You can test the app rapidly by appending that text to the url String:

  

**String url = getIntent().getStringExtra(RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT_2Application.NAVIGATION_URL);**

**url+="?$top=3";**



Thank's!**  
**

OData node activation after SP upgrade
text:
Dear All,



Recently i have updated my Gateway Server SP from 02 to 03.In SP02, we used
the node sdata under opu.All the services were created under the sdata.



After upgrade odata node is added under opu and it is in the inactive mode.



I want to know the following

 is there any prerequisites for activating the odata after upgrade

 How to access the existing service created under sdata through odata url



Regards,

Satish
author: Satish Kumar
Jibin Joy
text:
Hi Satish,



I never faced this scenario but based on my experience i can explain u .....



 Case 1 :  is there any prerequisites for activating the odata after upgrade



 - I think u have to activate opu node and its child.

 - Check whether Gateway is active or not if not activate it .

 - Manage SAP system Aliases

 - In /iwfnd/maint_service Tcode , activate and maintain ur service.



 Case 2 : How to access the existing service created under sdata through
odata url

  

 - under service catalog u can see ICF nodes (as in image)

  

[![Activated Service.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage
/2-13634566-152737/450-74/Activated+Service.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/J
iveServlet/showImage/2-13634566-152737/Activated+Service.PNG)

\- select ur service then corresponding ICF Nodes will be shown .

\- activate ICF node for Odata Node for OData channel ( it will use Odata
Lib).

\- else activate ICF node for SDATA Node for generic channel ( it will use
SDATA Lib).



Hope It will work



Regards ,

Jibin Joy

Hi Martin,

I don't believe it is an issue with escaping the url. First off I believe the
logical operators eq,le,ge etc all have to be lowercase.



Second while debugging i saw there needs to be a suffix appended to number
values

m or M for Decimal

d or D for Double

l or L for Int64

else the value is incorrectly parsed as an int32 and an exception is thrown



not sure why. but you can see for yourself

/IWCOR/CL_DS_EDM_SIMPLE_TYPE->PARSE_URI_LITERAL



eg the following works in gateway

[http://services.odata.org/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Order_Details?$filter=UnitP
rice ge 13.5000m](http://services.odata.org/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Order_Deta
ils?%24filter=UnitPrice%20ge%2013.5000m)



Whilst it works, I cannot help but think this isn't supported in the popular
OData client libraries!



UPDATE:

just saw this - "Literal representation of primitive types must be used in
OData URI" [source: [OData in SAP NetWeaver Gateway - Feature Overview](http:/
/help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp05/helpdata/en/d8/5d033b8edf439f9897c4e546363
d78/content.htm) ]



For a full list see
<http://www.odata.org/documentation/overview#AbstractTypeSystem>  





cheers

John P
title: Re:how to escape a dot in a query URL?qu

author: Martin Fischer
text:
Hi John,



we also found out that it didn't work because of the missing "m" Suffix. I
forgot to update the thread here.



Thanks and regards,

Martin
title: Re:how to escape a dot in a query URL?qu
Problem with configuration of Gateway demosystem
text:
Hello,



I have installed NW702GW (from SDN) and configured. Now I am facing the
following problems:



1\. When I try the url [http://nw702gw:8000/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/RMTSAMPLEFLIGH
T/?$format=xml](http://nw702gw:8000/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT/?%24fo
rmat=xml) I receive the error message "/IWFND/CM_MGW/053 no customizing
available"



2\. While I can use the ES Workplace as a destination in Eclipse, my local
installation refuses to work as a destination. Error message: connection
refused.



Can anybody provide some hints?



With kind regards,



Thomas Bayer
author: Thomas Bayer
Stephen Kringas
text:
Hi Thomas,



For point 1 -



I had the same issue and the solution from Michael Bram worked for me:



"In transaction /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE I had to map a "System Alias" to the
Service (just used "LOCAL").Then it works."



<http://scn.sap.com/community/netweaver-gateway/blog/2012/05/16/now-available-
sap-netweaver-abap-trial-702-sp11-win-64-bit-version-with-sap-netweaver-
gateway-20-sp3>



Cheers,

Stephen
title: Re:Problem with configuration of Gateway demosystem
How to Create 'CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY' for create operation in SEGW
text:
Hi Experts,

 Am trying to create a sale order with item in **SEGW**. While click on
post in **REST** client am facing the following error





**'**| **..ERROR_INFO**| **Method 'CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY' not implemented in data provider class**  
---|---|---  
  


How to implement the **CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY **method in SEGW transaction.
author: Swethun V
Lukasz Grochal
text:
You need to redefine method /IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY
in your xxxxx_DPC_EXT class that was generated for you by SEGW. You can find
this method under inherited methods in that class.
title: Re:How to Create 'CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY' for create operation in SEGW
Upload a .DTD file to validate XML file using if_ixml_parser->parse() method

given file for DTD validation."

I tried putting the DTD file on application server at destination (as per some

/usr/sap/<SAPSID>/DVEBMGS$$/j2ee/cluster/server0

Please help!!

author: Ninad Mehta

title: Error when executing Gateway service
text:
Hi,



I have created an OData service using the standard BOR object **Flight** and
doing the implementation using the method **Flight.Getlist. **This method does
not have any mandatory input parameters therefore I am also not passing any
input parameters and just reading the data returned in its export parameter
**FLIGHT_LIST**. The implementation of the entity set has been done using this
method (as mentioned above) of the BOR object.



When testing the service the OData Service document and the Metadata XML are
generated correctly. However when i test the collection through the Gateway
client (/IWFND/GW_CLIENT) or Explore Service function (In Maintain service
option via SEGW) i am getting an **HTTP 500 error (Internal Server Error)**.



**Details of the Error Log**

**A parameter has an invalid value: Parameter <VALUE> has the invalid value 735116.**



**Details of the Application Log**

**1\. Exception of type CX_PARAMETER_INVALID_RANGE has occurred. See details for more information**

The details provided are** "A parameter has an invalid value: Parameter
<VALUE> has the invalid value 7 35116."**

**  
**

**2\. Exception of type /IWCOR/CX_DS_INTERNAL_ERROR has occurred. See details for more information**

The details provided are **"In the context of Data Services an unknown
internal server error occurred."**

**  
**

I am not passing any parameters therefore am unable to figure out which
parameter is causing this error.



Need the help of the experts out there to resolve this issue.



regards

Nitesh
author: Nitesh Jain
Jibin Joy
text:
Hi Nitesh,

 Can u post ur $metadata Document for this service and if possible
mention for which entity and properties this error coming.



Error Information.

 This Type of error occur when there is an invalid format or out of range
for a value.



for example :

 Employee date

 "2 001021" - Invalid format (it should be 8 digit )  

 "20001321" - out of range (wrong month : 13)



and some other restriction for other data type



Regards,

Jibin Joy
title: Re:Error when executing Gateway service

author: Nitesh Jain
text:
Hi Jibin,



Thanks for your response. The issue was with the 'DATE' data type fields
however the reason was slightly different. The conversion of the ABAP type to
the EDM data type was not being done correctly when the entity was created
w.r.t. the BOR method interface parameter.



We were on IW_BEP SP05 and therefore had to implement the notes 1763390 and
1780498. Further to implement the service from the BOR method without errors i
had to implement the note 1790618 and its prerequisite note 1788265.



Hope this helps others setting up the Gateway installation. With the
experience i have had in the last few days would recommend to implement the
latest SPs of the Gateway components and as far as possible always try to keep
them up to date.



regards

Nitesh
title: Re:Error when executing Gateway service
Regarding Sap netweaver gateway services
text:
Previously i worked on ABAP only. Now i joined with new organization. Here I
have supposed to work on Netweaver gateway services. So how about the my
career in future, and i am new to sap netweaver technology. Can any guide me.
author: Suman P
Nitesh Jain
text:
It will be a nice add-on on your CV considering 'Enterprise Mobility' is the
future and the gateway middleware will be an integral part of the Mobility
framework. Knowing ABAP, reusing existing business functionality or creating a
new one in the gateway service implementation will be advantageous for you.
However the caution is the ABAP developments will be only be restricted to
requirements as a Data provider only.
title: Re:Regarding Sap netweaver gateway services

Access to restricted URI denied
text:
Hello all,



I am trying to access a gateway service from javascript using datajs.



When I execute my demo application in Internet Explorer everything works fine,
but when I try using Firefox my javascript function returns the following
error message: **"Access to restricted URI denied"**.



Is / Was anyone else confronted with this problem? It looks like a browser
issue?



Thanks in advance and best regards,

Alej
author: Alejiandro Sensejl
Samuli Kaski
text:
What is your Javascript function doing? Share the code. Firefox is usually
more security aware than IE.
title: Re:Access to restricted URI denied

author: Alejiandro Sensejl
text:
This should be the relevant part of my application:



    
    
    ...
    <script src="javascript/datajs-1.1.0.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    ...
    <script type="text/javascript">
    ...
    function fetchData() {
     OData.read( 
     { requestUri: "...", user: "...", password: "...", },
     function (data) {
     ...
     }, 
     function (err) {
     alert(err.message);
     }
     );
     ...
    }
    ... 
    </script>
    ...



The error is returned in line 14, see alert(err.message).

After some further research it looks like I have problems with the same origin
policy (see <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Same_origin_policy>) since my
application tries to call an OData channel of a foreign SAP system.



Is there any server-side configuration (ICM?) required to bypass this
limitation?

I have already found some threads that recommend using a proxy server, but I'd
like to avoid that.



Best regards,

Alej
title: Re:Access to restricted URI denied

Hi All,



Debugging revealed that there is an issue in the service implementation using
the 'Map to Data Source' option to a BAPI method.



In my case the ABAP code generated automatically in the Method <Entity
type>_GET_ENTITY in my BASE class for mapping key fields had ONE key field
missing. This bug is there in a specific scenario which is currently unknown
to me.



I created a new project, maintained the respective objects as before and now
the key predicates are working correctly.



Anyone using referential constraints in their project kindly check the code in
the Base class in case you get errors!!!



I will post this bug in OSS and have SAP look at it.



regards

Nitesh

title: Re:Unable to populate complex entity type

author: Iwan Santoso
text:
Hi Jibin,



I was following the tutorial mentioned in the first post, so I did not use
SEGW. I created a new service using SEGW and it works, I did look into
generated class and found out that in the tutorial, iv_abap_fieldname is not
listed in the code when defining complex type within entity type, but it is
generated by SEGW.



I added iv_abap_fieldname to my complex type field:



lo_complex_type = lo_entity_type->create_complex_property( iv_property_name
= 'CustDet'  
iv_complex_type_name = 'CustomerDetails'  
 **iv_abap_fieldname = 'CUSTDETAIILS' **).  

And it is now populated correctly.

title: Getting data from SAP backend into Gateway Hub
text:
Dear all,



I am new to Netweaver Gateway. In my landscape the IWBEP component has been
installed in the Gateway Hub system. In my custom OData service i want to get
the data from my backend SAP ERP system using a BAPI.



I have created my custom OData service with the relevant components and have
implemented the service using the BAPI method. While implementing the service
i referred to the BAPI method from the SAP ERP backend system using the RFC
destination (ABAP connection i.e. connection type 3) to the SAP ERP system
created in my Gateway hub.



Now when i test the service, the service document and metadata XML are
generated correctly. However when i test the entity set, i find that the data
is NOT being extracted from the SAP ERP backend system.



What configuration/settings need to be maintained in the custom OData service
so that the service refers to the correct SAP backend system? How does the
gateway service determine from which system it should extract the data?



regards

Nitesh
author: Nitesh Jain
Nitesh Jain
text:
Dear all,



Further correspondence with an expert has revealed that to consume a BOR
method successfully at run time from an SAP backend system (ERP in my case) it
is mandatory to install the component IW_BEP in the backend system. Please
note this is run time requirement and not a design time requirement.



Personally i am not satisfied with this framework requirement but cannot do
much about it. A workaround is possible but that has its own overheads.



regards

Nitesh
title: Re:Getting data from SAP backend into Gateway Hub

regards

regards

Issue with URI when using Key predicates and filter option together with
Navigation
text:
Hi all,



I am trying to execute the following URI



[http://<server>/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists('TF4CKF3
')?$filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelListPOListNAV](http://%3cserver%3e
/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'\)?%24filter=OrderSt
atus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelListPOListNAV)



but i am getting the error **Left hand expression of memberaccess operator
invalid . **This error is being issued by the component OPU-FND-CCL.

** **

Details of above link:

  * **VEHICLEAVAIL** is my external service name
  * **SalesModelLists** is my entity set name which has one property as key which is being passed as the key predicate
  * OrderStatus is a property of the SalesModelLists which I want to pass as a filter. This property has the attribute filter marked in the entity.
  * SalesModelListPOListNAV is the navigation from entity SalesModelList to another entity POList



Note: without the filter the URI executes correctly and returns the results.



Not sure the filter option has been placed correctly in the URI. Please
suggest.



Regards

Nitesh
author: Nitesh Jain
Jibin Joy
text:
Hi Nitesh ,



Filter is applied for the parent entity for example

[SalesModelLists('TF4CKF3')](http://%3Cserver%3E/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAI
L/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'\)?%24filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelList
POListNAV)$filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'

here filter is for [SalesModelLists](http://%3Cserver%3E/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEH
ICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'\)?%24filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesM
odelListPOListNAV)



or if the URL is

[SalesModelLists('TF4CKF3')](http://%3Cserver%3E/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAI
L/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'\)?%24filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelList
POListNAV)[/SalesModelListPOListNAV](http://%3Cserver%3E/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEH
ICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'\)?%24filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesM
odelListPOListNAV)

then filter is for pointing entity-set by navigation [SalesModelListPOListNAV]
(http://%3Cserver%3E/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'
\)?%24filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelListPOListNAV)





[http://<server>/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists('TF4CKF3
')?$filter=OrderStatus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelListPOListNAV](http://%3Cserver%3E
/sap/opu/odata/sap/VEHICLEAVAIL/SalesModelLists\('TF4CKF3'\)?%24filter=OrderSt
atus%20eq%20'S'/SalesModelListPOListNAV)

and the above URL conversation is wrong one based on odata URL convention

plz ref below link

<http://www.odata.org/documentation/odata-v2-documentation/uri-
conventions/#45_Filter_System_Query_Option_filter>





Regards,

Jibin Joy
title:
Re:Issue with URI when using Key predicates and filter option together with
Navigation

Application not connecting to Gateway system
text:
Hello,



I have developed an HTML & Javascript application to consume a NetWeaver
Gateway service, based on the below tutorial:

[http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/scn/go/portal/prtroot/docs/library/uuid/505619a7
-73bf-2e10-fe96-da9a86b23120?QuickLink=index&overridelayout=true&52239
688165884](http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/scn/go/portal/prtroot/docs/library/uuid/
505619a7-73bf-
2e10-fe96-da9a86b23120?QuickLink=index&overridelayout=true&52239688165884)



I have hosted the HTML & Javascript files on the same server as the
Gateway system(using remote desktop). So I should not need a Web server
configured as a reverse proxy.



However, on running the HTML application on the Gateway server, it gives the
following error:



_XMLHttpRequest cannot load <http://><GW server host>:<GW server
port>/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_=100&sap-user=*****&sap-password=***&amp
;sap-language=EN. Origin null is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Origin._



However, the url in itself works fine and shows the Gateway service response
in a browser.



Any inputs on what may be missing?

Is there some configuration on the Gateway system that prevents it from
sending data back to the HTML app?



Regards,

Sudeep
author: Sudeep Sura
John Patterson
text:
Hi Sudeep



Is the JavaScript hosted from the same port as the Gateway services?



For two resources to be considered to have the same origin, the protocols
(http/https), the domain and the port (eg 80XX) have to be identical.



eg _[http://](/message/http:)<GW server host>:<GW server
port>/<js resources>_

__  
__

hth

John P
title: Re:Application not connecting to Gateway system

author: Sudeep Sura
text:
Hi John,



The gateway services are hosted on port 5000, whereas the JS & HTML files
are stored locally on the server desktop. I invoke the app using the local
HTML file in browser as below:

_'C:\Users\\*******\Downloads\UserDataApp.html'_



So how do I invoke the HTML & JS files on the same port? A Web-server or
some other mechanism?



Regards,

Sudeep
title: Re:Application not connecting to Gateway system

author: John Patterson
text:
Sudeep

If your Gateway services are ABAP based and you have developer access, you can

\- embed your HTML file in a BSP application

\- host content in mime repository



Cheers

John P
title: Re:Application not connecting to Gateway system

author: Sudeep Sura
text:
Thanks John. These pointers helped me resolve the same origin issue.



Regards,

Sudeep
title: Re:Application not connecting to Gateway system
How to erase cache/session SAP Gateway (iOS)?
text:
**Are there any methods that can be called from our SAP Gateway application to not generate a session when user does the login, or logout when the user exit of the application?**





We have created an application for iOS and Android devices using SAP Gateway.
The connections code has been generated with the tools provided by SAP for
Eclipse and Xcode.



Both Android and iOS have a screen on which the user does the login before
accessing the data provided by the application.



When user introduce user and password we validate login with the SAP Gateway
and if the login is correct we allow it access to the data of the application.
The problem comes when once user have successfully logged and return back to
the login screen and enter a another user with any password, the SAP Gateway
system responds that user exists without validating username and password and
shows their data. This error only occurs in the iOS app in Android works fine.



We have found that the SAP Gateway generates a session associated with the
user and terminal of the first time that user does login. Thus when user login
again with another user the SAP Gateway system really doesn't check user and
password and we found with an SAP Gateway open session. The application
doesn't call any method to save the connection cache on the phone and we
ignore the connection cache.



Thank you very much!
author: David Jardon Peinado
Matthias Bucher
text:
Hello,



iOS clients are not my daily business but in general, ODATA is provided by
http requests from ERP backend. Thus, also session handling and logon is
maintained there. You may check in this backend with transaction SICF,
services under /sap/opu/...



Here, you may find information how to set up logon/session handling ...

<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp05/helpdata/en/c3/424a2657aa4cf58df949
578a56ba80/frameset.htm>



Regards & good luck,

Matthias
title: Re:How to erase cache/session SAP Gateway (iOS)?

author: David Jardon Peinado
text:
**Thank you Matthias!**



I thought that would be the solution, but I wanted to think that would not
open a Gateway session without giving the possibility to control it from the
application. I find it quite dangerous to the security of our system and the
consistency of our mobile application.



In the link that you recommend me I've found this information:



<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp05/helpdata/en/3d/45e259b4bd49e197316c
bfd3c7fa8e/content.htm>
title: Re:How to erase cache/session SAP Gateway (iOS)?

author: Matthias Bucher
text:
Hello David,



as you said, changing (global) backend behaviour may the generic way to solve
this but not the best.



May be the connection code you've generated with SAP Tools in Eclipse supply
parameters which are not used by code generator. Code generators are ok for a
quick run but bad for understanding the whole picture or in case of errors.



Maybe cache/session handling can be influenced by URL parameters or http
header in your client app. For this you may analyse the ABAP sided http
handler for ODATA streams like SE24 class /IWFND/CL_SODATA_HTTP_HANDLER if
there are some usable parameters.



Good luck :-)

Matthias
title: Re:How to erase cache/session SAP Gateway (iOS)?

author: Daniel Rothmund
text:
Hi David  
Have you found a solution , I have the same problem but with IE9 . With Chrome
it works , the IE9 always cache my gateway requests. And so I have always old
data ...



regards



Daniel

How will generated Gateway consumers be aligned to Production environment?
text:
Hi Gatekeepers,



I've been getting to grips with the Eclipse plug-in(s) for Gateway. Already
confused as the previous and current plugin versions are packaged differently,
so I ended up with a few duplicate feature names but different look & feel
in Eclipse depending on the one I picked.



What I did notice in common with both application builder versions is that
they hardcode(?) the **absolute service address** into the application
package.



[![address.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1413835
7-233628/624-68/address.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage
/2-14138357-233628/address.PNG)

That leads to a few problems:

1 - it may not allow my development GW address if I am running the SDK on
localhost due to Same Origin policy error. In which case I need a reverse
proxy address as the service address (not tried this) or I need to manually
edit the stored location (as done above).

2 - if I am sharing this project to other development bodies, they may have a
different proxy defined if using localhost.

3 - when this is deployed to a SAP AS and served from there, what happens when
it needs to be transported through to PRD? How do we re-route the service
call?



The address value is stored in 'connectivity.js' in the Webcontent hierarchy.
It is therefore technically viable to edit it in a target environment after
loading. Is this the procedure for carrying out such a change? I'm not a
Jscript or Web developer by trade so I don't know if this is a normal
expectation with a standard cutover activity when the transport package is a
web related offering.



I was expecting something more like a property list in a bundle where the
protocol, server, port and service node are maintained separately. This would
then be an in-system configuration which is maintained by web/Basis admin.



Not going to be transporting any time soon but it would be nice to head off
any tricky obstacles like this.



Regards



Ron Sargeant.

title: Re:Update/Create entityset

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
OData does not support multiple entity creation via a collection. Entities are
created one at a time, either singly or as deep inserts.

The closest you will come to creating a collection in one 'operation' is to
place the entities inline in body of a "$batch"-ed POST.

Keep Simple Things Simple.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/cool.gif)
title: Re:Update/Create entityset
Odata Create/Post Method Issue
author: Uday M
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Uday,



If you are able to GET an entity, generally there should be no issues POST-ing
to the same entity template as long as you body is correct.



I think we need more information about the data provider implementation
details as that is not mentioned.

I don't think creating OData services via SE80 is the best way to go as it
only really exposes a small portion of the actual service. I've never used it,
it's horrible!

If you have SP04 or higher I would suggest using the Gateway Service Builder
instead. You get a lot more transparency with services methods that you write
than the ones that use RFC modules.

Gateway services based on RFC function modules.



My colleague Volker Drees has pointed 3 new blog's that show to do it with the
Servcie Builder:

title: Re:Missing How To Guide

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Have to agree with Andre. RFC fits a lot of people's comfort zone and they
immediately gravitate towards that option.

But it is outdated and quite awkward to work with. It's very much an inside-
out development process (fitting your resource model to BAPI that is not a
resource model) , whereas I find the outside-in approach much more efficient
(build a resource model abstract with a resource based implementation).



Learn to use the Service Builder, once you get to grips with it, development
of services is much faster.

Gateway Service Builder. Complex Types.
text:
Hi,



I'm new to gateway services. I have a question regarding Complex Types.



My initial idea was to create a table where each field is a table. But it
didn't work.

Is it possible to pass multiple tables in one Service? (E.g table-
1SalesOrder header fields table item fields table

 2SalesOrder header fields table item fields table )



Thanks in advance!
author: Anna Logunova
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Anna,



Gateway complex types are simply compound types, i.e. comprised of scalar
types. They allow you to describe a pattern that can be reused in entities. An
address complex type is a good example.



The Gateway design abstract only supports flat structures, you cannot design a
'deep' entity. In order to obtain what you are looking for, such as sales
order and items, you need to implement both as separate entities. You then
establish a relation between them by an association and provide a navigation
path by adding the association as a navigation property to the parent
("header" entity).

Once this has been done, the client can request the order and its items in one
feed by using the $expand system query option.

Conversely, the client can also create a sales order header and items if a
deep insert method is implemented.

My advice is to concentrate on the simple entities first to become familiar
with concepts and practical building, then work up to the more complex
features. Hopefully, knowing these are possible will prevent you worrying that
you are wasting time or that Gateway is not able to do certain things. We have
to start thinking differently when it comes to Gateway.



Regards



Ron Sargeant
title: Re:Gateway Service Builder. Complex Types.

author: Anna Logunova
text:
Thanks a lot for your reply.

Now my doubts regarding only flat structures support are dispelled.



Regards,

Anna.
title: Re:Gateway Service Builder. Complex Types.

How to Create Multiple records for one collection
text:
Hi Experts,



 I need to create multiple records for one **collection**.(ie) It's
not like a Sales order (Header & Item).



Its a custom application just am inserting into a Custom table.When am trying
to create using **create** operation in **SEGW** its taking only one record.





Am trying wtih **Z***CL_DPC_EXT** also, Its not triggering when am giving a
**POST**.





Thanks in advance



Regards,

Myil
author: Myilraja Arumugam
Steffen Froehlich
text:
Hi Myil,



maybe you need to use $batch parameter. See an example here:
<http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-29682>



You need to redefine method CHANGESET_BEGIN and CHANGESET_END. You find these
methods in interface /IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME of class Z***CL_DPC.





\--

Steffen
title: Re:How to Create Multiple records for one collection

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Steffen is right, you have to use a $batch body - insert a POST for each
entity into the body and POST the body with the $batch option. That is the
reason why there is no CREATE_ENTITYSET method.



You only need to redefine the changeset methods if there is any particular
logic you need to invoke before or after. Be aware that you should not COMMIT
WORK on any of the insertions, the changeset processing doesn't like it, and
should do it for you anyway at the end of the LUW.

  
Regards



RS.
title: Re:How to Create Multiple records for one collection
Navigation Properties and the $orderby command
text:
Hi All



I am trying to sort results using a Gateway OData Service as follows:



<http://><hostname>:<port>/sap/opu/odata/sap/<Service>/Mater
ialHeaderSet('ABC')/NP_MatlHeader_SOItem?$expand=NP_SOHeader&$orderby=NP_S
OHeader/DocumentDate%20desc,OrderId%20desc&area=SP&sap-ds-debug=true



Which means:

a) Find me all the Sales Order Items that are for Material 'ABC' using the
Navigation Property 'NP_MatlHeader_SOItem' (Material Header to Sales Order
Item using the Property of Material (MATNR) that is common to both MatlHeader
and SOItem).

b) Expand to the Sales Order Header using the Navigation Property
'NP_SOHeader' (Sales Order Item to Sales Order Header using the property of
OrderId (VBELN) that is common to both SOItem and SOHeader).

c) Order the results using the Properties of 'DocumentDate' (in Descending
order) and 'OrderId' (in Descending order) which are contained in the Entity
SOHeader and can be navigated to using the Navigation Property 'NP_SOHeader'.



The issue I have is that I get the following response:



##### Navigationproperties are not supported in ABAP select options



So the Gateway Framework does not support the use of Navigation Properties for
specification of the $orderby command. The exception is thrown at the
following point in the Gateway Framework:



Exception /IWCOR/CX_DS_INTERNAL_ERROR occurred in Class
/IWFND/CL_SODATA_PROCESSOR Method EXPR_NODE_TO_PROPERTY_PATH and Line 26



If I try this same command on public OData services such as Northwind, it
works fine. The business requirement behind the query (explained in points
A-C above) is not unusual, indeed quite common.



Does anyone have suggestions about how I might be able to implement a solution
for this?



Thanks very much for your consideration of my question.



Tony
author: Tony Duncan
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Tony,



In theory everything that you could do in the official OData protocol should
be implemented in Gateway, but it's not all there yet. For example, you could
not, until recently, make an update to a resource without addressing it
canonically. There is still no support for custom parameters either.

I've tried a similar and simpler URI and get the same error so it is
definitely the framework blocking this. This looks like a bug: if the message
is correct, it should have nothing to do with select-options as they are
related to the use of $filter.

You are probably best served by writing a function import to do this, although
I consider that a last resort as it is by no means as flexible the use of
query options.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Navigation Properties and the $orderby command

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Had a further look at it and there is a pattern emerging. Gateway doesn't
really manage the navigation context very well; generally it is aware of the
predecessor and current entity nodes but once you start going down a third
level or more, it starts to lose it's way. At least that has been my
observation.

What you have encountered here is a similar cross-context issue. You are
leading in with one entity, expanding the navigation set, then asking to
orderby, but doing so in the navigation set rather than the 'lead' set. The
ABAP doesn't have a processing path for that - it requires a temporary context
shift that it cannot support. I've had the same problem with something I am
developing - I think this is only going to be solved once SAP get the
implementors of /IWBEP/IF_MGW_REQ_ENTITYSET right. It's going in the right
direction but it is too "closed" - I would like to be able to create my own
sub-request (easily).
title: Re:Navigation Properties and the $orderby command

author: Tony Duncan
text:
Thanks for your prompt response Ron. I have come across several situations
that do not seem right and was wondering if I had the wrong end of the stick
or was finding a pattern.



I note that I also have problems with:

**A) Filter on Expanded Entity**

<http://><host>:<port>/sap/opu/odata/sap/<service>/MaterialH
eaderSet('ABC')/NP_MatlHeader_SOItem?$expand=NP_SOHeader&$filter=substring
of('335',NP_SOHeader/OrderId)&area=SP&sap-ds-debug=true

  

**Browser Result**

Returns Sales Orders that includes all Sales Orders Lines (and expand to SO
Headers) where MATNR = 'ABC', however the Filter to only return
SOHeader/OrderId = '335' is being ignored.

Upon debugging the issue is that:

a) all SOItems where MATNR 'ABC' are found, then;

b) all SOHeaders relevant to SOItems in above step are found.

c) there is no facility to reduce the number of SOItems returned to only take
account of those where SOHeader/OrderId = '335'.



B) Case Insensitive Searches

<http://><host>:<port>/sap/opu/odata/sap/<service>/SOHeaderS
et?$inlinecount=allpages&$skip=0&$top=50&$filter=substringof('tEst
',CustomerPONumber)&$select=OrderId,DocumentDate,CustomerPONumber,Customer
,DocumentType,YourRef&sap-ds-debug=true#sec1



The field BSTNK (CustomerPONumber) on VBAK is recorded in whatever case it was
entered. Changing the above text 'tEst' to 'test' it works, so the problem is
that it's passed as CP *tEst* yet VBAK-BSTNK has entries for *Test* *TEST* but
not *tEst*.
title: Re:Navigation Properties and the $orderby command

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Tony,



Filters are tricky as they are implemented in ABAP but defined in the model.
Currently the OData implementation is a bit loose in that you can request a
filter on any property of an entity.

There is a "requires filter" property but this is not enforced by the OData
handler. I think it should be, then we can write ABAP that fits the expected
filters.

So don't expect "any old filter" to work as the OData framework does not
actually do the filtering, i.e. it's not an intrinsic query option that
requires no BEP logic.



With regard to the case-insensitive searching, that is old as the hills in SAP
and not restricted to Gateway. It's an ABAP problem.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Navigation Properties and the $orderby command

author: Tony Duncan
text:
Thanks Ron.



Agreed the case-insensitive searching is an ABAP problem and Gateway is only
highlighting that as typically users do not care what case they used.



Could you perhaps send me a Direct Message?



Cheers



Tony
title: Re:Navigation Properties and the $orderby command
MAP TO DATA SOUCE ODATA SERVICE RE-MAP a FUNCTION MODULE
text:
Hey all,



for a project I've to create various odata services and map different RFC
Function Modules.



So the Gateway SEGW is not dealing very good with different in / output types
of the RFC Funtion Modules, so I build Wrapper Function Modules and try to
convert, lets say STRING --> DATS and in return DATS --> String.



The Problem is I have to delete and RE MAP the Function Module all over again,
if I change some Type Declaration of the Function Module like:



[![sddg.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-14244611-2
54961/450-209/sddg.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14
244611-254961/sddg.jpg)



Did anybody know how to remap the RFC without delete and setup everything
again???



Greetings





David
author: David Schenke
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi David,



I would advise you to drop the mapping approach as it's the old way of doing
things, without IW_BEP.

Write the service in IW_BEP terms, i.e. use SEGW to produce a data model then
generate the data and model providers. Within the generated DPC_EXT methods
you can link to your function modules (or the wrappers) and map data more
easily.



Regards



RS
title: Re:MAP TO DATA SOUCE ODATA SERVICE RE-MAP a FUNCTION MODULE

author: David Schenke
text:
Hey Ron,



thanks for your reply. I'll keep that in mind when I go deeper into the
service creation.



Thanks david

title: Service to Return a Structure
text:
I've created a gateway service based on a function module.



It returns values in the READ operation based on the primary key.



It returns several structures and some of those structures have several
entries- for instance appointments.



It will only return one appointment no matter how many entries there are.



I was hoping for all the appointment records to be in a nested XML structure
that I can bind to table rows.



I know this is possible, I'm just not sure of the method. Can someone describe
the process to me?



Thanks.
author: Ryan GodFrey
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Ryan,



You are modelling from inside out (based on a RFC interface) rather than
outside in (what data does your resource present?).



In your case you have a parent entity that has appointment entities. You
should therefore define both as entities in the model and provide an
association between the two. Generate the DPC and then redefine the access
method implementations for the parent (get_entity) and child set
(get_entityset). Then you can simply read the collection of appointments from
a given parent key.



The use of RFC mapping to multiple sets is old school and it can be done but
it's not very flexible or non-disruptive.



Check out Andre Fisher's guide here:
[http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/scn/go/portal/prtroot/docs/library/uuid/f0efbaca-
45ba-3010-b7bb-8c1c5aa109ab?QuickLink=index&overridelayout=true&584759
79909212](http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/scn/go/portal/prtroot/docs/library/uuid
/f0efbaca-45ba-3010-b7bb-
8c1c5aa109ab?QuickLink=index&overridelayout=true&58475979909212)
title: Re:Service to Return a Structure

Error Handling through SAP Gateway
text:
Reopening the issue.



reference to a similar issue <http://scn.sap.com/thread/3343754>



Hi,



I did raise the exception in my RFC FM as suggested in another discussion
(ref. link given above) . But the Gateway service ran into errors without
even creating the record in backend.



Let me explain my scenario in detail.



I have a Gateway System connected to SolMan. The OData services are consumed
by sharepoint. Its a complete Z Solution in SolMan so an RFC is consumed by
the service. The Create service is called from sharepoint application and the
record got created successfully in SolMan. However,GW system is unable to
catch the return message and throws an exception/iwfnd/cx_mgw_tech_exception.
I debugged the entire scenario and I could see that the message is being
passed from SolMan but somehow, GW is unable to catch it.



Am I doing something wrong here ? Please let me know your inputs as I'm new to
Gateway



Regards,

Naresh
author: Naresh Kumar Margam
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Naresh,



Is there a possibility that a CATCH with has no actual handling logic has been
implemented somewhere in the call stack? If an exception is caught and not
handled, it cannot then be handled by GW as the exception will be removed form
the exception stack.



I often see this, not just in GW, where developers don't understand catching
or place it there to avoid "awkward" errors that should be handled.



regards



Ron.
title: Re:Error Handling through SAP Gateway

author: Naresh Kumar Margam
text:
Hi Ron,



Thanks for the response.

Yes, the exception needs to be caught but where do i do the coding ? Ofcourse,
it has to be in the Gateway system but where in GW ?



I tried to update the record using QUERY service call and in this case, the
system could send the Success message back to the Sharepoint application.
However, the same message is not being transferred when I use CREATE service
call. I know that updates must only be done using CREATE service call but
still I could do the update with QUERY call and the message handling was also
successful.



Regards,

Naresh

title: "Select" for non-key fields
text:
Hi experts,



jsut a short question:



I have the link

> /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZTEST/mara

to read MARA.





I know I can select a specific material with link

> /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZTEST/mara(123456789)

for material number 12345679.





Is it also possible to use non-key fields, for example

> /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZTEST/mara(MATKL='01')

to get all MARA entries with MATKL = 01?



Thanks for an update

Michael
author: Michael Fallenbchel
Swadini Sujanaranjan
text:
Hi,



Select * from Mara into your internal table.



Then read or loop the internal table with key MATKL = ' 0 '.



Hope this will help you.



Regards,

Swadini Sujanaranjan.
title: Re:"Select" for non-key fields

author: Michael Fallenbchel
text:
Sure, I know the programming part - my problem is the URL...when using non-key
fields here, I get error



> The request URI contains an invalid key predicate

Is tehre something I have to maintain in SEGW - Data Model - Entity Types so
that I can use also non key fields?
title: Re:"Select" for non-key fields

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Michael,



This would be done by (at least) two alternative means.



1) Filter your query using the OData $filter query option on the collection
set, e.g. <service>/mara?$filter=MATKL eq '0'



or



2) Create a navigation where the endpoint is only those materials with a value
of '0' for MATKL.



The latter is hardcoded, but the client would not need to know that this
material group is defined by MATKL = 0. On the other hand, if the client
wishes to query various values of MATKL, then filter is better.



Both require the requisite coding to satisfy the search, it won't happen as
part of OData parsing.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:"Select" for non-key fields
GWPA: SAP ABAP fieldname
text:
Hello All,



We can export and import models from the GW Productivity Accelerator. Great
oData modelling tool for Eclipse !

However: for the properties of an entity we can enter name, key, et cetera but
I am missing a property for entering a corresponding ABAP Field Name. When I
import a model in SEGW now, I have to check every property and change the ABAP
Field Name to a correct fieldname. Would be great if I can do that in my EDM.



Or...am I missing something and is this already possible ?



Regards,

Bert
author: Bert Deterd
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Bert,



I think you are correct in assuming that the ABAP references are not present.
I believe the GWPA OData model is taken from the service metadata, as such it
would have no access to the technical implementation details such as ABAP
structure basis and element details.

It's not unlikely that a later version will integrate with the ABAP in Eclipse
components to supplement the ABAP based definitions. However I think there is
also a move underway to promote gateway- hosted service definitions (rather
than model-from-BEP) which would be more of an outside-in approach and not
really reliant on the backend Dictionary.

The tools are improving, it's best to make the most of what we have on each
release otherwise we will be waiting forever for the perfect toolkit!



regards



Ron.
title: Re:GWPA: SAP ABAP fieldname
How to do a CREATE of sales order using transaction SEGW
text:
Hi SAP Gurus,

I am new to SAP Netweaver Gateway and would like to know the steps in using
the CREATE function of transaction SEGW. I found a lot of discussions on the
Query and Read function but I couldn't find a detailed steps on how to use the
CREATE function. Would somebody out there send me the steps for this function?
I really appreciate any body's help on this.

Thanks,

Conrad Argente
author: Conrad Argente
Ron Sargeant
text:
The basic abstract for CREATE is to read the payload, validate it, store it,
check for errors and then return the entity.



To begin, you read your payload into the return entity parameter.



**io_data_provider->read_entry_data( importing es_data = er_entity ).**



Then you can extract the data from the er_entity structure to process your new
order.



The request must sent as a POST in order to hit the CREATE method, and a body
needs to be provided.



There are examples on SCN and the SAP sites so please try searching a bit more
thoroughly ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/wink.gif) Or get in
and experiment!



Regards

  
Ron.
title: Re:How to do a CREATE of sales order using transaction SEGW

author: Conrad Argente
text:
Hi Ron,

Thanks very much for quickly replying to my question. I'll try to search for
more examples and get into the experiment part, meanwhile, I appreciate your
tip, it is indeed a nice starting point for me.

Conrad
title: Re:How to do a CREATE of sales order using transaction SEGW

Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata
text:
Hi,



I have created a RFC in ECC system. The RFC reads certain values and returns
data in three output tables. The corresponding data model has been created in
netweaver gateway.



When the portal application is trying to consume this service, it has to
specify a particular table in the odata. Thus, to get the data of the three
tables, the portal application is hitting the SAP database 3 times.



Could anyone please advise, how can we get the data for all the 3 tables in
one go.



Regards,

Jiten
author: Jiten Rajendra Barai
David Gimeno
text:
Hi Jiten,



I'm facing a similar situation. Do you finally know how to achieve that? It's
possible with SAP Gateway or it's a misunderstood of GW architecture?



Thanks in advance.



David.
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: Jiten Rajendra Barai
text:
Hi David,



This could be achieved using the READ Operation.



1\. perform the READ operation for the entity set or the collection with the
key input values.

This would provide you with the URLs for the specific tables.

2\. Using these URLs you can retrieve the individual table data.



<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw70ehp1/helpdata/en/f6/152975ec4d411aa192a0de339
ffd91/content.htm>



Thanks,

Jiten
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: David Gimeno
text:
Thanks Jiten,



we are able to get several tables data using $expand, but (as we are using
"Map To Data Source" in get_entity operation) Gateway is calling the RFC one
time for each table. What we need (for performance reasons) is to get
information of all RFC tables at one single call.



I think that it might be possible using GET_EXPANDED_ENTITY but i'm not sure
about it and I want to find another "standard" solution.





Regards,
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: Jiten Rajendra Barai
text:
Hi David,



Yes, the RFC would be called once for each of the tables - i.e. multiple calls
to the same RFC.



$expand would be effective only when the method GET_EXPANDED_ENTITY and
GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET have been implemented.



GET_EXPANDED_ENTITY and GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET could be useful to retrieve
inline data (or nested table data)



I will try to explain with the example of Sales Orders. Lets say we want to
write an RFC that retrieves Sales Orders related data based on certain input
criteria.



Now, each sales order will have One Header and Multiple Line Item data. Also
the result of the RFC could be multiple Sales Orders - i.e. multiple sales
Orders. Refer the below image. It is one output table that contains Sales
Order data. Further, each record has inline item data (or nested table with
item records).

[![Sales_Order_Header_Item_inline.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/
downloadImage/2-14365174-281556/Sales_Order_Header_Item_inline.JPG)](http://sc
n.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14365174-281556/Sales_Order_Header_I
tem_inline.JPG)

So, if we need to retrieve Sales Order data and Item data in one read, we need
to implement GET_EXPANDED_ENTITY and GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET where you would
populate the complex output structure.



The output XML(on using $expand in the URL) would have following structure

(Please note this is a pseudo XML for understanding purpose only)



<Sales Order # 1>

 <Item # 1>1</Item # 1>

 <Item # 2>2</Item # 2>

 <Item # 3>3</Item # 3>

</Sales Order # 1>

<Sales Order # 2>

 <Item # 1>4</Item # 1>

 <Item # 2>5</Item # 2>

</Sales Order # 2>

<Sales Order # 3>

 <Item # 1>6</Item # 1>

 <Item # 2>7</Item # 2>

 <Item # 3>8</Item # 3>

 <Item # 4>9</Item # 4>

</Sales Order # 3>

<Sales Order # 4>

 <Item # 1>10</Item # 1>

 <Item # 2>11</Item # 2>

 <Item # 3>12</Item # 3>

</Sales Order # 4>



Now in the above example, nested table for item data is as good as a field in
the output structure.



Now, this gives me an idea!! :-)



Based on this example, theoretically we can have multiple nested tables as
fields of the output structure. So multiple table read in one RFC call should
be possible if you have all the output tables as nested tables in the output
structure. So, the output structure would still be a table with only one
record and all the actual output tables would be nested tables. Please see the
example below.



This would be an output structure with field named "Data" and nested tables.

[![Multiple Nested Tables.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/download
Image/2-14365174-281615/Multiple+Nested+Tables.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servle
t/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14365174-281615/Multiple+Nested+Tables.JPG)

As you can see Table # 1, Table # 2 and Table # 3 are as good as field like
"Data" in the output structure.



I think using this approach you should be able to get the data of all the
output tables in one RFC fetch.



I have not tried it practically, but yes theoretically, I think you should be
able to meet your requirement using the above mentioned approach.



Try it. I believe this should work.



Please check and let me know your findings or observations.



Thanks,

Jiten
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: Jiten Rajendra Barai
text:
Hi David,



This is in addition to my earlier comment.



Here's some more useful information on $expand:

<http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg309461.aspx>



The information on $expand available on this link would help you to expand
multiple relationships(for multiple output tables).



Thanks,

Jiten
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
This doesn't help if you are accessing multiple enitities on the basis of
accessing the parent - who says the navigation would go down to children? Why
would you need to know all child values for a given collection?

I cannot understand, if you **wrote **the RFC in question, why you have
written it to provide 3 concurrent feeds. That is simply wrong. Each resource
should be granular ( one set of operation functions for each entity ) and
then you can decide if some means of improving performance can be designed.

If you were using IW_BEP this would be more of a possibility, but you have
made your own constraints here.



Regards



RS
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: lokeswar reddy byni
text:
Hiie ,



Multiple Output Tables Can be Achieved by Using Get Entity set() in Read
Operation...



Rgds,



Lokesh.
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
This is a bad design paradigm, you are building an inside-out model. This is a
really bad trend ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/cry.gif)



If the function doesn't provide the data required in a scalable or low-cost
fashion, it's not the right function and the data needs to be obtained in a
more efficient fashion.
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: Krishna Kishor Kammaje
text:
I agree with Ron.



We need to recognize the fact that not every Function Module is a right fit
for a OData service.

Workarounds are possible but they should be considered only as a last option.
Rather we should explore if right FMs can be created or do a code based
approach.



Thanks

Krishna
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata

author: David Gimeno
text:
Thanks all for your answers.



I've opened a [new thread](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3426165) about RFC
dessign patterns.



Regards,



David.
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway : Multiple Output Tables : Odata
Gateway - RFC Design
text:
Hi Experts,



We are developing a set of RFM to enable gateway to get some backend data. Do
you have any design pattern for a gateway-enabled function module?



As I know, we must have the key as import parameter, and (for performance
reasons) one single output table in each FM. Is there any SAP document about
that?



Thanks in advance.



Regards,

  
David.
author: David Gimeno
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi David,



I am guessing, like a lot of newcomers to GW that you have seen some reference
to RFC and like a moth to a flame, you start investigating that (it's easy,
right, we all know RFC!)



If you have looked into BEP and discounted it for sound reasons, acceptmy
apologies, otherwise please look at the code based implementation style using
BEP.



<http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-43030>



Regards



Ron.



p.s. RFC does have a place and can be used, so the RFC design pattern question
is valid but maybe not what you really need to be knowing.
title: Re:Gateway - RFC Design

title: How to get a http 5xx error status (system dump) in JSON format?
text:
Hi guy's,



In Gateway we created an REST API.

When we consume this API with the query option ?$format=json and use the
following HTTP Headers in the GET Method to get results in JSON format it
works fine and we receive the data correct in JSON format:



Content-Type -> application/json  
X-Requested-With -> XMLHttpRequest  
Accept -> application/json



All http 2xx, 3xx and 4xx client errors that occur will be displayed correctly
in JSON format (e.g. http 400 bad request, because wrong query options are
added to the consuming API url):



{

 "error": {

 "code": "005056A509B11ED1B9BF94F386DD82E6",

 "message": {

 "lang": "en",

 "value": "The Data Services Request could not be understood due to
malformed syntax"

 }

 }

}



Only when a http 5xx internal server errors occur (system dump) the error
information is displayed in XML format (e.g. system dump occors or an RFC
destination is not reachable):



<error>

<code>HTTP/500/E/Internal Server Error</code>

<message>

 Call of service XXXX terminated because of an error. The following error
text was processed in system XXXX : Error when opening an RFC connection
(CPIC-CALL: 'XXXXX Unable to determine host address: NiHostToAddr failed ).The
error occurred on the application server XXXX The termination type was:
RABAX_STATE.If the termination type is RABAX_STATE, you will find more
information on the cause of termination in system XXXX in transaction ST22. If
the termination type is ABORT_MESSAGE_STATE, you will find more information on
the cause of termination on the application server XXXXX in transaction SM21.
If the termination type is ERROR_MESSAGE_STATE, you can search for further
information in the trace file for the work process in transaction ST11 on the
application server XXXXX. You may also need to analyze the trace files of
other work processes. If you do not yet have a user ID, contact your system
adminmistrator.

</message>



</error>  



How to get a http 5xx error in JSON format?
author: Luc Hermans
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Luc,



There are several possible reasons for this not appearing and I can't see the
actual value in wanting it in JSON format.

  1. The dump state breaks the backend process flow, so no actual formatable data is in the handler. 
  2. A dump state should not be normal operational expectation! i.e. you expect to get these in development, but you iron them out to be production-ready.
  3. It is not the client's duty to handle 5xx failures, especially in Gateway. If a 5xx response occurs I'd stop expecting to process a JSON feed as soon as I see the response code. 



The Gateway and/or backend servers will have all the the requisite detailed
logs for RCA to begin.



I think you should not expect to be able to read a 5xx response body, simply
report back the 5xx status text - that should be enough. I don't see any
justification in asking GW team to add JSON support for 5xx responses.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:How to get a http 5xx error status (system dump) in JSON format?

author: Steffen Froehlich
text:
Hi Uwe,



did you tried HTTPS connection? I heard rumors that on newer systems SSL is
mandatory. I tested it some minutes ago on my old SLES 11 GW 7.02 Trial
edition and it works well w/o SSL. On a prod. 7.31 machine HTTP doesn't work
for me either.



However, you could give it a try. But be sure to import the certificate into
JavaVM cacerts keystore via keytool.



keytool -import -trustcacerts -alias root -file your-certificate.crt -keystore
"%JAVA_HOME%\lib\security\cacerts"



After that you have to restart your client machine!



Hope that helps.



\--

Steffen

@Uwe: there is also a blog post by my colleague Gal Roter covering the

netweqaver-gateway-productivity-accelerator>

title: Re:Eclipse: unable to create a Gateway Connection

author: Steffen Froehlich
text:
Hi Uwe,



> But this cannot be the final solution, because it should be possible to
connect to NW Gateway without SSL IMO.



An SSL connection could be helpful if you not want to transfer all ODATA
unencrypted an 'viewable for anybody'. Especially if you have a GW-service
with sensible/personal data. However, with default Gateway setup, on every GET
you'll automatically get the CSRF token (<https://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway
20sp06/helpdata/en/e6/cae27d5e8d4996add4067280c8714e/frameset.htm> )a .



This token is needed to change Data (create,update / post,put). If you
deactivate CSRF token, you'll be able to change data via anonymous user (if
create/update methods are activated in backend system).



Anyway for simple services and 'open data', HTTP should be available
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

\--

Steffen

author: Patrick Zimmer
text:
This exception states the server certificate is not trusted... should actually
not happen if you added its root certficate (could also be the certificate
itself in case it's self-signed) to the cacerts file of the JRE used by your
Eclipse installation ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/sad.gif)



Maybe you can try again via keytool, as e.g. described here:
<http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2893819/telling-java-to-accept-self-
signed-ssl-certificate>

(don't forget the JRE has to be restarted afterwards - Eclipse restart should
do the job)



If it still doesn't work, I'd suggest to create an OSS ticket (OPU-GW-DT).

Confusion about requirements (NW740)
text:
Hi

We use NW740 with GWFND SPS4 for development (hub).

Our developer wants to access some data in the backend system which is NW731
(ERP6 EHP6 SPS7) and currently without any Gateway components and gets the
following error:

Function module "/IWBEP/FM_MGW_MED_LOAD" not found.

As IW_BEP is not installed in the backend this sounds logical.



On the other hand we found following statement (source:

<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp06/helpdata/en/62/91ad98b19b4a91bca737
fbe442273f/content.htm>)



The SAP NetWeaver Gateway core components can be deployed in a standalone
system, either behind or in front of the firewall. In addition, you can
install the optional components for central hub deployment in your standalone
system. For SAP NetWeaver 7.02, 7.03, and 7.31 you can install the component
`IW_BEP` either in this hub system and/or in the backend system. For SAP
NetWeaver 7.40 and higher, the core component `SAP_GWFND` is installed as
standard and includes the functional scope of `IW_BEP`.



The question now is if we need to add (optional gets required) IW_BEP to the
ERP instance or if there is some kind of workaround/change in development for
our Gateway application on NW740 (I'm the basis guy and don't know much about
the development itself).



Michael
author: Michael Schler
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Michael,



I'm pretty sure you should just install IW_BEP 7.31 in ERP (basis version
allowing). Although your Gateway hub has the 'all-in-one' GWFND component,
your backend does not.

Backend providers need a suitable IW_BEP version installed in order to be able
to provide any kind of feed to Gateway.



I hope this answers your question.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Confusion about requirements (NW740)

author: Michael Schler
text:
It does.

Thank you.
title: Re:Confusion about requirements (NW740)

Generating Runtime Objects in NetWeaver Gateway
text:
Greetings All,



I am creating a service using transaction SEGW. I have created my data model
as an XML file and imported it by right clicking Data
Model->Import->Data Model From File. After writing some code for one of
my entity_set methods, I realized that there was an additional entity_set that
I needed to create. I created the entity_set using the SEGW UI. I then
Generated my runtime objects. To my surprise, the code that I had written for
the other entity_set had been overwritten. Is there any way to Generate
Runtime Objects for when additions to the data model are made without
overwriting existing code?



Regards,

Clayton
author: Clayton Rogers
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Clayton,



You have modified the wrong class method.

Do not write your code in the DPC class. Choose the DPC_EXT class and redefine
the method in question. The DPC_EXT version is never overwritten and is the
first point of contact with the incoming request. DPC is always rebuilt as you
may have added an entity, etc, which now needs a new method stub set.

If a method is not implemented, it falls back to the DPC class intentionally
to notify that the method is not in use.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Generating Runtime Objects in NetWeaver Gateway

author: Clayton Rogers
text:
Hey Ron,



Thank you for your response. I should have known this was the issue because
every time I navigated to the ABAP workbench by right clicking the method name
it would say "method is not yet implemented." Thanks again for your answer!



Regards,

Clayton
title: Re:Generating Runtime Objects in NetWeaver Gateway
NetWeaver Gateway Authorization Concept
text:
Greetings,



I am developing an application that will grant users that do not have a
backend username and password access to the system. The authorization concept
that I have come up with is similar to how Biller Direct/UCES work. I will
supply users with a reference username and password. These values are passed
to SMP where they are verified against the backend system. However, the users
also need a way to receive information that pertains only to them from the
backend system. I have developed my application so that the username and
password that user enters is passed into the URL as a key which is validated
in the backend. However, after reading about NetWeaver Gateway Security, it is
not recommended to pass sensitive data through the URL in the form of keys.
What other options do I have as far as getting the username and password to
the backend for validation?



Thank you,

Clayton
author: Clayton Rogers
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Clayton,



User login is not only for authorisation, it is a means of managing licences.
If the user is a SAP licence holder they are meant to access SAP with their
login. If they are, for example, a customer or partner using a self-service
function then they can access via an anonymous login.

However, trying to access business functions on a named basis without a
licenced login is probably breaking the operating licence terms, so I'd
suggest you cover off on this possible breach before pursuing this any
further.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:NetWeaver Gateway Authorization Concept

author: Clayton Rogers
text:
Hey Ron,



Thank you for your reply. I do not think there is any danger of this. I am
intending my application to be similar to UCES. In UCES, the user login and
password is maintained in UME, along with the user's business partner number.
Once the user has validated their login credentials, the business partner
number is passed into the session. That is how all the information that is
pulled from the backend only pertains to that user. They are granted access to
backend functionality via a Reference User that is maintained in the XCM
settings. Every RFC call to the backend is validated using the Reference User.



My concept would be the same. I want to maintain the userId's and passwords
and have them associated with the respective business partner number. The
users would receive access to backend functionality through the Reference
User, but this would not be on a named basis.



Regards,

Clayton
title: Re:NetWeaver Gateway Authorization Concept

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
It's a tricky one.

Gateway authorisation works on the basis of SAP login being part of the
request credentials, not the request content.

If you continue along this path, you will have to pass login credentials as
part of every call you make to this service, it's not a one-off procedure as
it is stateless.

It's been said before and maybe it applies here - Gateway is **not **the
solution to every web service scenario. I've done the 'business partner login'
type scenario as well in the past; in all of those scenarios they were
stateful and the whole application was controlled and secured by the backend.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:NetWeaver Gateway Authorization Concept

author: Clayton Rogers
text:
Good info, thanks Ron. I wonder how SAP used authorizations for their new
Utility Customer Engagement app? I would think that they would have had to
answer the same questions that I am asking now. Maybe they didn't use a
Gateway service to begin with?
title: Re:NetWeaver Gateway Authorization Concept
OData Create operation / OData Framework / SEGW
text:
Hello experts,



.. I got the following problem when using standard gateway builder and remote
function modules for the functionality on the backend:

there is a create operation for a time card and caused by wrong frontend data
the create operation in the backend fails (which means the fucntion module
doesn't create anything).

How can I trap this case ?

Is there a possibility to raise an error for this or to stop execution at this
point?

I'm asking this, because the read after create, which is usually done
automatically by the framework after the create operation causes a short dump.

> METHOD XXX_CREATE _ENTITY.

>

>

>

> ..

>

> create part, doesn't create anything ...

>

> ...

>

>

>

> .. at the end the read after create:

>

>

>

> CREATE OBJECT lo_tech_read_request_context.

>

> ...

>

> bla bla (fill key table)..

>

> ...

>

> * Call read after create

>

> /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~get_entity(

>

>  EXPORTING

>

>  iv_entity_name = iv_entity_name

>

>  iv_entity_set_name = iv_entity_set_name

>

>  iv_source_name = iv_source_name

>

>  it_key_tab = lt_key_tab

>

>  io_tech_request_context = lo_tech_read_request_context

>

>  it_navigation_path = it_navigation_path

>

>  IMPORTING

>

>  er_entity = ls_entity

>

> ).

>

>

>

> * Send the read response to the caller interface

>

> ASSIGN ls_entity->* TO <ls_data>.

>

> er_entity = <ls_data>.



I'm sending back all data of the entity in my read operation, thus the entity
is empty in case it does not exist which means ls_entity points to nothing and
the last operation then leads to the short dump.



Thx a lot in advance,

Robert
author: Robert Kemeter
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Robert,



there is a standard exception path that you use to surface errors. In this
case, it is a business error so you use exception class [/IWBEP/CX_MGW_BUSI_EX
CEPTION](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/en/f2/a126519eff236ee100000
00a445394/content.htm).



<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/en/95/fd2651c294256ee10000000a44539
4/content.htm?frameset=/en/6c/4f22518bc72214e10000000a44176d/frameset.htm>



The framework will pass it back to the response, do not add any CATCH points
of your own.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:OData Create operation / OData Framework / SEGW

author: Robert Kemeter
text:
Hi Ron,



.. first of all thanks for the fast answer.



If I understood you correctly then I have to redefine xxx_create_entity method
and raise exception in case of not successful backend operation and omit the
read after create request ?



Or should I catch the not checked assignment (if NOT <ls_data> is
assigned ..).



Reagrds,

Robert
title: Re:OData Create operation / OData Framework / SEGW

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Robert,



I would check the return from the create function/method that does the actual
update. If that is clear then be optimistic and continue on the assumption it
has worked. Otherwise raise that exception.



If the update is asynchronous, you could get into trouble trying to read it
immediately, so I would not do that - sometimes you'd get an entity body back,
sometimes not . Either way, I don't consider it the job of the creation to
read back the value - if the client wants to confirm the resource, it should
GET it back.



I usually return the entity content back in er_entity in the form that it was
received, plus the key.



Ultimately it's down to you how you want to handle the exceptions, this is
just how to do it.



Cheers



Ron.
title: Re:OData Create operation / OData Framework / SEGW

author: Robert Kemeter
text:
Hi Ron,



.. thanks for your help.



I implemented it for both options, because reading is not necessary after
unsuccessful create operation (which is synchronous here) and for me this is
some kind of unsafe programming in the code that SEGW created itself (if I
implemented the READ operation correctly) to not check an assignment.



Best regards,

Robert
title: Re:OData Create operation / OData Framework / SEGW
