title: Concurrency control issues
text:
I'm looking at concurrency control mechanisms for Gateway, but I'm wondering
if the in-built conditional support works yet.



The problem I am experiencing relates to the "If-Match" header that is needed
to test an ETag value. There is code to check conditions on a request - it is
located in /IWCOR/CL_DS_HDLR_ROOT->HANDLE_CONDITIONS.

During testing I've found that the code here drops down to a kernel call to
extract named headers in the IF-series from the http request.

Despite an If-Match header being clearly visible in the original request, the
browser developer tool and another part of the ABAP, the kernel can't find it
and returns nothing.

Result: It is decided that I never sent the prerequisite header, so I am told
I should probably consider adding an If-Match header.

OK then, another one or the same one?
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/mischief.gif)



Has anyone else tried to use ETag checking and hit this obstacle?
author: Ron Sargeant

text:

single application using one service with multiple entities.



What is the best practice of approach for this scenario?



Thanks In Advance.

VKK.
author: Kiran Kumar Vadrevu
Ron Sargeant
text:
Kiran,



Creating one service with multiple entities is normal practice; in fact one
entity per service and many services in the application is bad practice.



The current approach used in Fiori is one Gateway model per application.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Grouping GatewayModels

author: Andre Fischer
text:
Hi Kiran,



I am not sure whether I understood your question correctly.



There is however an option to group existing services such that their entity
sets are publihsed as one new OData service.



This is called model composition.



Here you create a new service out of existing services.



<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp07/helpdata/en/16/2d8af9360e4b69970d73
4f99900061/frameset.htm>



Regards,

Andre
title: Re:Grouping GatewayModels
Netweaver Gateway deployment options
text:
Hi



We are planning to build OData services from SAP using Netweaver Gateway for
consumption in a mobile app and I'm having some very basic questions.



When I tried looking that the most recommended deployment approach for NW
Gateway, I got some contradictory results.

There's an old [blog](http://scn.sap.com/community/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2012/01/09/opinions-on-deploying-netweaver-gateway) that quotes
(and commented by SAP) that SAP recommends the cetral hub instance and a
subsequent[ blog ](http://scn.sap.com/community/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2012/01/09/how-to-architect-sap-netweaver-gateway-for-dummies-
and-for-experts)that says there's no clear indication on the right
architectural option while there's an old [sdn doc](http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj
/scn/go/portal/prtroot/docs/library/uuid/a0e63157-4e86-2f10-8bb0-b634973efc49?
QuickLink=index&overridelayout=true&55160264986758) (stamped approved and all)
from SAP which says the most recommended option is the embedded approach.

Since its been quite a while, is there any clear stance that SAP is taking now
on the best deployment options or is it still based on the enterprise's
existing landscape, security etc?



\- If NW Gateway server is installed on ECC as an add-on in the embedded
approach, is it then possible to retrieve data from other SAP systems( eg: BW,
POS-DM) through (RFC connections?) and build once single OData service?



\- SAP says it recommends OData Channel approach for all NW Gateway
development. Does OData Channel development differ based on which deployment
option you chose? It mentions backend OData Channel and hub OData Channel. How
different are they?



Thanks!



Arthi
author: Arthi N
Tom Bo Larsen
text:
Hi Arthi

Did you get som feedback on this one - or have you gained som experience
yourself in the meantime?



I found the same contradictionary info - in general it seems in older notes
and material that embedded is recommednde, in the new Fiori inst guide the HUB
is recommended and in Gateway 2 documentation there are 3 alternatives
represented.



Any up-to-date recommendations or experience is very welcome.



Br

Tom bo
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway deployment options

author: Arthi N
text:
Hi Tom bo



We are on NW 7.31. We still needed to install the add-ons. So, we went with
the Hub approach.



There are both pros and cons for that approach.



The hub is separated from the back-end, so no changes are involved in the
back-end systems (in terms of add-ons etc). We had more than one back-end
systems to fetch data from. So we didn't want to embed a Gateway server in
each. We are doing the service development as well in the hub.

You need not also unnecessary expose the back-end systems to the external
world directly.



The limitations are that we can only access data from the back-end systems
using RFCs and Easy Queries. Otherwise it worked out pretty fine.



I hope you have read [this](http://scn.sap.com/community/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2013/05/27/sap-netweaver-gateway-deployment-options-
in-a-nutshell) blog as well, which seems to give some updated info, still no
clear recommendations.



I guess the decision on which deployment option to pick is purely based on
what your requirements and limitations are.

Good luck to you!



Regards

Arthi
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway deployment options

author: Andre Fischer
text:
Hi Arthi,



thanks for mentioning my blog but I thought that the recommendation was clear.



If not I better work on it :-).



The recommended approach is definitely to develop in the backend and use a
standalone hub.



I would in addition always recommend to also deploy IW_BEP on the hub. This
way you can for example leverage model composition.



But if customers have an issue with deploying AddOns in their backend than the
development on the server is definitly the way to go.



Best Regards,

Andre
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway deployment options

author: Tom Bo Larsen
text:
Hi Andre



Thanks for a good blog about this hot topic. The blog certainly clarified the
alternatives for me regarding the deployment options. One suggestion for
further improvement of the blog is the include guidance/alternative for
'landscaping': E.g. if you have a four-system ECC landscape (sandbox,
development, QAS and Prod), which should be 'OData-enabled' - do you then
require four gateway systems also? In a hub-scenario, this is certainly quit
an overhead for small/medium customers.



Br

Tom Bo
title: Re:Netweaver Gateway deployment options

author: Tom Bo Larsen
text:
Hi Arthi



Thanks for the prompt answer. I have read the blog and it clarified the pros
and cons for me. However it is still a 'hard' decision to choose the
deployment alternative as pros and cons can be hard to weight against each
other and also has to be balanced with TCO (e.g. a central Hub needs its own
system, OS, capacity etc.).



As our use case of the GW is for Fiori we choose the hub (with backend
development) deployment. This is the recommendation from the Fiori guide.



Br

Tom Bo

title: Odata service to trigger calculation in back-end

Hi all,



I have the following requirement. First I have to collect last years customer
sales figures plus a calculated discount percentage from the ERP system (Odata
GetEntity with key customer number). In the app the user can see the last
years sales figures and can set sales estimates for the next year. Second I
want to call another service (Function Module in ERP) with the changed sales
figures as input. The FM calculates the discount percentage and sends it back.

as key fields? Is there an example available of such scenario?

To summarise, there is a bug which should be fixed in the next few days,
alternatively there are some workarounds.

title: Re:iOS Generation fails using GWPA for iOS/Eclipse

author: Brad Pokroy
text:
Hi Olli,



I have them as I am participating in the ramp-up. However that OSS note I
mention gives instructions how to fix it.



Ill paste the instructions below:



**Known Issue**

Toolkit for iOS  
Currently, when you use the Toolkit for iOS, it fails to generate the iOS
application.



The following workaround solves the iOS application generation issue. A fix
will be available in the next patch release:

    1. In the file system, open the folder, _**Eclipse** _\--> _**plugins** _and find the JAR file, _com.sap.odata.dt.cons.toolkit.ios_
    2. Extract the content of the JAR file into a folder in your file system.
    3. Find and copy the folder, _**res/SDMLibs/iOS,**_ in the extracted content.
    4. Create a new folder called, _**Temp/IOSODataSDK**_ (case sensitive), and place the copied **iOS** folder into it.   
You should have the SDM libs in the following folder structure:
_**/Temp/IOSODataSDK/iOS/**_

    5. Open Eclipse and go to **Eclipse **\--> **Preferences**, and choose **OData Development **->** SAP NetWeaver Gateway **->** iOS Toolkit.**
    6. Select **Use Local SDK**, and** c**lick **Browse **to select the folder, _**Temp/IOSODataSDK. **_The selected
    7. path displays in_ **Location.**_
    8. Click **OK**.



Hope that helps.



Cheers,

Brad

text:

 I created a project using the segw t-code for which I need to import the
Data Model by DDIC structure. I am trying to look for the BAPI
CUSTOMER_GETDETAIL1 but it doesn't appear. I looked it's package details using
the transaction se37 . I used that package name to search while looking for
the BAPI's in segw , but it still did not appear in the list.

BAPICUSTOMER_GETDETAIL1 and few other combinations, but nothing worked.

Regards,

Ravi Chaudhary

jitendra kansal
text:
Hi Ravi,



in case of importing data model for BAPI , you should choose RFC/BOR interface
instead of DDIC Structure.

Refer this document for more understanding



[Importing a Data Source (RFC/BOR Interface) - SAP NetWeaver Gateway
Foundation (SAP_GWFND) - SAP Library](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdat
a/en/43/dc22512c312314e10000000a44176d/content.htm?frameset=/en/f3/dc22512c312
314e10000000a44176d/frameset.htm)

Rgrds,

author: Ravi Chaudhary
text:
Hi Jitendra,

 I forgot to mention it in the original post, but we still have
netweaver gateway components in level SP4 and the RFC/BOR interface is only
available with SP5. Is there any other way I can import the BAPI using the
DDIC Structure?

Regards,

Ravi chaudhary
title: Re:Unable to find BAPI CUSTOMER_GETDETAIL1

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Ravi



Where are you looking for this BAPI? If you have a standalone Gateway, it
won't be in there and you should not be building the service implementation in
the Gateway instance.



If you don't have the right SP level for what you are trying to do, do a code-
based implementation using the BAPI as means of obtaining the data for your
read. How were you planning to satisfy a query and get the entityset? It's not
RESTful to assume that the customer key is known for a direct read.



See these articles:



[http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2013/10/17/improved-inside-out-
modelling](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2013/10/17/improved-inside-out-modelling)

[http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-43000](http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-43000)





Regards



Ron.

 Thank you for sharing the documents, they were very helpful. I guess I
will upgrade the setup to SP08, which I assume is the latest so as to use the
RFC/BOR import method. That apparently should make things easier for me.

Regards,

Ravi Chaudhary

SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?
text:
Hi All,

 Within all the discussions about Gateway and OData sevices, I couldn't
answer to a basic question I have... Hope someone here could answer it for me.

 We have a NW 701 ABAP system with the IW_BEP Addon installed. I understand
that this is enough to create OData channels from ABAP.



 However, every blogs/articles goes ahead to GW_CORE as further steps to
expose the OData channel as gateway services to the world. That's fine, but
I'd like to know if I want to develop a UI5 application that's hosted right
within the same ABAP server (using SAPUI5 runtime), then is there a way to
consume these OData channels directly without the GW_CORE?

Can anyone refer me to any articles, wiki or blogs etc. that has such an
information?
author: Mithun Kumar
Thomaskutty Mathew
text:
I am not sure we can consue OData channels directley without the GW_CORE. The
following link will provide good informations and it might give some
directions to you.



<http://scn.sap.com/people/dj.adams/blog/2012/02/13/sapui5-says-hello-odata-
to-netweaver-gateway>
title: Re:SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?

author: Suhair Liyakath
text:
<http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-28526>

please refer to this doc



hope this helps,



suhair
title: Re:SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?

author: Suhair Liyakath
text:
Hi Mithun ,



IWBEP is one of the components for the Backend enabling of the ECC or CRM
servers.But you would Require a Gateway instance installed seperately with
GWCORE and other components(And the backend system need to configured with the
system alias ) to Host a odata channel.The Other Alternative is to have the
Gateway core componets in the Backend server itself (ECC or CRM).

Hope this answers your query



Best Regards,

Suhair .L
title: Re:SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?

author: Mithun Kumar
text:
Thanks for the info, Suhair and Mathew...

I was under the impression that Gateway is mainly required to expose SAP data
to the outside world, only... And it might be possible to build and consume
the data internally within SAP systems without requiring Gateway.

In fact our product managers want to avoid Gateway with a view to reducing TCO
for our own product. That is if customers buy license for our product, then
they should not need to spend additionally for another product's (Gateway's)
license mandatorily.

So I was trying to figure out if there's any other way to expose RFCs as Odata
/ RESTful services, then we can host the SAP UI5 runtime within our system and
call the services internally to build beatiful UIs on top of them.



But from your explanation, it seems not possible without Gateway
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/sad.gif)
title: Re:SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?

author: Suhair Liyakath
text:
Hi Mithun ,



The TCO Concern is a just one.In that case you have some alternatives provided
your requirement is not very complex.you can write simple json based REST Http
services in abap and integrate them in SAPUI5 and Jquery to create simple
applications.

But if you need complex data model and entity relations , then there is not
many options other than custom odata channel using Gateway 2.0



Best Regards,

Suhair.L
title: Re:SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?

author: Mithun Kumar
text:
Thanks Suhair...

We'll think of that possibility... Although we do have a few data models a bit
complex.

author: Suhair Liyakath

Do you know of any document/link about how to create REST http services in
ABAP?

author: Suhair Liyakath
text:
Hi Mithun



this book was very useful.

the chapter 16 in this book covers a simple rss feed build , but we can modify
the same approach to build the HTTP based rest service

<http://scn.sap.com/people/thomas.jung/blog/2007/06/27/next-generation-abap-
development-book>



As For Json , there is a json document code exchange project that will give
you the json parse/render capability.

<https://cw.sdn.sap.com/cw/groups/zjson>



Hope this sets you in right direction.



Best Regards,

suhair liyakath
title: Re:SAP UI5 on ABAP without Gateway?

author: Holger Schfer
text:
Hi Mithun,

did you solve your problem?



We just started migrating our Sencha uis to UI5 and we did implement a custom
JSON solution on a native AS ABAP 7.0 EHP 0 with no need for GW (because ther
customers will not update their systems).



We implemented the Sencha ExtDirect Prototol.



That means, you can directly call ABAP Classes/Methods from UI5 including DDIC
to JSON transformation and vice versa.



All we had to do was implementing a http handler with abap coding.

The ddic to json encoder can be found on SCN.



Cheers Holger

adapter-for-abap-function-modules)

It isn't REST based services, but you could consume JSON "services"

Kind regards

Modify external service name
text:
When attempting to register and activate a service through the Service Builder
the field External Service Name cannot be changed. In various documentation I
commonly see the statement:

 _The External Service Name is defaulted with the Technical Service Name_



Is there some requirement that these names must match or is it is possible to
change this value somehow?
author: Brett Rehberg
Lukasz Grochal
text:
I'm afraid there is no way to assign an external service name of your
choosing. It does always default to the Technical Service Name. The technical
name can be modified when you activate the service, the external name is
always grayed out. Even if you go to transaction /IWBEP/REG_SERVICE to create
a new service from scratch (as opposed to using SEGW), you'll notice that the
external service name is grayed out.

It's a bit of inconvenience, I agree.

Please note that in most system landscapes the client application that is not
running on the internal network will not be accessing NW Gateway directly but
rather through a proxy or a relay server. The URL used by the app will be that
of the proxy and you'll have the freedom to give your service any alias you
want on that proxy.
title: Re:Modify external service name

author: Andre Fischer
text:
Hi Brett,



maybe using an external alias could be a solution for you?



[SAP Library - SAP NetWeaver Gateway](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp0
6/helpdata/en/ad/ff9a1da7aa4ddbab594ff2f13d09db/frameset.htm)



Best Regards,

Andre

When using batch request, the bapi functionality is undesirable.
text:
Hi Geeks,



I am creating a netweaver gateway service for Physical inventory cycle count.

For entering the count i an using the BAPI_MATPHYSINV_COUNT.



After entering the count, when we check in the table IKPF, we can see that the
Count Status field gets updated.

'X' -- count completed.

'A' -- partially counted.



The problem which i am facing is that,

consider the physical inventory material document has 3 material to be
counted,



I am using a batch request for entering the count when multiple materials are
to be counted.

In each changeset i have a PUT request with details of a single material
count.



When i am updating the count for all 3 material in a document in one go,

the count status as i mentioned earlier is reflected as 'A' which means
partially counted.

But all the counts are succesfully entered.

In the actual scenario, the count status should have been reflected as 'X'
since we have entered count for all materials.



Note: In the above case when i update the count for 2 materials in one request
and the remaining one in another request, the count status is correctly
populated as 'X'. The mentioned problem is also not present when the document
has a single material in it.



please throw some suggestions on this to achieve it.



Thanks & Regards ,

Naseem VP.
author: SAP Geek Illuminati
Pranay Aitha
text:
Hi Naseem,



Firstly if any one of the Change Set processing fails, all the requests are
cancelled by default. Also each Change Set is treated as a single transaction
on the back end while processing. So I don't see the purpose of using the
partially counted flag.



Regards,

Pranay
title: Re:When using batch request, the bapi functionality is undesirable.

author: Saurabh Gupta
text:
Hi Naseem,



Please check for COMMIT statement. It should be used at last of the
processing.



Can you pls share the batch request and code used for the problem scenario.





Thanks

Saurabh
title: Re:When using batch request, the bapi functionality is undesirable.

to be in the implementation of the various filters:

[https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV/SalesOr
ders?$top=15&sap-ds-debug=true#sec6](https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/o
pu/odata/sap/ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV/SalesOrders?%24top=15&sap-ds-debug=true#sec6)



Martin
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

author: Mattias Johansson
text:
Hello,



Thank you for the debug link, I did not know about that one. I guess I have
build a demo withour sales order filters, but isn't it ironic that the "top"
filter slows things down.



Regards

Mattias
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

author: Robin Panneels
text:
Mattias,



The inlinecount=allpages causes your performance issue, it will query and take
all entries for your filter (which are none in this case). So if you have
100.000 sales orders for example. It will take them all for count purposes and
only return the 15 first entries. It is not a describe table sort of thing.



When you add filters to restrict your data, you'll notice that this goes way
faster (even with the inlinecount=allpages).



When you investigate the data you receive back from the service with and
without $inlinecount=allpages you'll notice that the data might not be the
same.



Kind regards,



Robin
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

author: Mattias Johansson
text:
Hi,



Thank you for your response, and I can understand the reason for it. But if
you look at the request in my original post, it has a "top" filter, which I
thought meant it would read only the first 15? The request still takes around
40 seconds, but I guess it's due to a bad implementation of the get_list-
method. Unfortunatly I don't have authorization to look at the implementation
in the demo system.
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

author: Robin Panneels
text:
Hi,



The "top" filter isn't an actual filter... From my understanding your service
will first perfom the inlinecount (to get the total possible count),
afterwards it takes to top 15 records.



The process is the following:

  1. $filter
  2. $inlinecount
  3. $top



Kind regards,



Robin
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

author: Mattias Johansson
text:
But that means it's more or less impossible to use the sap.m.list-objekt to
show a longer list, as it automatically will append these parameters to the
call...
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

author: Robin Panneels
text:
I see what you mean...

In Google Chrome Developer Tools can you see in the Networking tab what the
result is for the $count method on your gateway service?



Because 40seconds looks like a lot of data... Normally the
$inlinecount=allpages should return a higher number (if there are more
records) than your $top parameter.
title: Re:Slow response times for the Gateway Consumption System

Transferring HCM Process & Forms(FPM) using Gateway
text:
Dear Experts,

As of now we have been able to send workflow decision task(no forms is
attached to this) from SAP Backend system to the Gateway system and then
sending them to the Lotus Notes Server in ODATA format and user is able to
approve/reject the worktiem from Lotus Notes Email.



We have developed HCM Process and Forms using FPM(Floor Plan Manager) for
several HR Process like Employee Transfer, Contract change , compensation
change etc. and the **requirement is to transfer the whole form(attached to
the workflow task) to the Gateway system** and eventually sending them to
Lotus notes Server so that the user can approve/reject the request from Lotus
Notes application like Lotus Notes Email.



Can anyone please let me know whether is it possible at all and if it is
possible then how to do this or what are the additional steps needs to be
followed for this.



Your response is highly appreciated....Thanks in advance!!!!!
author: Hafizul Mollah
Ron Sargeant
text:
When you say 'form', do you need the form representation, e.g. an interactive
PDF form, or the form data only, for the transfer? That will make a big
difference!

If the form is a PDF file, it should be possible to transfer attachments. Are
you using WFSERVICE for your current process? I'm not sure what coverage it
has for file attachments, but if there is none, you could redefine it to
include that feature.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Transferring HCM Process & Forms(FPM) using Gateway

author: Hafizul Mollah
text:
Hi Ron,

Thanks for the reply.

The actual requirement is to transfer both the form data as well as the form
representation if possible but if the form representation is not possible at
all then the form data will also do and in the front end application like
Lotus Notes - the same form needs to be developed (using HTML5 or Java) which
will use the data from back end ECC system.



In HCM PF we have two option to build the front end form-1)Using Adobe form
2)Using FPM(Floor Plan Manager)------and the FPM option has been used to
develop the front end form which basically generates Webdynpro ABAP code.



So we need to know whether we can use the same HCM PF FPM form to transfer the
data(and form representation if possible) to the Lotus Notes Application via
Gateway using ODATA protocol.
title: Re:Transferring HCM Process & Forms(FPM) using Gateway

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
If this was something I had to do, I would look at using Adobe interactive
forms. You then only have one form to manage. The data is in that form and can
be extracted or manipulated wherever required.

Being PDF, it would be easier to simply show the PDF via Notes than it would
be to build a local form representation. You would also have to make sure this
form is kept in line with any changes to the master. It can be transferred
through Gateway as a binary media entity.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Transferring HCM Process & Forms(FPM) using Gateway

WFSERVICE?

text:
Dear,



When I test a json deep insert (For eaxmple:a POST on
/sap/opu/odata/sap/<Gateway_service>/<GW_Data>Set in the GW Client
then it returns the result in atom/xml....



If i add **?$format=json** to the call i receive following error:



[![gw_json_error.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1
4826781-398737/450-203/gw_json_error.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServ
let/showImage/2-14826781-398737/gw_json_error.png)

The Data Services Request contains SystemQueryOptions that are not allowed for
this Request Type





Is there a way to get the response in json for a POST deep insert/create?



Thanks in advance!



Kind Regards,



Robin
author: Robin Panneels
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi Robin,



This error is coming from method PROCESS_ENTITY_SET
(/IWCOR/CL_DS_PROC_DISPATCHER)



Below system query options are not allowed for POST.





> " system query option are not allowed

>

>  IF io_uri->expand IS NOT INITIAL OR

>

>  io_uri->select IS NOT INITIAL OR

>

>  io_uri->filter IS BOUND OR

>

>  io_uri->orderby IS BOUND OR

>

>  io_uri->skip IS NOT INITIAL OR

>

>  io_uri->top IS NOT INITIAL OR

>

>  io_uri->skiptoken IS NOT INITIAL OR

>

>  io_uri->inlinecount IS NOT INITIAL OR

>

>  io_uri->format IS NOT INITIAL.

>

>  RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /IWCOR/cx_DS_proc_error

>

>  EXPORTING

>

>  textid =
/IWCOR/cx_DS_proc_error=>invalid_system_query_option.

>

> ENDIF.



May be using batch call you can get response in JSON format. I mean using
batch method, 1st give call to POST and then to GET which allows $format.



again on client side (may be ui5), you can easily convert response in json
format with available APIs.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:JSON deep insert returns atom/xml

author: Lukasz Grochal
text:
A simple trick to get a json response from a POST request when testing with
either the Gateway Client or any browser-based REST Client is to add the
following header to the request:



Accept application/json



No need to use $batch in this case unless you're really batching requests.

You can use this with any HTTP method supported.

SAP NW RFC SDK throws RFC_INVALID_PARAMETER when running sample programs?
author: Lynton Grice
Ulrich Schmidt
text:
Hi Lynton,

the problem is as follows: the libnwrfc.so expects all string inputs in
Unicode format. But the way you compiled the application, the SAP_UC type, cU
macro, etc resolve to standard 1-byte char. Therefore the names of all logon
parameters (e.g. "ashost") get passed as 1-byte ASCII, but get interpreted as
2-byte Unicode, resulting in garbage like "", which are of course
"invalid parameters"...

In order to activate Unicode input, you need to apply the following to steps,
as explained in SAP note 1056696 "Compiling and Linking RFC Programs with the
SAP NW RFC SDK", which lists the necessary compiler settings for each
platform:



o Add -DSAPwithUNICODE to the preprocessor flags (and a few more recommended
ones) and stop after the pre.processing step

o Run a certain perl script on the resulting output (script is available in
SAP note 763741). (This step is necessary on Linux only, because the Linux
operating system works with multi-byte UTF-8 instead of a fixed-length Unicode
representation expected by SAP R/3)

o Run compile and link step as usual.



In addition to the above mentioned notes, also the following SDN articles
might give you more detailed information about working with the NW RFC SDK:



Part I -- RFC Client Programming

<http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/sdn/index?rid=/library/uuid/302f1a30-f4cb-
2c10-e985-c8a280a96e43>



Part II -- RFC Server Programming

<http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/sdn/index?rid=/library/uuid/b02b0719-4ccc-2c10
-71ab-fe31483e466f>



Part III -- Advanced Topics

<http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/sdn/index?rid=/library/uuid/5070f62a-6acd-
2c10-8cb5-858ef06adbb9>



Regards, Ulrich
title: Re:SAP NW RFC SDK throws RFC_INVALID_PARAMETER when running sample programs?

Because ASCII conversion to UTF16LE (<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-16>) is
very simple, I prepared function

> char* ascii2utf16le( char *text_ascii)  
{  
 int rec=-1;  
 int i=0;  
 int j=0;  
 int n=0;

>

>

>

>  size_t inbufsize = strlen(text_ascii);  
 size_t outbufsize=(2*inbufsize);

>

>

>

>  i=2*inbufsize;

>

>

>

>

>  for(j=0;j<i;j++)  
 {  
 if(0==(j%2))

 converted[j]=text_ascii[n];

 return converted_str;

Fixed-length Unicode representation expected by SAP R/3 is under control, but

Developer auth on Gateway system
text:
Hi - Can you please advise if I want to allow a developer to build just a
oData service on Netweaver Gateway System based on a existing BAPI in the
backend system (say ECC system), do I have to give the developer a core ABAP
developer level access on the gateway system? or is there anything like just
oData developer level access that only limits the developer to only build
oData services but not real ABAP developments like building FMs, DDic etc.?
author: Venkat Architha
Steffen Froehlich
text:
Hi Venkat,



please have a look into documentation regarding auths for users, developers
and administrators:

[User, Developer and Administrator Authorizations - SAP Documentation](http://
help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp06/helpdata/en/c0/af543a0ce04b7690c196294db1b8
02/content.htm)



There are predefined roles for various profiles. I'm not a administrator
expert, but I guess you have to give your OData-developer, ABAP development
auths as well. While creating and activating OData services, there are classes
and other development objects created in the background.



\--

Steffen
title: Re:Developer auth on Gateway system

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Venkat,

  

Technically speaking, service **creation** rarely happens on the Gateway
server (assuming you are talking about a hub). The services are defined on the
backends and the Gateway server is only **registering** them.

All of the technical objects in GW are standard SAP components that manage the
BEP interfacing through abstract models, so no specific case coding per
service is required.

There are cases where you may develop on a hub, but in your scenario this
doesn't apply.

  

regards

  

Ron.
title: Re:Developer auth on Gateway system

title: Re:Error in Update method in NW Gateway

author: Lukasz Grochal
text:
The first error is caused by the fact that you're using POST and you do not
have your Entity Set name at the end of the URL. Instead you have $metadata
and other query string parameters. This is not proper syntax. Also where's the
payload? What are you uploading?

The other screenshot - well, the only HTTP method you can run from the browser
like that is GET. The browser doesn't know you're trying to post anything. You
should use the Gateway REST client with the proper synatx or an external REST
Client browser plugin (Advanced Rest Client, Postman or alike). Then you'll be
able to change the request method as well as add payload to your modifying
requests.

Also if you are trying to upload a binary file, the entity type should be
flagged as media and CREATE_STREAM, UPDATE_STREAM and similar methods should
be implemented.

Please familiarize yourself with the concepts behind restful web services in
general as well as test tools available first and then binary file handling in
OData and NW Gateway.
title: Re:Error in Update method in NW Gateway

Data Provider Class. And i have redefined the

aseOrderHeaderCollection

aseOrderItemCollection?$filter=(PONumber eq '4500000003')

HI Sagar Patil,

 Can You please share the Info how to approve Or Update data.

 Update Operation through REST Client.

title: Re:Help to implement accept and reject functionalities of PO Approval .

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Sagar,



Accessing your items as '/PurchaseOrderItemCollection?$filter=(PONumber eq
'4500000003')' is not the right way to do this as it is not compliant with
discovery expectations.

As there is a hard relationship between the header and the items, this should
be indicated by a navigation, e.g.
'PurchaseOrderHeaderCollection('4500000003')/Items'.



Accept and reject could be done by changing a status property and PUTting the
entity or just PATCHing the status. However this is also not discovery
compliant and would normally be done by a function import.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Help to implement accept and reject functionalities of PO Approval .

Connecting to Multiple ECC systems via one Gateway system(Dynamic System
Selection)
text:
Hi Experts,



We have multiple ECC systems and one Gateway server. We want to connect to
these different ECC systems using one GW system.

I have created System Aliases for these ECC system in GW system. For a
service, i added 2 system aliases.



Now we are looking for the solution where UI can provide the system alias (it
wants to connect) as a parameter while calling oData Service.



Please help.



Regards,

Rohit
author: Rohit Choudhary
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Rohit,



Should this not be determined by the service name? The service name is bound
to an alias (backend), therefore unique service names are equivalent to
logging into "backend instance x".



I don't expect service connection details to be passed through by the Gateway,
consumers should be agnostic of the provision source(s). This allows Gateway
administrators to redefine the backend endpoints without changing the
published Gateway interface.



There may be a way to do this but I don't really see a common use case for it.



Regards



Ron.
title:
Re:Connecting to Multiple ECC systems via one Gateway system(Dynamic System
Selection)

author: Holger Neven
text:
Hi Rohit,



we have a similar scenario where we have two system aliases for one service.
Both aliases point to the same system, but different clients; it should not
make a difference though, having different systems. The feature you are
looking for is Multiple Origin Composition (MOC).



There are a couple of things you have to consider:

  * in the SEGW the entity to be called has to be marked as addressable
  * the URI of the service needs to include the tag for MOC (;mo) --> [http://sapgw.domain.org:8000/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSOME_SERVICE**;mo**/entityset](http://sapgw.domain.org:8000/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSOME_SERVICE;mo/entityset)

Without the ;mo the call will be routed to your default alias. The ;mo will
route the call to both systems. Using MOC will generate an additional key
property into your entities --> SAP__ORIGIN. The property is the alias. If
you want to route to a specific system you have to provide the SAP__ORIGIN
like providing normal key properties in your requests.

This will look like this:



<content type="application/xml">

 <m:properties
xmlns:m="<http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata>"
xmlns:d="<http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices>">

 <d:SAP__Origin>SOME_ALIAS</d:SAP__Origin>

 <d:Identifier>SOME_IDENTIFIER</d:Identifier>

 <d:Doublet />

 </m:properties>

</content>





The original Entity only consists of the key property "Identifier" and the
property "Doublet". "SAP__ORIGN" is added via the ;mo.



Hope it helped...

Holger
title:
Re:Connecting to Multiple ECC systems via one Gateway system(Dynamic System
Selection)
Cannot generate proxy for oData service using .NET 3.5
text:
Hi,



We get an error when generating client proxy to SAP CRM OData
(CRM_OPPORTUNITY) using MS DataSvcUtil.exe tool for .Net 3.5 (ADO.NET Data
Services client).

  * Specifically when generating within VS2010 it fails at design time. 
  * VS2012 generates proxy successfully but fails with same error at runtime. 
  * If using .Net 4 version (now called WCF Data Services client), we do not get this error. 



The question we have is whether there known constraints to calling SAP OData
services from .Net 3.5 client proxy and is there anything we can do to
remediate, apart from using .Net 4 version, since CommSee runs still on .Net2

[![d.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-14780225-3864
89/450-112/d.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14780225
-386489/d.png)

Particularly it seems to be complaining on the Edm.Guid field saying it is
treated as binary and hence not supported.



We are using VS 2010 .NET 3.5 SP1.

We have company platform restriction that restricts us from using .NET 4.
VS2012/3 is not possible.





On the side note:

We tried some of the publicly available OData services in OData.org (Northwind
and the like) and can see:

  * Have no issues creating .Net3.5 proxies for their demo services
  * Only issue appears if try to create proxy for v3 OData service, which aligns with everything I can see that 3.5 supports up to v2 OData protocol. The error I see is quite obvious and points to incompatible version





SAP_GWFND 740 0005 SAPK-74005INSAPGWFND SAP Gateway Foundation





Any help or suggestion would be much appreciated.
author: Michael Pang
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Michael,



I have seen this error with .NET consumption of CRM services but need a
refresher. I'm pretty sure that when we had this issue, the 'guid' property of
the GW model had **not** been generated as an edm.guid, but as an edm.binary
type. Switching it to edm.guid fixed the problem, although I don't know what
version of .NET the UI developers were using.

Since there is no screenshot of the model, I can't be sure whether the guid
actually is edm.guid type or that you are assuming that? As you are working
with GWFND 7.4 the type issue might have been fixed and it is edm.guid - I
don't know ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/sad.gif)



If it is Edm.guid type and not working with .NET, there is a workaround which
we adopted until finding that the type change was a simpler option.

Change the model property to a string with 32 length. In the ABAP code, make
sure the extracted guid is converted to its C32 form before placing it in the
property value.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Cannot generate proxy for oData service using .NET 3.5

author: Michael Pang
text:
Using the oData extension framework, we managed to redefine the service and
changed the Edm.binary to Edm.guid by adding code to the DEFINE method of the
MPC_EXT class.



Thanks for the help again.
title: Re:Cannot generate proxy for oData service using .NET 3.5

Developing services on one client, testing on another
text:
We have a customer who uses an embedded Netweaver Gateway deployment. They
have 3 clients in their development system. One is used for customization.
One is used for workbench. And the last is their de facto QA system.



The last client ("QA") is set to not modifiable. The first two clients have
no master data on them at all, so we cannot test in either of those clients.
The Netweaver Gateway configuration is done in 100 and transported across to
110 and 300. So the system aliases are setup.



Development of the service is successful in the workbench client. When we
register the service, we get a green traffic signal and are able to test it in
the workbench client. Because there is no data, we can only do a metadata
test.



However when we log onto the third client ("QA"), and maintain the service,
the green traffic signal is replaced by a yellow yield signal. If we click on
"register", we are told that the service has already been registered. If we
maintain it, there is no system alias assigned to the service. Because fo
this, when we test the service, we get an error. We cannot delete the service
and re-register it again because of the not modifiable setting.



I realize this setup is a bit unorthodox, but customers are customers.
Besides asking the customer to unlock the third client, are there any other
suggestions someone would suggest?



Regards,

Gareth
author: Gareth de Bruyn
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi Gareth,



you can refer my answer from thread [Registering service on mulitple
clients](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3533981)



In transaction /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE, you can register SAP client in which you
want to perform testing.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:Developing services on one client, testing on another

author: Gareth de Bruyn
text:
Thanks. Ordinarily that would work just fine. However because the client is
not modifiable, this is a weird situation. We will just ask the client to
change the setting.
title: Re:Developing services on one client, testing on another

Beginners Question on CRUD of delivered flight Model for Travel Agency info.
author: Christopher Glander
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



this error is because while create operation, you are not clearing field
<d:agencynum>00004689</d:agencynum>



it means you are going to create record with same key and hence getting error.



Just delete this value so that it will be
<d:agencynum></d:agencynum> and then perform create operation.



you can even put breakpoint in class /IWBEP/CL_MGW_RT_SFLIGHT local
definition/implementation and at line 2114. this will be the code



> METHOD create_entity.

>

>

>

>  DATA: ls_agency TYPE stravelag,

>

>  lv_error_entity TYPE string.

>

>

>

>  io_data_provider->read_entry_data( IMPORTING es_data = ls_agency ).

>

>

>

> INSERT into stravelag values ls_agency.

so at this INSERT statement it is failing because of same key.



I hope this answers your question.



Regards,

Chandra
title:
Re:Beginners Question on CRUD of delivered flight Model for Travel Agency
info.

author: Christopher Glander
title:
Re:Beginners Question on CRUD of delivered flight Model for Travel Agency
info.

author: Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



You need not to add code anywhere. Just see the entries of table STRAVELAG in
your system and then select the next number for
<d:agencynum></d:agencynum> to create new record.



for e.g. if the current entry is 998 then pass
<d:agencynum>00000999</d:agencynum> to create new record with
travel agency number 999.



I hope this answers your question.



Regards,

Chandra
title:
Re:Beginners Question on CRUD of delivered flight Model for Travel Agency
info.
SPM3.0 Appbuilder integrated app
text:
Hi Experts,  

  

Please clear me one thing for SPM3.0 Appbuilder integrated app , is this
necessary to write odata service / gateway service in gateway service builder
?

  

Best Regards,

SK
author: Shafia Kiran
Midhun VP
text:
Yes, when SAP is the backend you have to create Odata services using gateway
service builder. The _SAP AppBuilder_ is a browser-based application
development tool for developers to easily build HTML5/JavaScript mobile
applications. The Odata services are used in appbuilder tool for the
development of mobile apps.



Midhun VP
title: Re:SPM3.0 Appbuilder integrated app

author: Didier Bueno

title: Error with Read "expected type is Edm.Binary" using /IWFND/GW_CLIENT
text:
First and foremost I am a Gateway Newbie... I created a Gateway service via
SEGW to read incident reports in EHS. We are developing a concept mobile
application for that will create and read EHS incident reports, based upon
HANA PA. I tested the BAPI's BAPI_BUS1240_GETDETAIL for the read and
BAPI_BUS1240_CREATE for the Create (both via SE37 ) and they worked perfectly.
When creating the gateway Models, I am getting the error.





Invalid key predicate type for 'Scenario'. Expected type is
'Edm.Binary'</message>

  

  

Yet the entity type it is defined as the following

  

**Scenario**| **1**| **Edm.Binary**| **0**| **0**| **0**  
---|---|---|---|---|---  
KeyDate| 1| Edm.DateTime| 0| 0| 0  
RecordNo| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 20  
CreatedOn| 0| Edm.DateTime| 0| 0| 0  
CreatedBy| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 12  
Incident| 1| Edm.String| 0| 0| 20  
Type| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 3  
Plant| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 4  
Status| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 5  
Event| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 60  
DamageType| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 21  
FunctLoc| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 30  
Equipment| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0| 18  
Langu| 0| Edm.String| 0| 0|

  
  
  

  

Here is the URL I am submitting via /IWFND/GW_CLIENT

  

/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZINC_SRV/Zinc(Scenario='00',KeyDate='2014-05-06T00:00:00',I
ncident='00000000000000000016')

  

What am I doing wrong?

  

  

Thanks for all of the assistance!!!

  

Chris
author: Christopher Glander
Lukasz Grochal
text:
In the URL you've got _Scenario='00'_ \- I bet this is being interpreted as a
string being sent and the service is expecting a Binary value.

According to OData documentation type Edm.Binary is an array of bytes up to 64
KB in size. Are you sure the type should be Binary? Won't Edm.String work?
title: Re:Error with Read "expected type is Edm.Binary" using /IWFND/GW_CLIENT

author: Christopher Glander
text:
thank you for your response..

In SEGW, when I tried to change the Data Model Entity Set Property of Scenario
from Edm.Binary to Edm.String, I get a hard Error. "data source Attribute
SCENARIO and model Property scenario have different types". So I am not sure
what to do here



Any advice is welcome.



Do i have to handle this with ABAP?



Chris
title: Re:Error with Read "expected type is Edm.Binary" using /IWFND/GW_CLIENT

author: Lukasz Grochal
text:
The problem is that the SCENARIO import parameter in BAPI_BUS1240_GETDETAIL is
defined as type RAW in SAP. That is why it gets converted to Edm.Binary when
you map your Gateway operation to an RFC function module. I'm not even sure
you can effectively use this type as the key in GET_ENTITY (or how to build a
URL that would work). What I'd do is create a ZBAPI wrapper function module
where SCENARIO would be defined as string. In the new fm I'd convert the
string coming from the OData request to RAW. Please take a look at this post
to see how a conversion can be done: [raw data to
string](http://scn.sap.com/message/7360260#7360260). Just keep in mind you
have to do that in the other direction.
title: Re:Error with Read "expected type is Edm.Binary" using /IWFND/GW_CLIENT

author: Ann Josse

title: Using simple return types in Function Import - Is it possible today?
text:
Hi All,



I've defined a function import with a simple return type of Edm.Int32 in GWPA,
but after importing it into the Gateway Service Builder, it sets the function
import to "no return", plus there appears to be no standard code in Gateway to
handle this scenario even if I redefined at a code level. Is this correct?

[![2014-05-15_12-03-59.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadIma
ge/2-15049017-453232/2014-05-15_12-03-59.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-15049017-453232/2014-05-15_12-03-59.png)

If you're wondering, I created a function import rather than using a query for
the PersonSet since I have parameters for filtering that are not part of the
Person Entity (free search value specifically) - which means I lose out on
inbuilt oData functionality like $count too
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/plain.gif).



Anyway, if the answer is this is correct, I assume I need to butcher my
Gateway model by either:

  * Returning an Entity which is not really an entity; or
  * Add my non-Person properties to Person anyway and leverage default Query behaviour like $count.



Ideally I would prefer to have a function import called FilterPersonSet and
get rid of FilterPersonSetCount which supports $count too since Gateway should
know it is returning a collection.



Cheers,

Matt



I probably should have added the better option of creating a very simple
Complex Type with a single property as the better option (though I'm warming
to butchering the Person structure just to have these fields for my scenario
and removing the need for a function import, though I dislike myself for
thinking this is okay). Message was edited by: Matt Harding
author: Matt Harding
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Matt,



Viewing this scenario from the 'other end' (SEGW), what GWPA has allowed you
to do is inconsistent. A function import cannot return scalar data types, so
the 'No return' is sort of correct. You are right in the assumption that you
might do it with a complex type. A complex type with one element does seem
like overkill, I agree, but what the hey? Get's the job done, even if it makes
us look sloppy.

I understand why you are doing this and the limitations of having to expose
elements to enable a filter on them can be a pain. That makes sense though
because you'd never know what properties were there to filter if you didn't
expose them.![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/mischief.gif)

I've had this problem too and now that it's appearing in other posts I'm
wondering if $search (OData 4) might be the answer in future?



Regards



Ron
title: Re:Using simple return types in Function Import - Is it possible today?

author: Matt Harding
text:
Hi Ron,



Thanks for the feedback. I kind of wonder if the introduction of the tooling
is the problem rather than a deliberate restriction. the reason I say that is
if you look at the example in the note (which has nothing to do with my
question) [1695674 - Support for optional parameters in function
imports](http://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1695674) \- you'll see them
refer to the following function import definition:

<FunctionImport Name="FunctionImportWithOptionalParameter"
ReturnType="Edm.Binary" m:HttpMethod="GET"><Parameter
Name="OptionalParameter" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="true"/>



which has an Edm.Binary return type - This is GW 2.0, but I'm guessing we've
lost this.



Regardless, I've just used the Complex Type and moved on. And as you say,
hopefully $search is the answer in the future - makes sense it will be.



Thanks again,

Matt
title: Re:Using simple return types in Function Import - Is it possible today?

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
I'd say the documentation of the note may be wrong in that respect. The
subject is about **input** parameters so the author may not have been so
careful about the return type part of the syntax.

NEOTIIT



If you look at the class model, the action (function import) methods
specifically support only entity or complex type settings for a return if one
is present. Code don't lie
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/cool.gif)
title: Re:Using simple return types in Function Import - Is it possible today?

author: Matt Harding
text:
Hi Ron,



I suppose part of the reason for this blog is to make sure this is understood
and confirm completely that it's not available but also to partly encourage
SAP to introduce this feature since I like nice design and don't like this
dodgy solution. e.g. That note talks about nullable options for parameters in
Function Import also, which are not available to set within SEGW which makes
calling the Function Import a bit annoying since all parameters are required
parameters otherwise. This also leads to bad design. That said, code can get
past this but I think SAP need to show Function Imports the love
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/silly.gif)



Cheers,

Matt
title: Re:Using simple return types in Function Import - Is it possible today?

title: Unable to CREATE or VIEW a project in T-code "SEGW"
text:
Hi,



As part of a training exercise, I need to first...  
1) go to T-code "SEGW",  
2) create a project/or use an existing one and  
3) import an OData file

4) create an Android App

as instructed in the course titled course - Introduction to Mobile Solution
Development for the Enterprise using the
<https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/webgui> link.



But I neither can CREATE nor VIEW an existing project in T-code "SEGW" (i.e.
SAP NetWeaver Gateway Service Builder) in that environment. The error that I
receive says "You are not authorized to create project".



Just wanted to know if anyone else has faced a similar issue earlier and what
was the workaround used to resolve it.



NOTE: I have installed all the necessary plug-ins in Eclipse as mentioned in
the below document:  
<http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-45809>

Regards,  
Aaron D'C
author: Aaron D'Cunha
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Aaron,



If this is due to user authorisation and not a namespace issue, you need a
role based on one of the Gateway templates.

You or your security admin should look for a suitable template in the /IWBEP/*
(and/or (/IWFND/*) list of templates in PFCG and generate the required roles
and assign them to your user.



You can determine the missing authority by checking in SU53 if it continues.



Regards



Ron.

resolved in the next version.

available now )

Read custom HTTP Headers in gateway service
text:
Is there a way I can read HTTP Headers that are set in the incoming request ?



I can see that we can set custom HTTP headers by the method given in the below
discussion



[Success/Error/Info Message in return of Odata Service response from
ECC](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3470565)



But I need to read custom HTTP Headers are coming in. Is there a method to do
that?
author: sivasakthi danasekaran
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



Use below code



Data : Lo_facade type ref to /IWBEP/IF_MGW_DP_INT_FACADE,

lt_client_headers type TIHTTPNVP.

lo_facade ?= /iwbep/if_mgw_conv_srv_runtime~get_dp_facade( ).

lt_client_headers = lo_facade->get_request_header( ).





Refer this [Odata, Reading Custom Header
Problem](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3561244) discussion for more information.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:Read custom HTTP Headers in gateway service

author: sivasakthi danasekaran
text:
Exactly what I was looking for!

Thanks a lot!
title: Re:Read custom HTTP Headers in gateway service
Using different entities in the same service call
text:
Hi,



I have scenario where I have to fetch data from the DB based on some filter
criteria.

The data I have to fetch is taken from a PLAN table and the fields that I have
to fetch are PLAN_ID, PLAN_DESCRIPTION, PLAN_START_DATE,PLAN_END_DATE etc.The
filter criteria I pass contains fields like MANDT,USER_ID,LANG_ID,SEARCH.



Now I have created a project where I have 2 entities.

#### FILTER and PLAN with their respective fields.



Since my filter is large and I will not know the length of the filter at
runtime im choosing to POST it as payload instead of passing it as $filter in
my GET url.



So when I use the POST method and pass the filter the create entity method
gets invoked.So I have written my code inside this method where I fetch the
plan details using the filter.

Now is there a way I can return my plan details in the same method?



**I tried making my ER_ENTITY point to the plan structure instead of the Filter structure.**



**At runtime in the debug mode it does hold the plan details but when I test in the gateway client I can see only an empty filter as the response.**



### Can anyone let me know if we can pass one entity structure as request and
return another as response?
author: sivasakthi danasekaran
sivasakthi danasekaran
text:
Hi Folks,



Any inputs?
title: Re:Using different entities in the same service call

author: Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



### Can anyone let me know if we can pass one entity structure as request and
return another as response?

This is not possible. The request and response payload will remain same as
that of entity structure.



you can have fields of FILTER (MANDT,USER_ID,LANG_ID,SEARCH) in same entity of
PLAN and can use it.



you will get all those values in IT_FILTER_SELECT_OPTIONS of DPC_EXT method.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:Using different entities in the same service call

author: sivasakthi danasekaran
text:
Hi Chandra,



Thanks for your response.



I think then I will have to use the $batch option.
title: Re:Using different entities in the same service call

author: Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Yes that can be one of the option as well.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:Using different entities in the same service call

title: The argument 01:17:33 cannot be interpreted as a number
author: Pranay Aitha
Lukasz Grochal
text:
Can you provide the request you're sending as well? It's important that the
date time parameter is passed using the correct formatting.

The Edm.DateTime is used to represent a date and time in one. The Time type in
ABAP is for time alone: HHMMSS.
title: Re:The argument 01:17:33 cannot be interpreted as a number

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
The dump is really giving you a clue.



01:17:33 isn't a number, given that the colon isn't a digit between 0 and 9.



That's a date formatted for output (text) rather than the raw value of 011733,
so somewhere you are obtaining a formatted date and passing it into the OData.
title: Re:The argument 01:17:33 cannot be interpreted as a number

title: Authentication validation
text:
Hi All,

I have a Odata service which creates a Notification when triggered from PHP.
Before triggering the service there is a logon page on front end. User need
one more service to be created to authenticate logon credentials. I suggested
that the same service(which creates notification) can be used to validate sap
logon credentials when it hits SAP server. But, still I want to understand if
there is a standard way to create a service to authenticate logon credentials
of SAP? Please help.



Regards,

Vikram.
author: John Vinukonda
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



As per my understanding if calling to OData service from frontend opens the
logon page then no need to have separate service for authentication is
required. Logon page contains login id and password i.e. basic authentication
for SAP server is performed.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:Authentication validation

author: John Vinukonda
text: Thanks for your quick reply Chandra.

System to system interaction through gateway
text:
Hi,



I'm building an mobile/desktop application with SAPUI5 -> Gateway ->HANA
as the architecture.

Now apart from the end user inputs I have a scenario where I will get data
from a system.

Is system to system interaction via OData services acceptable?



I know we traditionally use SAP PI for system - system integration.

But I do not have PI here.



So can you please tell me whether I can use OData services for this? If not I
will do a direct file upload via the application layer.



Thanks

Shakthi
author: sivasakthi danasekaran
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Shakthi,



Assuming that you are talking about OData as the means of transport at both
ends, you may want to look at OCSI.



[How to consume an OData service using OData Services Consumption and
Integration (OSCI)](http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-47366)



regards

  
Ron.

title: Re:Table as input for SAP Netweaver Gateway service

author: Muhammad Shahezad
text:
Hi vivek,

Just take table fields in one entity which you want to give as input and map
the field in PUT method and than start gateway client and write the parameters
name and values which you want to act as input for BAPI in HTTP Request Block
and select PUT method radiobutton.

And if you want in case multiple rows as input in table you have to redefine
method CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY.



Hope this will help.





Regards,

Shahezad
title: Re:Table as input for SAP Netweaver Gateway service

author: Dirk Roeckmann
text:
Hi Shahezad,

  

in order to work properly, the function module to be connected needs to have
range tables for every input parameter with multiple values. At the same time
this allows for filtering in a query.

  

hope this helps

  

regards

Dirk

Post method doesn't trigger create entity
text:
Hi,

We are trying to post parameters from Java calling Odata service. First we
call get method to get X-CSRF token and then call post method. But, while
calling both the methods it triggers get entity set only. During post it
doesn't come to create entity. We got the status code 415 as response. Data
passed from java is in Application/Json format. Please let me know if the
format need to be changed in Java or any property changes required in SAP.

Please guide.



Thanks,

Vikram
author: John Vinukonda
Dirk Roeckmann
text:
Hi John,



did you test the get method first in the gateway client transaction
/IWFND/GW_CLIENT?



Once you've got that running you can use the button 'Use as request' in the
right screen to create a correct create request. If you the switch the methode
to POST, adapt the URL and get the create running inside /IWFND/GW_CLIENT,
then use exactly that request for your JAVA application.



Hope this helps

DIrk

How to get data in multiple tables: OData : Netweaver Gateway
text:
Hi Experts,



I have a created RFC Function Module and OData Service in ECC. Service has
been registered in Netweaver Gateway.

Now the problem is the Function module is returning three tables in the ouput,
So i have created 3 entity types and Function Module

is being called 3 times when the Service is executed.



Could anyone please advise, how can we can get the data for all the 3 tables
in one go?



Regards,

Tanmay
author: Tanmay Chintamani
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



Check this blog [Improved Inside-Out Modelling](http://scn.sap.com/community
/developer-center/netweaver-gateway/blog/2013/10/17/improved-inside-out-
modelling) for more details.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:How to get data in multiple tables: OData : Netweaver Gateway

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Tanmay,



I would not develop a **custom** RFC for Gateway usage - this is, in my
opinion, very bad practice. It sounds like you expect one FM to provide three
entities at once. This isn't really viable and to make it so introduces
unnecessary complexity and constraints.

It would be preferable to construct the code for the provision of each entity
and entityset in the appropriate DPC_EXT methods - this would avoid your
problem altogether!



Regards



Ron.

Rules for OData datetime properties
text:
There have been quite a few posts about problems with Edm.datetime properties
in entities. Solutions offered are often on case by case basis, so it's hard
to figure out why things have gone wrong and what the remedy is.



This is a short discussion (I hope!) to establish some rules for edm.datetime
properties. If there are any exceptions to these rules, or some addtitional
rules, please post.



**Rule 1**

Use the Edm type **datetime**. Don't maintain dates as edm.string "for
convenience"



**Rule 2**

Make the property nullable if a null value is possible. If there is a need for
a value (mandatory) do not make it nullable.



**Rule 3**

The nullable attribute can only be correctly evaluated if the backend date
contains '00000000' as a value. ABAP date values containing spaces (this is
allowed unfortunately) will not be treated as null, but also not be able to
convert to an edm.datetime - you will get a runtime error from the server.



**Rule 4**

Be aware of the **full **property definition. Giving your "date property" a
type of edm.datetime alone is not enough to ensure proper conversion during
OData parsing. See rules 5, 6 & 7.



**Rule 5**

If the date property is part of a DDIC structure used for the entity
definition, and that component is a DATS (elementary D type), then you can
place a D type value in it directly, e.g.



[![Untitled-1 copy.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14455587-302351/478-143/Untitled-1+copy.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-14455587-302351/Untitled-1+copy.png)

[![Untitled-1 copy.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14455587-302304/276-83/Untitled-1+copy.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveS
ervlet/showImage/2-14455587-302304/Untitled-1+copy.png)[![Untitled-1 copy.png]
(http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-14455587-302305/476-58
/Untitled-1+copy.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-1445
5587-302305/Untitled-1+copy.png)



Valid ABAP:



 ls_entity-date = sy-datum.

  

Dates of this type can fall into the "date is null but not valid" trap
mentioned in rule 3.  



**Rule 6**

If the date property is **not **part of a DDIC structure and the entity
definition is "freeform", you can also place a D type value in it directly if
you assign its backend data typing: e.g..



[![Untitled-1 copy.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14455587-302352/263-71/Untitled-1+copy.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveS
ervlet/showImage/2-14455587-302352/Untitled-1+copy.png)[![Untitled-1 copy.png]
(http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-14455587-302353/450-35
/Untitled-1+copy.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-1445
5587-302353/Untitled-1+copy.png)

[![Untitled-1 copy.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14455587-302360/450-171/Untitled-1+copy.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-14455587-302360/Untitled-1+copy.png)



Dates of this type can fall into the "date is null but not valid" trap
mentioned in rule 3.



**Rule 7**

If the date property is **not **part of a DDIC structure, the entity
definition is "freeform" and there is no backend data typing, the target must
be filled as if it were a timestamp; this is because the MPC generated
property type is a packed type field. In rules 5 and 6, the MPC generated
property type is a D type.

Note that the edm.datetime will contain an additional portion representing
microseconds, which is not normally filled unless drawn from a high resolution
timestamp (i.e. more detailed than sy-uzeit).



Dates of this type **cannot **fall into the "date is null but not valid" trap
mentioned in rule 3.



**Rule 8**

You may also use TIMESTAMP as the component type in a DDIC structure entity
base instead of DATS. This can be converted as per rule 7.







I'm sure there are more things we can add here: for example, I found that
"json format" feed dates can look a bit "odd" - are they right or wrong?



Regards



Ron.
author: Ron Sargeant
Stefan Schreck
text:
Hello Ron (and all),



Note that Edm.DateTime is not part of the V4 specification of odata.org
anymore.

To anticipate V4, I recommend to use Edm.DateTimeOffset instead; this is
already supported by NetWeaver Gateway.



Regards,

Stefan
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Thanks Stefan.



Just when we think we've got to grips with the date and time options, it
changes again!



Expect some additions to this page when OData 4 comes along then...



regards



Ron.
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ralf Handl
text:
Hi Ron,



The only difference between DateTime and DateTimeOffset is that the latter
contains time-zoned values, e.g. a trailing Z for UTC.



Without time zone sender and receiver need out-of-band information to
correctly interpret the values. DateTime was defined to have an undefined
offset, so we removed it from OData 4.0. Which wasn't an easy decision.



Regards!

\--Ralf
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ralf Handl
text:
If the ABAP data type is just a date (DATS) without time portion, you will
want to use the new type Edm.Date once V4 arrives in your Gateway.



My recommendation: use Edm.DateTimeOffset for time stamps (here the time zone
matters) and Edm.DateTime as a work-around for pure date fields. Additionally
annotate the date property with sap:display-format="Date", see [SAP
Annotations for OData Version 2.0 |
SCN](https://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-44986#jive_content_id_Element_edmProperty).
This will tell clients that only the date portion is relevant.



Regards!

\--Ralf
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Tejas Chouhan
text:
Noh..gives me Invalid key predicate. ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emotic
ons/confused.gif)![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/sad.gif)
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Tejas,



I've looked at this in the full context, and it doesn't look like a
particulary consistent design. It makes no sense to assign a date to part of
the key and not use it for updates. You either remove it from the defined key
or pass it back in the PUT. Otherwise you are not complying with OData! You
can't have an "optional" key field!
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/confused.gif)



Regs



Ron.

title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Sorry that's just the result of awful design
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/cry.gif)



If you want to get help can you open a new thread as this isn't an issue with

title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ralf Handl
text:
A better design would be to have an entity set "PurchaseOrders" with a single
key property "PoNo" and a non-key property "Date". Then you can formulate a
lot of questions your current design does not allow:



POs created at a given date:

 GET ~/PurchaseOrders?$filter=Date eq datetime'2014-05-23T00:00'



Number of POs created at a given date:

 GET ~/PurchaseOrders/$count?$filter=Date eq datetime'2014-05-23T00:00'



POs created in a given period :

 GET ~/PurchaseOrders?$filter=Date ge datetime'2014-01-01T00:00' and Date
le datetime'2014-03-31'



etc.
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Aksel Wienke
text:
Hi Ron,



I followed your Rules, but I get a Dateformatt error - actually I got the
before I found you thread :-)



I have a Gateway-Hub and a IW_BEP-Backend.

In the Backend an attribute is bound to a structure according to rule 5

Edm.DateTime <-> DATS Length 8



In the service implementation (READ) I'm doing this:

er_entity-gbdat = ls_customer-gbdat.



In debugger it is looking good: er_entity-gbdat = 19530321 (e.g.)



But calling the service leads to the error "Format invalid: Gbdat - Value:
21.03.19"



If changed to Edm.DateTimeOffset I'm getting the error "21.0-3.-19" can't be
interpreted as a number...



Seems like the DATS is somewhere converted to its output (21.03.1953) and
after this it is put into the Edm.-field...



Do you have an idea what is happening?



Wishes,

Aksel



SP:

Backend:

IW_BEP -> 200 08

Hub:

SAPGW_FND -> 740 07
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Aksel



The date type assignment in your model may be wrong. Edm.DateTime may imply
that the date is type D but generation errors can create a different
(incorrect) type. Check the 'type' declaration in the MPC to make sure of the
type assignment.



Otherwise, I cannot see why this might consider the date to be invalid.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Rules for OData datetime properties

author: Aksel Wienke
text:
Thank you very much. You brought us on the rigtht track:

In MPC we saw that our field Type GBDAT had a conversion exit inside: PDATE.
That lead to the error. We created a new type without conversion exit and it
works.

Wishes,

Aksel

How does gateway know to call CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY method?
text:
Hi Experts,



 I have implemented CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY method of DPC extension class. Also
I am using POST.



 At runtime how does the gateway know that it has to call
CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY?



 In which class the logic is written like



 If HTTP method is POST then call CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY?



 What is the purpose of MPC and DPC class? What is the program flow that is,
which class is called first and then next etc?



 Please help.





Thanks

Gopal
author: Gopalkrishna Baliga
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Gopal



The OData parser inspects the payload of a POST. If the body is formatted
according to the deep insert conventions, it will try to extract the relevant
entity segments.



With regard to MPC and DPC. MPC (model provider) defines your service so that
it can provide a service document and metadata feed. DPC (data provider) is
used to access the data that the service represents.

You do not edit the DPC or MPC if they are generated by SEGW; build code goes
into the EXT classes. MPC_EXT rarely needs editing.

You can have a service that publishes a model with no DPC (e.g. define then
implement), but not the other way around; you can query the metadata but
operations cannot be invoked until implemented in the DPC extension.  
During execution, the model is opened at runtime by the gateway framework so
that it can be used to contextualise the entities, payloads and navigations
that will invoke the relevant parts of the DPC.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:How does gateway know to call CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY method?

text:

out.

Do I have to set any profile parameter or is there any other function module
that I should call explicitly to get this working?
author: sivasakthi danasekaran

title: How to create a service with different input and output?
text:
Hi Experts,





 I have created a service which has 2 entities.



 DeliveryHeader



 DeliveryItems



 StatusOutput





 Association has been defined for DeliveryHeader and DeliveryItems.



 I am using deep insert option.



 My input request message is:



 {

 "DN_No" : "123",

 "ShipTo" : "CNZ",



 "DeliveryItems" : [{



 "DN_No": "123",

 "Item_No": "1",

 "Quantity": "10'

 }]

 }



I want my output to be different entity structure that is of StatusOutput.



{



 "StatusOutput" : {



 "Code": "100",

 "Text" : "Successfully created DN"

}



}





But I am getting output same as input.



What I have to do to get the desired output? Please help!



In my create_deep_entity I have coded like this:



TYPES: BEGIN OF t_output.

 TYPES: StatusOutput TYPE
ycl_prj_create_dn_mpc_ext=>TS_STATUSOUTPUT,

 END OF t_output.

  

x_output-StatusOutput-code = "100".

x_output-StatusOutput-text = "Successfully created DN".

  

 copy_data_to_ref(

 EXPORTING

 is_data = x_output

 CHANGING

 cr_data = er_deep_entity ).











Thanks

Gopal
author: Gopalkrishna Baliga
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Gopal,

  

"What I have to do to get the desired output?"

  

Firstly, I think you are confusing Gateway with RFC, they are **not the same
thing. **I suggest you learn OData before touching Gateway to avoid this
confusion.

  

Asking that same question again, the answer is - nothing. You do not need
anything like this "status output" in your model, just accept the HTTP
response, which is doing what you want - telling you if it succeeded or
failed.  

  

Someone will probably point you at function imports, but that would be a wrong
answer to the question ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/sad.gif)

  

Regards

  

Ron.
title: Re:How to create a service with different input and output?
Batch request compression
text:
Dear Gateway Community,





I was wondering if it is possible to have the response of a Gateway batch
request (READ only) using the gzip compression.



Indeed, I've noticed that after I had grouped my requests into a batch (just
like best practices guides recommend), the payload went from 838Kb to 7.1 Mb
because the response was not using any content-encoding.



I'm using the Data.js library used by SAP themselves and tried adding the
Accept-encoding header parameter without succes.



v_ar request = {_

_ headers : {_

_ "Accept-Encoding": "gzip, deflate"_

_ },_

_ requestUri : '/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGW_SERVICE/flightCollection',_

_ method : "GET"_

_ };_





_ var batchRequests = [request];_

_ OData.request({_

_ headers : {_

_ "Accept" : "application/json",_

_ "X-CSRF-Token" : token,_

_ "Accept-Encoding": "gzip, deflate"_

_ },_

_ requestUri : '/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGW_SERVICE/$batch',_

_ method : "POST",_

_ data : {_

_ __batchRequests : batchRequests_

_ }_

_ }, function () {_

_ console.log('success');_

_ debugger;_

_ }, function () {_

_ console.log('failure');_





_ }, OData.batchHandler);_





Maybe that's got something to do with the fact that the response content type
with batch requests is multipart/mixed.



Thanks in advance for any help on this matter,

Cheers,

Paul
author: Paul Bertrand
Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Paul,



I don't know about gzip compression, but what have you done to minimise the
payload in the first place?

How large are your entities? Are you including "unused" properties from the
backend business model?

Have you tried using JSON (this will greatly reduce the size of payloads).



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Batch request compression

author: Paul Bertrand
text:
Hello Ron,



Thanks for your answer.



Single GET request (non batch) are triggered with the "Accept-encoding" HTTP
header parameter set to "gzip" which indicates the server that, if supported
by the server, the response payload should be compressed.



The entity collection has 20 000 entries. The JSON format reduces the payload
but not significantly enough to make it much faster.



Best regards,

Paul
title: Re:Batch request compression

text:
I am not able to figure out with this information. please let me know, how you

approach?



Please share the code of get_entity method as well. somewhere in the code,
language key might be getting passed as Chinese.

title: Re:Gateway http response wrong language

author: Bart Geudens
text:
Code Based.



Here is the code of the get_entity method:



DATA itab_sales_org TYPE TABLE OF ZSTRUC_sales_org.

 DATA wa_sales_org type zstruc_sales_org.

 DATA value type /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair.





READ TABLE it_key_tab INTO value WITH KEY name = 'ID'.





SELECT DISTINCT a~vkorg b~VTEXT FROM A079 AS a INNER JOIN TVKOT AS b ON
a~vkorg =

 b~vkorg INTO TABLE itab_sales_org WHERE a~vkorg EQ value-value.



 DATA: ls_entity LIKE er_entity.



LOOP AT itab_sales_org INTO wa_sales_org.

 ls_entity-id = wa_sales_org-id.

 ls_entity-name = wa_sales_org-name.



* APPEND ls_entity TO er_entity.

er_entity = ls_entity.

 ENDLOOP.

  

  

Regards,

  

Bart
title: Re:Gateway http response wrong language

author: Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
you need to write query as



SELECT DISTINCT a~vkorg b~VTEXT FROM A079 AS a INNER JOIN TVKOT AS b ONa~vkorg
=

 b~vkorg INTO TABLE itab_sales_org WHERE a~vkorg EQ value-value **AND
b~SPRAS=sy-langu.**



as you are not passing language, by default it is selecting chinese as
language.





Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:Gateway http response wrong language

author: Bart Geudens
text:
Thank you!



It's fixed now.



Kind regards,



Bart
