System Alias in Netweaver Gateway
text:
Hi Experts,



Can anyone lease explain system alias and its purpose?I know that system alias
is just a wrapper for RFC destination.I want to know what is that
wrapper(System alias)?Why do need System alias since we are having RFC
destination to connect to SAP system?





Regards,

Arjun
author: arjun mohan
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Arjun,



You are right about system alias that it is a wrapper around RFC destination.
But this is not the only thing that is wrapped around. System alias contains a
combination of a lot more information/config like Local GW, Local App, RFC
destination and Software Version. Based on the details provided in the system
alias, the gateway decides where to search for the DPC and MPC classes. This
also signifies the Box which we are referring to like is it CRM or ECC or
something else.

If we have to use RFC destination alone then how we will be able to add those
extra parameters with RFC. Thus we have a provision of System alias.



I hope this solves your curiosity.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:System Alias in Netweaver Gateway

author: arjun mohan
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Now I understand the purpose of System Alias.Can you please tell me about the
use of Local GW and Software version parameters in System Alias.



Regards,

Arjun
title: Re:System Alias in Netweaver Gateway

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



Local GW signifies that the Gateway is deployed on the same server. We check
this option if we are using Embedded approach. The sap help portal says:

> The system that is responsible for processing (managing and storing) the
data of an inbound request is the local SAP NetWeaver Gateway instance itself.

>

> If you activate Local GW for a SAP System Aliascalled LOCAL, the RFC
Destination is usually NONE.



The software version signifies the supported version of service. These entries
are SAP provided and can not be changed. The sap help portal says:

> This setting is specified by the content scenario you are using. Typically
it is DEFAULT.
title: Re:System Alias in Netweaver Gateway

author: Meenu Hans
text:
Hi Arjun,



Another advantage of having system alias is that it can be transported within
the landscape. Like its created in the development system and then transport
it to quality system so the alias can be maintained same but just once the RFC
destination needs to be assigned. And since alias is being used everywhere
like activating and maintaining services etc... the same entries need not be
modified in the next system.



Also check the below blog:

[All About System Alias and Routing of Requests in SAP NetWeaver Gateway
](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2013/05/30/system-alias-and-
routing-of-request-in-sap-netweaver-gateway)



Regards,

Meenu
title: Re:System Alias in Netweaver Gateway

author: Brad Pokroy
text:
Hi Diego,



Quickest and easiest way to setup a NW 7.4 MaxDB instance which will include

Cheers,

Brad

SAPUI5 program consuming gateway service
text:
Hi,



I have Netweaver Gateway Server set-up. I have Eclipse Kepler installed on my
machine with SAPUI5 plugin added to it.



Now I want to write a small SAPUI5 program which can consume the service
created in Netweaver Gateway server.



Can someone please let me know any websites/SDN sites which can help me get
trained on this and create my own demo application.



I am a java developer and know JQuery & javascript. But I have no
knowledge of ABAP programming. So please let me know if I need to have ABAP
programming knowledge also if I have a to create a service in Netweaver
Gateway sever.



My objectives are :



1) Create a service in Netweaver Gateway Server

2) Write SAPUI5 program in Eclipse to consume the service created in Netweaver
Gateway Server. (One doubt I have is,..once I create a SAPUI5 program, will I
have to deploy it in Netweaver Gateway server? ..If not then where will this
SAPUI5 program will reside?)

3) Run the SAPUI5 program.



Thanks.
author: Sun 197895
Sun 197895
text:
Can someone help me with the info. This I think is the standard question but
since I am new to UI5 programming ple assist me.
title: Re:SAPUI5 program consuming gateway service

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



I'll try to answer your queries.

> I want to write a small SAPUI5 program which can consume the service created
in Netweaver Gateway server



Check this link of end to end guide [End-to-End How-to Guide: Building SAPUI5
Applications on SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP 7.31 Consuming Gateway OData
Services](http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-33792) . You can ignore the
installation and configuration part of gateway. But it will be good if you go
through the whole document to get the overall knowledge. This guide builds an
app which consumes GW service as well.



> please let me know if I need to have ABAP programming knowledge also if I
have a to create a service in Netweaver Gateway sever

Yes, you need to know at least a bit of ABAP in order to create a service in
Gateway (you can create a service using graphical tools also but you will not
be able to understand how the program flows and how to debug the things).



> Can someone please let me know any websites/SDN sites which can help me get
trained on this and create my own demo application

You need to explore and practice a lot in order to be trained but this link
may help you in getting started well <http://www.bluefinsolutions.com/Blogs
/John-Murray/April-2014/Getting-started-with-SAP-Fiori,-NetWeaver-Gateway/>



> once I create a SAPUI5 program, will I have to deploy it in Netweaver
Gateway server? ..If not then where will this SAPUI5 program will reside?

You have two options for deployment: NW Gateway server and you localhost (i.e.
Apache Tomcat server). I would suggest that while you are learning UI5 go for
deploying on localhost since it will be easy to see the changes done. Once you
are done with your app, deploy it on GW server. You can check this link [Just
1 way of developing UI5 apps with localhost against Gateway services (&
more).](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-
end/blog/2014/08/09/just-1-way-of-developing-ui5-apps-with-localhost-against-
gateway-services)



Hope it helps in getting you started.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SAPUI5 program consuming gateway service

author: Sun 197895
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for the links .... I have gone through them on high-level and they
seems to be educating.



Thanks again.
title: Re:SAPUI5 program consuming gateway service

RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?
text:
Hi,



Our current Landscape of Gateway is "Central HUB Deployment" where all the
Gateway Add-on's installed on Gateway Server. i.e. IW_FND, GW_CORE, IW_PGW and
IW_BEP is also installed on Gateway System.



As IW_BEP is installed on Gateway System, we are doing gateway development in
Gateway system itself by creating Remote-Enabled Function Modules in Backend
ECC system if no standard BAPI or RFC function module is not available and if
available using the standard itself.



In Gateway Development, we are using Remote option to access the Function
Module and on top of those function modules/structures we are creating all the
gateway services in SEGW T-code and registering the service by Selecting the
Gateway System (GW_HUB system alias) and providing the Backend System alias in
the followed pop-up where it asks for System Alias.



System Alias for Gateway system is : GW_HUB

System Alias for Backend system is : ECC

  

Now we are trying to test the service, getting the below error.

[![Gateway error.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1
5654105-619574/640-319/Gateway+error.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServ
let/showImage/2-15654105-619574/Gateway+error.PNG)

  

Can anyone please suggest me how to solve the above issue.

  

Thanks in advance.

  

Regards,

Ramana.
author: Ramana SBLSV
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Ramana,



The error is due to configuration of system alias. You need to check the Local
App flag for the system alias that you are using to connect to backend.

I think following links will help you:

  * Check the Troubleshooting section in [How To Implement a Remote RFC Function Call from the Gateway Service](http://scn.sap.com/blogs/ui5-for-abap/2013/12/26/how-to-implement-a-remote-rfc-function-call-from-the-gateway-service)
  * [When use LOCAL alias Function failed could not find the function - Best-Built Applications - SCN Wiki](http://wiki.scn.sap.com/wiki/display/BBA/When+use+LOCAL+alias+Function+failed+could+not+find+the+function)
  * [All About System Alias and Routing of Requests in SAP NetWeaver Gateway](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2013/05/30/system-alias-and-routing-of-request-in-sap-netweaver-gateway)



Regards,

Ekansh

Thanks for your reply. I have mentioned configured steps below. please suggest

I have done the above configuration settings and I have developed a gateway
service using SEGW in Central HUB system. Now when Im registering the service
in SEGW, Im choosing the Central Gateway HUB system (NGW) and registering the

[![Gateway Error.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1

title:
Re:RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Ramana,



I do not see any problem in the config you stated above. This error of
'function call failed' is because of the system alias associated with the
service.

> I have seen the error in /IWFND/ERROR_LOG , there its showing that the
destination is NONE because in SPRO we have checked For LOCAL APP checkbox
for Backend system alias (ECC) because of which the above error is coming.

'For Local App' signifies that the IWBEP classes are at the local system(i.e.
the Gateway system itself) for this system alias. This means that the gateway
will look for the classes in the gateway system itself and while executing the
method, it will call the RFC with the given destination. And this is the case
in your scenario also because you have developed the service at the gateway
system itself. Thus 'For Local App' checkbox needs to be checked for system
alias ECC .

As you state that in the error log, it is showing that the destination is
NONE. I think that you have used system alias LOCAL instead of ECC while
associating the service with backend system. Please check the associated
system alias. It should be ECC.

[![system alias in service.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloa
dImage/2-15656659-620324/system+alias+in+service.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/serv
let/JiveServlet/showImage/2-15656659-620324/system+alias+in+service.PNG)
title:
Re:RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?

author: Ramana SBLSV
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks again.



I have maintained Backend ECC RFC Destination against Backend ECC System
alias. but when we are testing the service, system automatically taking NONE
as RFC destination because of "For Local App" flag was checked. Based this
flag, In standard code itself it's taking NONE as RFC destination even though
ECC RFC destination maintained against system alias.



Please see the standard code in class " /IWFND/CL_DESTIN_FINDER" method
"GET_SYSTEM_ALIAS_INFO".



here SAP hard coded if "For Local App" is checked then RFC destination as
NONE.



Please check this code and suggest me if further config needs to do.



Regards,

Ramana.
title:
Re:RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Ramana,



> I have maintained Backend ECC RFC Destination against Backend ECC System
alias. but when we are testing the service, system automatically taking NONE
as RFC destination because of "For Local App" flag was checked. Based this
flag, In standard code itself it's taking NONE as RFC destination even though
ECC RFC destination maintained against system alias.

>

>

>

> Please see the standard code in class " /IWFND/CL_DESTIN_FINDER" method
"GET_SYSTEM_ALIAS_INFO".

>

>

>

> here SAP hard coded if "For Local App" is checked then RFC destination as
NONE.



The method and the class you are referring is related to IWFND component. I
checked this code, this code is used while finding the destination for the
IWBEP classes. They have hard coded this destination to NONE because when you
have checked the 'For Local App' flag which states that the IWBEP classes are
at the same system. Thus RFC destination is not required.

**Please don't get confused with the above RFC destination. This RFC destination is pointing to the system which has IWBEP classes and not to the system where your FM is.**



To check the RFC destination which is pointing towards the ECC system for
calling the FM, please put an external breakpoint in the GET_ENTITYSET method
like below:

[![debug.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-15656995-
620420/640-230/debug.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-
15656995-620420/debug.PNG)



go to LO_DP_FACADE :



[![dest finder.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-156
56995-620427/640-372/dest+finder.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/
showImage/2-15656995-620427/dest+finder.PNG)



Go to MO_DEST.........



[![alias.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-15656995-
620422/alias.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-15656995
-620422/alias.PNG)



Here your system alias should be ECC in your case. I still doubt that you have
mapped this to LOCAL. Please paste your screenshots. I still need the
screenshot of the previous post which shows alias.



Regards,

Ekansh
title:
Re:RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?

author: Ramana SBLSV
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks once again for reply.



I got the solution by implementing the Enhancement-Spot
"/IWBEP/ES_DESTIN_FINDER".



In this Spot, we have a method
"/IWBEP/IF_DESTIN_FINDER_BADI~GET_RFC_DESTINATION" which contains Importing
parameter IS_DEFAULT_SYSTEM_ALIAS_INFO where we can get the System Alias with
RFC Destination and an Exporting parameter EV_RFC_DESTINATION which is default
blank.



Here i have passed the RFC Destination and now it's working fine.



Thanks for your support.



Regards,

Ramana.
title:
Re:RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Ramana,



Its good to hear that you made it work.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

But still I would say that if the gateway configuration is correct and you
have provided the correct system alias(Hub to Backend) at the time of
registering the service, **there is really no need of enhancing** the standard
code at all.

It would have been much better if you could have checked the associated system
alias instead of passing the RFC destination directly in the enhancement
implementation.

P.S.: you can check the system alias when you click the maintain button under
service maintenance node in SEGW.



Regards,

Ekansh
title:
Re:RFC call ended with "Communication Failure" exception in Gateway Service
testing?

author: Ramana SBLSV
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for your support.



In SEGW, i have selected Gateway SYSTEM (NGW) for registering the Gateway
Service and in the pop-up i have selected Backend ECC System Alias (ECC).



Actually, the Enhancement was already implemented without implementing the
method because of which the method is not getting executed which causing blank
in Destination field.



I think, i can try by deactivating the Enhancement so that that Enhancement-
Spot will not be called and may be it takes through config of system alias.



Regards,

Ramana.

How to call Function Import from SAP UI5 and get the return object in table?
text:
HI,

 I am New to UI5 .i have created odata gateway service with function
Import that will take single parameter as importing parameter and return the
data in table.My problem is I am not getting how to consume data from function
import in SAP UI5 and how i can display the returned data in ui5 table.

can Any Help me out regarding the issue.





Regards

author: laxmikant soni
Florian Pfeffer
text:
Hello LK,



if you are using the service with an ODataModel you can use function
"callFunction" of the ODataModel to call a Function Import.



The function has several parameters which allow you to specify the required
information. For a detailed description of the parameters please have a look
to the API reference.

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.model.odat
a.ODataModel.html#callFunction>



Here is a simple example:

    
    
    oDataModel.callFunction("TestFunctionImport", // function import name
     "POST", // http method
     {"parameter1" : "value1" }, // function import parameters
     null, 
     function(oData, response) { }, // callback function for success
     function(oError){} ); // callback function for error

If the function import call was successful the "success callback function" is
called. Within that you can access the returned data.



Regards,

Florian

title: What do 'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)' do.
text:
Once we create a project in Netweaver Gateway and follow few other steps to
create a OData service, we come across two methods which I think are very
important for service implementation perspective.



Can some one please tell me what exactly does these two methods do :
'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)'



I am a Java developer / SAP Portal consultant so thinking that these are ABAP
specific. But if some one can explain briefly I think I will be able to
understand though I have min ABAP knowledge.



Thanks in advance.
author: Sun 197895
Kedar Tingikar
text:
Hi,



'GetEntitySet (Query)' is to get a array of values i.e. if you need to get
multiple records from a database table/tables

  

'GetEntity (Read)' is used to get one single record i.e. all the details of a
particular employee/customer.

  

Look at this blog - [Lets code CRUDQ and Function Import operations in OData
service!](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/03/06/let-s-code-
crudq-and-function-import-operations-in-odata-service)

  

Hope this helps.

  

Regards,

Kedar
title: Re:What do 'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)' do.

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



GET_ENTITY method is used when you need to fetch a single record from the
database/backend. (READ)



While GET_ENTITYSET method is used when you need to fetch multiple records
from the backend. (QUERY)





> Can some one please tell me what exactly does these two methods do :
'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)'



I think the above mentioned is the only thing these methods do. If you are
asking in terms of ABAP code, there are pretty clear comments mentioned in the
generated code. Let me try to explain a generalized code of both methods.



In GET_ENTITY:

Firstly there is variable declaration part where we define the structures or
containers for FM import, export parameters, RFC destination etc. Then there
is code written to fetch the keys from the HTTP request. The code below this
extracts the RFC destination to call the FM from the system alias associated
with the service. Then it calls the FM based on the RFC destination. If any
error occurs during this or there is an error msg coming in return table, the
code below this handles errors. Then the response from the FM is transferred
to the er_entity structure.



In GET_ENTITYSET:

The same variable declaration part. Then we extract the filters from the HTTP
request. The long CASE statements extracts the filter values and put in the
containers. Then RFC destination extraction and calling of FM followed by
error handling part. Then there comes the code which handles paging. The
paging is handled by 'skip' & 'top' parameters. 'Skip' means that skip the
mentioned no. of records from the response while 'Top' means the maximum no.
of records to be processed from the starting (e.g.: for the first time you may
request skip=0 and top=100, then you will get top 100 records. After this you
may request skip=100 and top=200, then you will get the next 100 records
starting from 101 and ending at 200). Then we loop the output table based on
the skip, top values and transfer the values to the et_entityset table.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:What do 'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)' do.

author: Sun 197895
title: Re:What do 'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)' do.

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Sun,



possibly there is just a missspelling of the entity set name - UserInfoSample,
or UserInfoSampleSet or similar.  
It must be exactly the same name that you used when trying Get_Entityset, just
with the value of the key property appended in brackets, as you did.



To find out the right name, you can call the service document at

[http://<server>:8000/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI5_SAMPLEUSERINFO_SRV](http://
<server>:8000/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI5_SAMPLEUSERINFO_SRV).

Have a look at the <app:collection> entries in the service document that
you receive as response. The values of the attribute href in each collection
is the name that you have to use.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:What do 'GetEntitySet (Query)' & 'GetEntity (Read)' do.

Hello Moritz,



I must admit that I haven't done that tutorial, but let's check some basic
stuff ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif) From that error
message I understand that either:

  * The ProxyServlet class is missing / is incorrect (normally any errors would be signalled when you tried to deploy the app to the cloud)
  * The ProxyServlet was not deployed at the designated path (the web.xml file does not contain the correct specs)
  * The Destination name is not correct (You posted the destination definition, it seems OK)

The connectivity.js file content seems all right. So, please check that the
ProxyServlet class contains the right code (page 40 - onwards from the
tutorial), and that you didn't forget to put the servlet mapping and resource
reference specifications in the web.xml file (page 48/49).



Regards,

Serban

Retrieve X-CSRF-Token from sapes1 ZGWSAMPLE_SRV
text:
Hi,



x-posted from: [Retrieve X-CSRF-Token from sapes1
ZGWSAMPLE_SRV](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3676975)



I have successfully retrieved the "X-CSRF-Token" token value for a number of
the other odata services (eg ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV) on sapes1 but I'm unable to
get a response that includes the cookie & header being set in the response
when accessing
<https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGWSAMPLE_SRV/> .



My username and password are correct, I can retrieve data in ZGWSAMPLE_SRV but
when i set "X-CSRF-Token" to "Fetch" the response headers do not include a "X
-CSRF-Token" entry.



Using the "REST Console" in chrome I can provide the details of a failing
request.



Request Headers:

Authorization: Basic SOMEVALUE

X-CSRF-Token: Fetch

Accept: */*

Connection: keep-alive

Content-Type: application/xml

Origin: chrome-extension: //rest-console-id

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML,
like Gecko) Chrome/39.0.2171.95 Safari/537.36





Response Headers:

Status Code: 200

server: SAP NetWeaver Application Server / ABAP 702

dataserviceversion: 2.0

ntcoent-length: 2574

content-type: application/atomsvc+xml





The CSRF token header is missing.





Am I doing something wrong? Is the service mis-configured? What do I need to
try to overcome this?



Cheers,

Tom
author: Thomas James
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Thomas,



the check of the X-CSRF-Token is deactivated for that service, thats why the
ICF does not create tokens. If you start transaction SICF and navigate to you
service node, view the service details and press button "GUI configuration" on
the tab Service Data. There you can see the parameter ~CHECK_CSRF_TOKEN = 0,
which means "deactivated".



Unfortunately you can not change it by yourself. You may switch to edit mode
and change the parameter, but when you try to save it, an error message will
show up (that happens for my user, at least).



Official guidance is provided here:

<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/de/B3/5C22518BC72214E10000000A44176
D/content.htm>



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Retrieve X-CSRF-Token from sapes1 ZGWSAMPLE_SRV

author: Thomas James
text:
Hi Ringo,



Thanks for the info, helped a lot, looks like that service is setup in
"Compatibility Mode for SP02" mode. So using 'X-Requested-With=XMLHttpRequest'
allowed me to post modifying requests.



(Apologies for the ignorance on the SAP side of things, I'm not a SAP guy,
just a developer trying to integrate with a client SAP system).



Cheers,

Tom

expand query option in OData
text:
Hi Gateway Experts,



I want to know **expand** query option in OData web service.It's meaning and
use.



If available,please provide one example.





Regards,

Arjun
author: arjun mohan
jitendra kansal
text:
Hi Arjun,



I can give you an example on this. Lets take very simple publicly available
OData service: <http://services.odata.org/Northwind/Northwind.svc>



If you execute [http://services.odata.org/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Categories?$
expand=Products](http://services.odata.org/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Categories?
%24expand=Products)

you will get all of the Categories with the related Products entities inline
in the response.



You may also look at this blog for detailed explanation
<http://scn.sap.com/people/volker.drees/blog/2012/10/26/step-by-step-guide-to-
build-an-odata-service-based-on-rfcs-part-3>



Regards,

JK
title: Re:expand query option in OData

author: arjun mohan
text:
Hi Jitendra,



Thanks for your answer.



What I understood is Giving **"EntitySet(input)/?$expand=navigation name**" is
same as "**EntitySet(input)/navigation name**".



If yes then what is the use of $expand?
title: Re:expand query option in OData

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Arun,



The main difference is that a navigation returns the navigation target only.

Expand is an expansion of the original source, i.e. you get the source entity
plus the requested expansion inline as one response.

You may also request more than one expansion to be in the response, which
navigation alone cannot do.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:expand query option in OData

author: J Dinesh
text:
Hi Arjun,



  Use _$expand__ insert_ for associated entity types when you need to fetch
or create deep data.





A request with a `$expand` query option enables the reading of entries of an
entity together with an associated entity. For example, if you want to read a
Sales Order (therefore an entity) and all its associated Items you can execute
one request using the `$expand` query option.

Example

`<https://><server>:<port>/.../<service_name>/SalesOrders('0500000000')?$expan
d=SalesOrderItems`

You can also run a `$expand` statement to retrieve multiple Sales Orders
(therefore an entity set) including related SalesOrderItems.

Example

`<https://><server>:<port>/.../<service_name>/SalesOrders?$expand=SalesOrderIt
ems`



Regards,

Dinesh
title: Re:expand query option in OData

Error while accessing web service through logical port
text:
Hi All,

We are trying to consume SOAP Service from an external source and expose it
via odata service (SAP Gateway service).

I followed <http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-49811#comment-559114> wich was very
helpful.

But I am stuck with the logical port creation. After creating the logical port
I am getting an error while trying to access the web service.

Following are the exact steps I following. I used
<http://wsf.cdyne.com/WeatherWS/Weather.asmx?WSDL> for testing purpose

Please help.



**STEP 1:** SE80->Package->$TMP->EnterpriseServices->contesxt menu->create

**STEP 2:** Enterprise services create dialog box

  * Object type : service consumer
  * Generation source : External wsdl/schema
  * wsdl/schema source : URL

author: jhansirani j
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Jhansi,



I can give you hints, at least.



1\. Possibly your Consumer Proxy works correctly and the Wheather API service
provider just blocks pings. See note the note at
<http://solveissue.com/note?id=1947516>. Did you test a service method call
from SE80 already, using F8 on your Service Consumer object, then selecting
your Consumer Proxy created in SOAMANAGER and one of the Webservice Methods?
If that works, everything is fine.



2\. If that does not work, I suggest that you create another Consumer Proxy in
SOAMANAGER, this time not manually, but WSDL-based, using the URL from STEP 2
in your post. You can try to have SOAMANAGER download the WSDL file from that
URL, or you could also download the WSDL from that URL manually and specify
the path to the downloaded file in SOAMANAGER.



Best regards, hope it helps,

Ringo

Can gateway service work with windows 8 native app
text:
Hi all,



I have sap system with gateway configured. can we build native windows 8
application just by directly using the service url or is there any other
middle ware required.



thanks
author: Thivi Deepan
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Deepan,



I can see two options:



A) A native WinJS application in JavaScript, using frameworks like AngularJS
and Apache Cordova or PhoneGap. For the SMP, this is a REST API application,
further info see here:

[http://help.sap.com/saphelp_smp306sdk/helpdata/en/c8/430e1e9dfc47c985d9f7c488
4c6234/content.htm?frameset=/en/c8/430e1e9dfc47c985d9f7c4884c6234/frameset.htm
&current_toc=/en/7c/01cda6700610149b10c2f2a86d335b/plain.htm&node_id=6
](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_smp306sdk/helpdata/en/c8/430e1e9dfc47c985d9f7c48
84c6234/content.htm?frameset=/en/c8/430e1e9dfc47c985d9f7c4884c6234/frameset.ht
m&current_toc=/en/7c/01cda6700610149b10c2f2a86d335b/plain.htm&node_id=6)



B) Native application in C# using the SMP SDK 3.0 as described here:

[http://help.sap.com/saphelp_smp306sdk/helpdata/en/f9/374b08e4594aa78c833add4d
142b45/content.htm?frameset=/en/dc/74ea98916d4baf9780bbcd929c1a9f/frameset.htm
&current_toc=/en/7c/01cda6700610149b10c2f2a86d335b/plain.htm&node_id=4
11&show_children=false](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_smp306sdk/helpdata/en/
f9/374b08e4594aa78c833add4d142b45/content.htm?frameset=/en/dc/74ea98916d4baf97
80bbcd929c1a9f/frameset.htm&current_toc=/en/7c/01cda6700610149b10c2f2a86d335b/
plain.htm&node_id=411&show_children=false)



Option A) is easier to adapt to iOS or Android or any other OS supported by
PhoneGap / Cordova, if that requirement comes up later. I did it myself, it
works, but its a lot more manual implementation effort for a serious business
application than it is with option B). I did not have the chance yet to try B)
by myself.



Best regards and lots of success,

Ringo
title: Re:Can gateway service work with windows 8 native app

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
If you dont have SAP Mobile Platform you still have basically the same
options.



In case A) you can handle the access to the OData service using a JavaScript
framework like ODataJS or another one from this list:
<http://www.odata.org/libraries/> > JavaScript.



In case B) you develop the C# manually and use a library or a template such as
the OData Client Code Generator to access the OData service, see
<http://www.odata.org/libraries> > .NET



No need for an additional middleware, unless you have loads of mobile clients
and want to use SAP Mobile Platform.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Can gateway service work with windows 8 native app

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Deepan,



were you able to plan your project with the answers given, or is your question
still open?



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Can gateway service work with windows 8 native app
SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning
text:
I suspect that this should be something that can be easily answered (well at
least I'm hoping that this is the case).



We have recently created a NWG Project that has a number of entities etc The
use of this should go live within the next week.



I'm now being asked to provide other rest services where all I really want to
do is extend the entities already created. However I don't want to disrupt or
have to retest the services that are about to go live.



Now from what I have read it looks like I can just create another version of
the project / service ???? Can anyone point me to something that explains how
to do this ?
author: Mike Jackson
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



Check this blog [Extending a service using the Gateway Service
Builder](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/08/08/extending-a
-service-using-the-gateway-service-builder)



This feature is available from SP09



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Mike Jackson
text:
Chandra,



Many thanks for the post. I've read through this document and whilst useful I
don't think it gives me what I'm looking for. I know from what I've read you
can have different versions of a service. When you originally create it's
version 1. When you call this via a URL you don't have to include the 'v1'
element in the URL because I'm guessing it's implicit. When a second version
is created (not sure how) you identify the service by using a 'v2' in the url.
This then enables me to have 2 versions in operation and means I've not
affected the first application.



Do you have any idea how to achieve this ?



Mike
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Mike,



as far as I understand your requiement, Chandras hint is what you need. You
create a new service in SEGW, and choose Data Model -> Extend -> OData
Service (GW).



[![Extend.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-15707266
-633284/450-269/Extend.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/
2-15707266-633284/Extend.png)



This opens the Redefine Service Wizard, where you select your existing service
with existing version number, e.g. 0001. In the next screen, you select all
the entity types which you require in your extended service.



After completion of the wizard, generate the runtime artifacts of the extended
service. This brings up the "Model and Service Definition" dialog:



[![Register.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-157072
66-633286/450-352/Register.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showIm
age/2-15707266-633286/Register.png)

Usually you should be able to choose the same service name as for the existing
service, but with a higher service version.



Now the final and decisive step is to register the service in the Gateway
system (or embedded Gateway component). I do it from the Gateway system with
/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE, usually you can also do it from the backend system.  
Register the service with the same technical service name as the existing
service, but higher version number (you will need a new package to create the
service in it).



When that is successful, you see the service as a separate line in the service
catalog in /IWNFD/MAINT_SERVICE (exampel with three versions):

[![ServiceCatalog.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-
15707266-633290/450-187/ServiceCatalog.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveSe
rvlet/showImage/2-15707266-633290/ServiceCatalog.png)

Now you can call the version 2 by inserting ;v=2 into the URL just after the
service name (select the service in the catalog and start the Gateway Client
to try it):



[http://<gateway_server>:port/sap/opu/odata/sap/<external](http://<ga
teway_server>port)_service_name>;v=2/<entity_set_name>



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
I forgot to mention how to add new entity types and operations to the extended
service. Be careful with it. Official detailed help is provided here:

<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/en/c9/72141b977a4182930c192bfaf2c0b
1/content.htm?frameset=/en/12/de22512c312314e10000000a44176d/frameset.htm>



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Mike Jackson
text:
Ringo,



Many thanks for your response.



Sorry I'm still a little confussed. When you create a project say ZWFM_SRV,
create entities etc then come to generate the runtime artifacts the technical
name becomes the name of your service in this case ZWFM_SRV.



Now if you then create another project say ZWFM2-SRV and then redefine the
Entities as you suggest then generate the artifacts the technical name will be
ZWFM2_SRV which means when you call the service
"opu/odata/sap/ZWFM2_SRV/?????" you would **not** need to use version number
because it's a different service in the url so what's it's point ? or am
missing something obvious - sorry if the question is stupid !



Mike
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
I dont believe you or anybody else arround here is stupid, its just complex
somtimes. ;-)



The name of your project in SEGW is entirely independent from the the service
name that you register. Thus, your project name can be ZWFM2-SRV, but the
generated runtime artifact in the backend can have the Technical Service Name
ZWFM_SRV, version 0002, and the Technical Service Name under which the service
is registered in the Gateway system can be ZWFM_SRV as well, with version
0002.



I admit, I do not understand yet under which conditions you can still change
the service name and version when registering the service in the Gateway.
Thats why I already pay attention to the Technical Service Name and version
as well as to the Model Name and version when generating the runtime artifacts
for the first time in SEGW (see second screenshot in my first post). Those are
two different steps where you get a dialog for choosing service names and
versions: first when generating the runtime artifacts in the backend, and then
when registering the service at the Gateway System or component.
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Mike Jackson
text:
Ringo,



Many thanks for your reply and sorry for delay in getting back to you. The
sap help link that you sent out was particulary useful although took a while
to go through and understand which I think I do now.



So couple of questions :-



(a) Is this the only way you know of to extend an existing OData model

(b) Could I just copy an existing project rather than redefining because I
could still use the same Technical Service Name with a different version - do
you know of any best practice guides for this



Again many thanks



Mike
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Mike,



copying a Service Builder project has the disadvantage that you can only copy
the service model and generated service operations (defined by mapping, e.g.
to RFC/BOR or Search Help). Any operations implemented with your own ABAP code
will not be copied to the new project, despite marking the checkbox "Service
Implementation" in the Copy-Wizard.



You would have to do copy manual coding by yourself from the old classes to
the new ones in a copy-and-paste-orgy, plus adapting the data types to the
ones belonging to the new project - similarly to the process described in the
SAP Help page that you found helpful.



Apart from the mentioned SAP Help page I do not know a best-practise guide on
service versioning - Id love to read one and I believe there is room for
improvement in the Gateway Service Builder regarding that topic.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Mike,



did one of the options (extend or copy) work for you, so that your question
ins answered?



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Mike Jackson
text:
Ringo,



We have done a little more testing using the redefines functionality based on
the official SAP documentaton link you provided but to be honest this is a
little complex and I don't like the fact we have to change standard SAP code
to extend the service methods associated with entities by simply adding more
attributes. This would also complicate maintnence and support goign forward.
It feels like SAP still have work to do in this area. So we may well simply
copy the existing project and then enhance.



Many thanks for your help though and I will close the post with answered.



Cheers



Mike
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project / Service Versioning

author: Ringo Liebscher

Hi Gaurav,

[![Step_3.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-15716876
-635905/450-271/Step_3.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/
2-15716876-635905/Step_3.png)

title: Re:Issue while creating web service with structure input and table output

author: Gaurav Subramanian
text:
Hi Ringo,



Thanks for your inputs. I am using an Table as output, which has different
naming conventions from other's. Also, the input is an structure or individual
fields. So, i am still looking for a solution that satisfies my requirement.



Thanks and Regards,

Gaurav.
title: Re:Issue while creating web service with structure input and table output

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Gaurav,



the value of OData services is, that the structure of the services can be
chosen indepedently from the structure in the backend, exactly as required by
the client application. Particularly, you are free to break up results of one
function module into several entity types, if appropriate.



If the export parameters of the function module are individual fields as well
as a table, you will _have_to_ model separate entity types: one for the "main"
entity type consisiting of the individual fields, and another one for the
"dependent" entity type which reflects the structure of one line of the table.



Then you can add an association between the main entity type and the dependent
entity type. After that, you can add a navigation property from the main
entity type to the dependent entity type. Thus, if your client requests one
main entity, the result will include a link to the set of dependent entities,
and the client can follow that link to receive all the entities which
correspond to the table entries of the function module.



This structure is necessary, because OData services follow the REST webservice
paradigm. REST makes the development of client applications much easier, but
one condition for that is, that there are no table attributes in entity types.
There are entities as flat structures, and there are sets of entities. If
there is an entity which is linked to several datasets with the same
structure, then this situation has to be modeled as separate entity types with
a 1:m relationship.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Issue while creating web service with structure input and table output
Netweaver Gateway, Fiori and DUET in a Central Netweaver instance
text:
Hello,



We are in a concept study phase for implementing DUET enterprise which will
require the DUET enterprise 2.0 and the Netweaver gateway infrastructure. As
part of another project, we are also planning to deploy some Fiori apps for
users. I have been going through a lot of documentation on Netweaver Gateway
2.0, Fiori and DUET architecture. For Duet 2.0 the only requirement is
Netweaver Gateway 2.0 and Gateway can be installed on a Netweaver 7.4 instance
but according to note 1718520 the prerequisite for DUET is a SAP Netweaver 7.0
SP 8 instance. This is confusing.

We will be installing a seperate Gateway instance and the question is if we
could include Fiori infrastructure and DUET on the same instance.



1\. Are there any major disadvantages of implementing all 3 components in a
single instance as a Central hub.

2\. According to SAP note **1826531 - Add-on compatibility of SAP NetWeaver
7.4 - ABAP, **Netweaver gateway, Fiori and Duet are compatible with Netweaver
7.4, so can we have a Netweaver 7.4 as a central hub and install all 3
components?

3\. Advantages or disadvantages of installing the components on a Netweaver
7.4 instance instead of Netweaver 7.02.



The reason being that SAP recommends that these components be installed as a
separate system instead of embedding it in the Business suite and we would
like to avoid installing multiple Netweaver instances for each of the
component (increasing the administrative tasks)



We are on ECC 6.0 EHP6.



Any recommendations?



Thank you



Dee

author: Kaan Ozdogan

text:
Hi Kaan.



I hope you are trying to develop Fiori like custom application.



To build SAPUI5 applications you would need UI5 plug-ins which can be
installed in your Eclipse from either [SAP Development Tools for Eclipse -
Luna Software Repository](https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/luna/) for Luna or
[SAP Development Tools for Eclipse - Kepler Software
Repository](https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/kepler/) for Kepler.



Look at this link - [SAP Fiori - Developing Custom
Apps](http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-55585) for move info on developing custom
apps.



Please follow the space - [SAPUI5 Developer
Center](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-end) for

text:

but its not working at all. I am not facing the error that you are.



In the SAP help portal [Multiple Origin Composition - SAP NetWeaver Gateway
Foundation (SAP_GWFND) - SAP Library](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdat
a/en/bc/f72651c294256ee10000000a445394/content.htm), they have mentioned that

author: Seshaiah Machavarapu
text:
Hi,

Thank You ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Seshu
title: Re:CREATE_ENTITY Operation in Multiple Origin Composition (MOC) Support

author: Seshaiah Machavarapu
text:
Hi Ekansh,



I tried with all possibilities and found that we have some limitations for
ticket creation using MOC.



Create entity (not deep entity) without MOC will create the entity as usual.



Create entity with MOC will create the entity. But it creates entity only in
default backend system. And it does not matter whether we provide SAP__Origin
attribute in the payload. Even if you provide, there is no problem. For
example, If you provide BACKEND_1 as SAP Origin in payload but BACKEND_2 is
the default system, the create call will route to BACKEND_2, which results in
error (because the fields in the payload (corresponding to BACKEND_1) may
mismatch with the fields in the BACKEND_2 ticket create method).



Create deep entity without MOC will create the entity as usual.



Create deep entity with MOC will result in error as Inline component is not
defined or not allowed (HTTP PUT)**.**

** **

As it is mentioned in the following URL, CREATE calls cannot be done in all
configured backend systems, but **only in the default system**.



<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/en/bc/f72651c294256ee10000000a44539
4/content.htm>



Regards,  
Seshu
title: Re:CREATE_ENTITY Operation in Multiple Origin Composition (MOC) Support

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Seshu,



I checked for create. For Create with MOC, I have selected BACKEND_1 as the
default system and in the payload I have mentioned BACKEND_2 as SAP__Origin.
This is creating the record in BACKEND_2 system. If I mention BACKEND_1, it
creates in BACKEND_1.

This behavior is irrespective of the default system choosen but depends on
system alias mentioned in the payload.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:CREATE_ENTITY Operation in Multiple Origin Composition (MOC) Support

author: Seshaiah Machavarapu
text:
Hi Ekansh,

But its not working like that for me. What might be the reason?

Are using any extra headers in post request?

I have heard of changesets. Do u have any idea about them?



Please refer to SAP Note 1890049 once.



Regards,  
Seshu
title: Re:CREATE_ENTITY Operation in Multiple Origin Composition (MOC) Support

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



I have not used any other header in the request.

The concept of chageset belongs to Batch operations. The note you referred
states that they have enable MOC in batch from SP08 onward but this is
restricted to support only retrieve operations not the
Modify(Create/Update/Delete) ones in batch requests.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:CREATE_ENTITY Operation in Multiple Origin Composition (MOC) Support

Does Gateway oData filter support wildcard search e.g. search all entities
with ab* or a*b?

Aakash
author: Aakash A
Kedar Tingikar
text:
Hi Aakash,



It is possible to add filter to the oData service with wildcard something like
this:



[http://services.odata.org/V4/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Customers?$filter](http:
//services.odata.org/V4/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Customers?%24filter) =
contains(CustomerID, 'AL')

text:
Hi Aakash,



There are some limitations for $filter in gateway framework. You can check
this note <https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1574568> to get the
supported filters.



If you want to implement some custom filtering you may like to check these
links:

You may need to write some custom logic and try if it helps.



Regards,

Ekansh

Query with multiple values to single key-field
text:
Hi Experts,



We have a requirement to get the work orders from different work locations. On
the front-end screen the user can select any no.of locations where he wants
the WO's from. So, do we have any approach to get this requirement in a single
call(query) from SAP NEtweaver Gateway to ECC.



Thanks in advance..!!!
author: Sarat Mavuduru
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Sarat,



Yes we can have multiple values in one filter property. You can pass multiple
values in one property if that property is mapped to a range in the backend
RFC. In your case,

  * you have to make the locations as range table in the FM at backend
  * then in query, map the location property to that range



The URI for this type will look like:

/sap/opu/odata/sap/MY_PROJECT/EntitySet?$filter= location eq 'location1' or
location eq 'location2'



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Query with multiple values to single key-field

author: Sarat Mavuduru
text:
Thank you Ekansh..:)



It worked for me where i considered only 'low' of the range table while
importing the EntityType.

But in mapping i can see all the range parameters like sign,option, low and
high of location table are mapped as low_sign,low_option...so on. Ideally is
it a correct approach??
title: Re:Query with multiple values to single key-field

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Sarat,



does it work for you with Ekanshs hint?



As an addition: Filtering for several values separated by 'or' works as well
if you implemented the Query operation with your own code, without mapping a
function module. The method ...GET_ENTITYSET() will have the parameter
it_filter_select_options, this is the nested range table with one line for
each filter conditions that you entered in the request URI.



The GET_ENTITYSET() method generated by the framework when you map a function
module gives you a good hint how to "unpack" the range table and iterate
through the lines, you can do it the same way in your own code.



Best Regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Query with multiple values to single key-field

author: Sarat Mavuduru
text:
Hi Ringo,



Thank You for the
Info..![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

title: Connect SAP ECC system using SAP mobile application ((Dialog User- of SAP ECC)
text:
Hi All,



I am having one scenario while using SAP netwaver gateway.Describing in detail
as below:-

landscape:- ECC,SAP Netawever gateway,SAP Mobile Application.

Our Client have requirement like they want to connect SAP ECC system using SAP
mobile application ((Dialog User- of SAP ECC)

example :- They would like to relase PO using SAP mobile application.

As they are having SAP ECC dialog user ,and they wish to connect using same
user from SAP mobile application.'

They want specific user log details that who has relases PO and ssomewhat
same.

**Problem?**

**As in SAP netwaver gateway in RFC Destination we are specifying user and while invoking Odata Service with same user we are connecting to system.**

**So how to maintain log for specific user in case of release of PO.**

**  
**

**Thanks**

**Surekha  
**
author: Surekha Dhumal
Krishna Kishor Kammaje
text:
Surekha,



You should not put a user name in RFC destination.

Trust should be established between Gateway and ECC and "current user" check
box should be checked. Basis team will be able to do this.



Thanks

Krishna
title:
Re:Connect SAP ECC system using SAP mobile application ((Dialog User- of SAP
ECC)

author: Surekha Dhumal
text:
Thanks Krishna



But then how to pass username and password for RFC Destination.

As when hitting Odata Service it will ask for netwaver gateway credential.

Can you explain me ?



Thanks

Surekha
title:
Re:Connect SAP ECC system using SAP mobile application ((Dialog User- of SAP
ECC)

author: Krishna Kishor Kammaje
text:
A user should have same name in both Gateway as well as ECC. When a trusted
RFC connection is made, it will not ask for user credentials. Logging into
Gateway is good enough.
title:
Re:Connect SAP ECC system using SAP mobile application ((Dialog User- of SAP
ECC)

author: Surekha Dhumal
text: Thanks Krishna..
title:
Re:Connect SAP ECC system using SAP mobile application ((Dialog User- of SAP
ECC)
Gateway OData service on multiple clients (IDES)
text:
Hi guys,

I have ERP 6.0 EHP7 SP1 IDES version of SAP Business Suite standard
installation with NW 7.41 embedded. I am using NW Gateway (backend, not HUB
deployment) to expose Odata web services. I have managed to expose and read
data on client 001, where i also made all the customizing neccessary to enable
the NW Gateway, maintain system aliases etc..



Now, since all the demo data for IDES is in client 800, i don't know how to
configure NW Gateway and system aliases so that i can expose data from client
800. I have searched for an answer to this a lot, but most of the information
i could find was for a HUB deployment.Also, if i login to client 800, i can
see that the customizing settings for NW Gateway are not there. So i have a
couple of questions:

  1. How do i set-up my NW Gateway and system aliases to expose data also from client 800?
  2. Aren't gateway customizing settings cross-client? How come the gateway is disabled in client 800 but enabled in 001 on the same system?
  3. If not, how do i configure the gateway in client 800, where do i set the HTTP port etc.



I am quite new to SAP / NW, so sorry if what i'm asking is something stupid.



Regards,

Primo
author: Primo Brecko
Timo Rb
text:
Hi Primoz,



did you receive an answer to your question? I have the same question.



Best regards

Timo
title: Re:Gateway OData service on multiple clients (IDES)

author: Primo Brecko
text:
Hi Timo, i didn't get any answer (i guess SAP considers this too basic a
question ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)). I did
however manage to retrieve data from client 800, using the web service
configured in client 100.



This can be achieved with the sap-client parameter:



[http://mysap/my_service_path/MySet/?sap-
client=800&filter=](http://mysap/my_service_path/MySet/?sap-
client=800&filter=)...



This way you are returing data from client 800. But how to have a dev/prod
scenario on a single embedded deployment, i have yet to find out. By this i
mean how to have a service definition in client 100 that you can transport to
client 800 (using ie. SCC1) on demand, so these two clients can use different
service definitions. Altough i did transfer ws configuration from 100 to 800
using SCC1, looks like you have to set-up the aliases in a right way to
achieve the above and i don't know how.



Hope it helps in any way, i was on a long "vacation" from SAP, and i just
started dealing with this problem again .. If i find anything i Will let you
know, you can do the same of course
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Martin

title: Re:Error Handling through SAP Gateway

author: Arun Chembra
text:
Hi,



Yes, its possible for that you have to add little code in ABAP level to show
successful message in device. You have to do the following steps.



1\. Capture the message in RFC RETURN table.

2\.

if lt_return is not initial.

 read table lt_return into ls_return index 1 .

 message = ls_return-message.

 raise exception type /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception

 exporting

 textid = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error

 message = message.

endif.



Thnaks,

Arun
title: Re:Error Handling through SAP Gateway

author: Pranay Aitha
text:
Thanks Arun.



It worked for us.

text:
Why only index 1?



IF lt_return IS NOT INITIAL.

 mo_context->get_message_container( )->add_messages_from_bapi(

 it_bapi_messages = lt_return

 iv_determine_leading_msg = /iwbep/if_message_container=>

 gcs_leading_msg_search_option-first ).



 RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception

 EXPORTING

 textid = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error

 message_container = mo_context->get_message_container( ).

ENDIF.

Is Netweaver Gateway is pre-requisite for SAPUI5 and Fiori?
text:
Dear Experts,



I have been browsing many posts but unable to find an answer to my question
and request your help. Is Netweaver Gateway required for SAPUI5 and Fiori ?



Thanks,

Sathish
author: Satish Kamath
Kedar Tingikar
text:
Hi Satish,



For Fiori, yes you need Netweaver Gateway as the application delivered by SAP
needs to be deployed in and launched from Gateway system and the the required
components(IWFND and others) are only available in Gateway. There are many
options of deploying gateway systems - [SAP Gateway deployment options in a
nutshell](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2013/05/27/sap-netweaver-
gateway-deployment-options-in-a-nutshell)



For UI5 application the answer is both yes and no. It depends from where you
get data and where you wan to deploy/host the application.



Hope this helps.
title: Re:Is Netweaver Gateway is pre-requisite for SAPUI5 and Fiori?

Pass multiple values to a field in filter with and condition
text:
Hi,



I have created one oData service and i want to pass two values to a field with
'and' Condition. I tried it but its giving me 500 internal server error



I tried to execute following url:



[http://xx.xx.xxx.:xxxx/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGW_MOB_TRIAL_SRV/ProjectListSet?$fi
lter=QUERY_TABLE](http://xx.xx.xxx.xxxx) eq 'TVKOT' and DELIMITER eq '|' and
FIELDNAME eq 'VKORG' and FIELDNAME eq 'VTEXT'



In this i want to pass 'VKORG' and 'VTEXT' to Fieldname.



But its giving 500 Internal server error.



Can anyone help me in this issue?



Appreciate your help.



Thanks,

Supriya
author: SupriyaD Sawant
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Supriya,



this error typically comes up if you had the code generated (e.g. by RFC/BOR
mapping) and use a filter criterion that is not mapped. Did you implement the
code by yourself, or did generate it?



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Pass multiple values to a field in filter with and condition

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
If the code was generated by mapping to a data source, then you can only set
filters on those attributes which are mapped as input parameters in the
mapping definition in SEGW. In that case, check first whether all of the
attributes Query_Table, Delimiter and Field_Name are mapped has input
parameters.



If not all attributes are mapped, I can see two chances:



A) If your data source (like RFC function module) has input parameters or
table parameters or changing parameters for your filter attributes, then do
map these parameters in SEGW as input parameters. With simple function module
parameters, filtering will only work with one condition of sign 'EQ', not with
several conditions or with other comparison signs. Only if the function module
has range table parameters (selection tables), the code will be generated for
all comparison signs and for more than one condition.



B) If there are filter attributes left for which A) does not work, then you
will have to write you own ABAP code for filtering on them. Redefine the
generated method PROJECTLISTSET_GET_ENTITYSET in your Data Provider Extension
Class ..._DPC_EXT. In the redefined method, first call the method of the base
class (the code will already be there: CALL METHOD super -> ... ). Then
take the result table et_entityset from that call and identify and copy only
the rows matching your additional filter criteria to a new table of the same
type, which you can assign to et_entityset as final result.



In the example request in your post, FIELDNAME eq 'VKORG' and FIELDNAME eq
'VTEXT' seems a bit unsual to me - as the attribute fieldname can only have
one value at one time, I expect that the condition will never be fulfilled and
your result set will always be empty.



Best regards and lots of success,

Ringo
title: Re:Pass multiple values to a field in filter with and condition

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Supriya,



As Ringo said, its not supported by default if you have used RFC/BOR mapping.
But you can always redefine the method as per your requirements. If you have
used RFC mapping, you will find this piece of code



* Check if the supplied filter is supported by standard gateway runtime process

 IF lv_filter_str IS NOT INITIAL

 AND lt_filter_select_options IS INITIAL.

 " If the string of the Filter System Query Option is not automatically
converted into

 " filter option table (lt_filter_select_options), then the filtering
combination is not supported

 " Log message in the application log

 me->/iwbep/if_sb_dpc_comm_services~log_message(

 EXPORTING

 iv_msg_type = 'E'

 iv_msg_id = '/IWBEP/MC_SB_DPC_ADM'

 iv_msg_number = 025 ).

 " Raise Exception

 RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception

 EXPORTING

 textid = /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception=>internal_error.

 ENDIF.



Here it checks the filter string and if it satisfies the given condition, it
raises exception that this type of filter string is not supported. To suite
your requirements, you can comment out the exception part and retrieve your
parameters from the lv_filter_str by your custom ABAP code. Now you can pass
those parameters to your RFC.



Here I am assuming that your RFC is designed in such a way that it can take
multiple values for a parameter. (Like you may have a table with only one
column 'Fieldname' so that you can receive multiple values of property
FIELDNAME.)



Otherwise, you may have mapped FIELDNAME property to the range table of
Fieldname so that you can directly send multiple values to single parameter.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Pass multiple values to a field in filter with and condition

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Please be aware, if you change the generated code in the DPC class, then your
changes will be lost when you make updates to the parameter mapping and re-
generate the project. For that reason I personally prefer to make manual
additions in the redefined method in the DPC_EXT class.



Regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Pass multiple values to a field in filter with and condition

author: Ekansh Saxena
text: Yes Ringo, DPC_EXT serves that purpose.
title: Re:Pass multiple values to a field in filter with and condition

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Supriya,



were you able to receive the data with the filter criteria that you needed?
Please just let us know whether you questions is answered.



Best regards,

Ringo

author: Sri Patlu
text:
Hi Ringo ~ I understand there are some constraints with SAP Odata
implementation, especially around the $filter command. Is it possible to do
wildcard searches with Odata services implemented on SAP Gateway? One of the
use cases we have is to look up customer by name, for example a query that
looks something like URL below.



[https://<server>:<port>/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_HELP_SHIP_TO_
SRV/Customerhelp_shiptoSet?$filter=contains(Mcod1,'BRK')](https://kdwsapydi01.
graybar.com:18001/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_HELP_SHIP_TO_SRV/Customerhelp_sh
iptoSet?%24filter=contains\(Mcod1,%27BRK%27\))



When we execute this query on SAP Gateway we get an error that states contains
in invalid command with an SAP note that lists SAP's Odata implementation
limitations.



Any suggestions on how we can get around this limitation?



Thanks in advance for your response!

please be as kind as to start a new discussion for your question, as it is
different from the original question. I will be happy to do my best and answer

answers to it later on.



Best regards,

Ringo

title: Re:Problem in Creating a Gateway Service
Support for wild card search in SAP Gateway based Odata services
text:
I understand there are some constraints with SAP Odata implementation,
especially around the $filter command. Is it possible to do wildcard searches
with Odata services implemented on SAP Gateway? One of the use cases we have
is to look up customer account by customer name, for example a query that
looks something like URL below.



[https://<server>:<port>/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_HELP_SHIP_TO_
SRV/Customerhelp_shiptoSet?$filter=contains(Mcod1,'BRK')](https://kdwsapydi01.
graybar.com:18001/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_HELP_SHIP_TO_SRV/Customerhelp_sh
iptoSet?%24filter=contains\(Mcod1,%27BRK%27\))



When we execute this query on SAP Gateway we get an error that states
"contains" is invalid command with an SAP note that lists SAP's Odata
implementation limitations.



Any suggestions on how we can get around this limitation?



Thanks in advance for your response!
author: Sri Patlu
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Sri,



I have personally worked successfully with the URL option **startswith**. For
example access to a service of the Gateway Service Consumption Demo System:



[https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGWSAMPLE_ SRV/BusinessPart
nerCollection?$filter=startswith(CompanyName,'S')](https://sapes1.sapdevcenter
.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGWSAMPLE_%20SRV/BusinessPartnerCollection?%24filter=st
artswith\(CompanyName,'S'\))



Even more interesting for you is the URL option **substring**. Just as with
startswith, the Gateway Framework will convert this into a string in import
parameter IV_FILTER_SELECT_OPTIONS of the method *_GET_ENTITYSET of the
*_DPC_EXT class of your entity set. You can use the parameter within a WHERE
clause of a SELECT statement when implementing _GET_ENTITYSET. However, please
check what you receive in IV_FILTER_SELECT_OPTIONS for all required cases
beforehand, using the debugger!



SELECT * FROM your_table

INTO TABLE lt_your_target

WHERE iv_filter_select_options.

  

If that is not sufficient you can check what you receive in the import
parameter IT_FILTER_SELECT_OPTIONS, which you can use as a selection table in
a SELECT statement or in any function module which takes a selection table as
input parameter.



If you have the implementation generated by RFC/BOR mapping, then startswith
and substring will only work with the generated code if the function module
has range tables as input parameters and you mapped these input parameters.



There are two ways of using substring. Both take the starting position of your
pattern within the attribute value which is searched - please see SAP Note
1922246 for details. The first option:



$filter=substring(FirstName, 1 ) eq 'amina'

-> Generated filter condition: NAME_FIRST LIKE '_amina'



The second option additonally takes the number of characters which must be
equal:



$filter=substring(FirstName, 1 , 3 ) eq 'ami'

-> Generated filter condition: NAME_FIRST LIKE '_ami%'



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Support for wild card search in SAP Gateway based Odata services

author: Sri Patlu
text:
Hi Ringo ~ Thanks very much for your prompt reply and detailed explanation of
the options to do wild card searches in Gateway. Your suggestions have been
very helpful. I have been able to successfully use URL options startwith. In
the process of testing URL option substring, I believe some authorization
issue is preventing me from executing this call as I get a valid response but
no data. Working with Security to resolve the authorization issue and will
provide an update soon.



Regards,

Sri
title: Re:Support for wild card search in SAP Gateway based Odata services
Android Deep Insert in Odata Service Issue
author: Teh Lynn

title: POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service
text:
Hi guys,



I stumbled across the following problem:

I use the domain poc_timestamp in an entity type inside of my OData service.
The targeted format is Edm.decimal.

When I try to access the data via URL, this is the result:
CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_NUMBER. The argument '10.03.2015 07:27:07' cannot be
intepreted as a number.



Do you have any idea on how to get these datetimes into my Edm.decimal
structure without changing my domain?

  

Thanks for you help in advance,

  

Dominik
author: Dominik Rosch
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Dominik,



Unfortunately, a property of the type Edm.Decimal can not hold a value with
colons ":" and with more than one decimal point. At first sight, I can see two
chances to solve the issue, given that you do not want to change the existing
domain:

  

a) In your service implementation, remove all decimal points and colons from
the value, before you hand it over to the property of the type Edm.Decimal.
Thus you can stick to your existing domain and to Edm.Decimal at the same
time, if that is really important for you. In the implementation of write
operations, you would have to insert the decimal points and colons at the
correct positions before writing the values to the database.



b) Change the property type to Edm.DateTime and manage to fill the property
correctly in your service implementation. This depends on the data type used
within the definition of the domain POC_TIMESTAMP - which data type do you
use?





Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service

author: Dominik Rosch
text:
Hi Ringo,



thank you for your answer, I will definitely try out alternative a); but b)
seems to be the nicer version.

POC_TIMESTAMP is standard SAP; the data type is DEC 21 with 7 decimal places.



Also, there is a output characteristic defined which limits the output length
to 26 with a specific conversion routine. Is it possible that this could also
be part of the problem?



Best,

Dominik
title: Re:POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Dominik,



As far as I know conversion routines for domains are used only when a value is
displayed through a Dynpro field associated to the domain via a data element.
Furthermore, your example value producing the error is far shorter than 26
digits. Thats why I dont believe your issue comes from the output
characteristics of the domain, but rather in the colons and several decimal
points, which do not fit into a DEC type variable.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service

author: Dominik Rosch
text:
Hi Ringo,



I tried out your first approach and let go of the decimal points etc.

But I still got that problem.

More specific: my et_entityset only accepts the following format:

 YYYYMMDDhhmmss.mmmuuun



So whatever I try to cut in the Method of my DPC-Class, the returning
parameter only accepts the above format.

The structure of et_entityset is automatically assigned to my entity-type
which is derived from the DDIC-Table POC_C_PROC_CHNGE. The attribute we're
talking about is CHANGED_TIME and cannot be changed.



So is there any way of changing the format of my et_entityset without changing
my entity-type?



Best,

Dominik
title: Re:POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Dominik,



if you do not wish to convert the value into the format accepted by the
existing entity type, then you have to change the data type of the property,
e.g. to Edm.DateTime or as last resort Edm.String, so that your value will be
accepted.



To do that, you first need to delete the association of the entity type to the
DDIC type. Navigate to the list of entity types in the project and delete the
content in the column "Name of ABAP structure type":



[![Delete association.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImag
e/2-15834936-668875/450-238/Delete+association.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servle
t/JiveServlet/showImage/2-15834936-668875/Delete+association.PNG)



Afterwards you may navigate to the list of attributes for the entity type and
change the EDM data type of the property:



[![Change Edm Type.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-15834936-668932/Change+Edm+Type.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/
showImage/2-15834936-668932/Change+Edm+Type.PNG)



You should then be able to save and generate the project successfully.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service

author: Dominik Rosch
text:
Hi Ringo,



thank you for your approach. Over the weekend I got another idea to solve this
problem.



As my entity types all base on CDS-Views, I actually redefined the timestamp-
fields via substrings:



    
    
    substring( cast(created_time as abap.char( 23 )), 1, 8) as conv_created_date,
    substring( cast(created_time as abap.char( 23 )), 7, 6) as conv_created_time,

Thank you though, your ideas took me to the right track!



Best,



Dominik
title: Re:POC_TIMESTAMP Integration in OData Service

Is it possible to create a webservice using RFC that has importing parameters
??
text:
Hi,



I am new to segw.

I want to create a webservice using a function module that takes importing
parameter and I want to get table data based on the passing parameter.In the
tables section of RFC I declared a table and based on the importing parameter
I want to populate the table and get as output.

So, I want to pass a parameter . I want to know how to create a webservice for
that..



Thanks in advance,

Tejaswi.
author: Ayyapusetty Tejaswi
Scott Stefanich
text:
Hello Ayyapusetty,



**Short answer**



Yes, it is possible ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)





**Long answer**



[OData Best Practices](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/en/c6/fd2651c
294256ee10000000a445394/content.htm) has a helpful suggestion in relating REST
terms to ABAP. If you see:



GET ~/EntitySet?$filter=...&$orderby=...&$top=...

  

think:

  

SELECT * FROM EntitySet WHERE ($filter) ORDER BY ($orderby) UP TO ($top) ROWS

  

  

I suggest creating a RFC enabled function module which imports a parameter
with a [range table or structure type](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpda
ta/en/ac/db22512c312314e10000000a44176d/content.htm?frameset=/en/ac/897dccbf89
485dba0053ecbbe69397/frameset.htm&current_toc=/en/ad/612bb3102e4f54a3019697fef
65e5e/plain.htm&node_id=349) (sign, option, low, and high components) and
exports a table. The import parameter corresponds to an OData $filter and an
ABAP WHERE condition.



In the GetEntitySet (Query) operation of the Entity Set's Service
Implementation, a property to be filtered can be mapped to the function
module's importing parameter with a range type: In the mapping, append a row
and enter the Entity Set property to be filtered. Then, click and drag the
function module's Data Source Parameter (the import range parameter) to the
Data Source Parameter field of the Entity Set Property. You should be prompted
to confirm the range's sign, option, low, and high component mapping.



The blog [Detailed step by step procedure for Creating Gateway Service with
all the CRUD Operations and testing them in Service Explorer
Part1](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2013/12/22/steps-in-creating-gateway-service-with-all-the-crud-
operations) contains an example in which a Query operation is mapped to
BAPI_MATERIAL_GETLIST using a range Data Source Parameter.



Regards,

Scott

parameters ??

OData Service with multiple entity set for Create SO:
text:
Hi Experts,



I want to create a OData service for create sales order, using
BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2. For this I have created multiple entity/entity
sets i.e. I need to pass Order Item, Order Partner and Partner Address as
table fields to call above BAPI to Create Sales Order. Kindly suggest how to
proceed further, because now I am little confused, where (In Service
Implementation) I should call the BAPI, because now I have three entity sets
and of course there is no association in all of them. Probably I may be wrong
in approaching "Create Sales Order" OData, Please advice. However, it is clear
if I create a custom structure (Consist of mandatory fields from all the three
above required entities) and fill all the fields in the single entity/entity
set this is achievable, but I want to use the straight BAPI and use the table
structures of the BAPI directly.

Thanks & Regards

Saurabh
author: Saurabh Mishra
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Saurabh,



There is association between your three entities: OrderHeader, OrderItem and
OrderPartner. There may not be any referential constraint (no common key among
all these) but still the association holds true.

You need to create association and navigation properties. Then you need to
implement the create_deep_entity method in order to receive your payload and
create a sales order. You can check this link on [Step by Step development for
CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY
operation](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/04/27/step-by-step-
development-guide-for-createdeepentity-operation)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:OData Service with multiple entity set for Create SO:

author: Saurabh Mishra
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for your reply, but still I am not aware of your point - "**There may
not be any referential constraint (no common key among all these) but still
the association holds true.**" - How do I create this in OData service? it
would be good if you share some example or screen shot.

  

Thanks & Regards

saurabh
title: Re:OData Service with multiple entity set for Create SO:

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Saurabh,



> "**There may not be any referential constraint (no common key among all
these) but still the association holds true.**"

I meant that there may not be any common property between Header entity and
Item entity as I saw in the given BAPI table structures. But still you know
that there is a association between these two. So you can go ahead and create
a association but without providing referential constraints which is nothing
but common properties. For example:

[![salesorder.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1584
2753-671273/salesorder.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/
2-15842753-671273/salesorder.PNG)

Since I am able to create associations, I went ahead and created navigation
properties in header entity. Now I will pass my item level and partner level
data to these nav. prop. in the payload and will receive all three in the
deep_entity method(you have to implement the code).



Hope this makes the statement clear.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:OData Service with multiple entity set for Create SO:

author: Hemendra Sabharwal
text:
Hi Saurabh,



Ekansh is correct, "Where" to do this, please see below screen for your
consideration. You will do while creating association wizard Step-2:

 [![Pic.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-158436
33-671426/254-152/Pic.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2
-15843633-671426/Pic.PNG)

Thanks,

Warm Regards

Hemendra

Ekansh & Hemendra
