author: Tomas Svoboda

title: How to get multiple records from a service using HTTP GET?
text:
Hi experts



 I have a REST based SAP Gateway service. This service has a key field
called DeliveryNumber. It returns PGI data for the given Delivery Number.



 It works fine when for one Delivery Number using the below url where
'345667' is one delivery number.



 <http://xxxxxxxx/getpgidata('345667>')



 What I have to do if I want more than one delivery number details? How
will my url look?



 For example if I need to get PGI data for DN numbers 12345 and 678989



 Please help.



Thanks

Gopal
author: Gopalkrishna Baliga
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Gopalkrishna,



Till now you are using GET_ENTTITY method to get the PGI data of one Delivery
Number i.e. Read scenario. Now you want the data of more than one delivery
numbers so you need to use GET_ENTITYSET method of this entityset.



If you are using standard BAPI then check if you can pass multiple delivery
numbers in that or not. If there is no provision of passing multiple numbers
as input, you need to use a custom FM which accepts multiple delivery numbers.
For this, you need to make delivery number as range(with SIGN, OPTION, LOW,
HIGH fields). Then map your delivery number property to this range in
GET_ENTITYSET method.



The HTTP Request URL would be something like: (say DeliveryNum is the key)



<http://><server>:<port>/sap/opu/odata/ZXXXX/getpgidata?$filter=(
DeliveryNum eq '123' or DeliveryNum eq '456' )



Regards

Ekansh
title: Re:How to get multiple records from a service using HTTP GET?

author: J Dinesh
text:
Hi Gopalakrishna,



 You have to use GET_ENTITYSET method to fetch multiple
records . If you are using RFC then create two import parameters and pass
those numbers to the RFC and include it in where condition in your select
querry .



Regards,

Dinesh Jeyasurian.
title: Re:How to get multiple records from a service using HTTP GET?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



Did you get your answer? If yes, please close this thread.

[How to close a discussion and
why](http://scn.sap.com/community/support/blog/2013/04/03/how-to-close-a
-discussion-and-why)

look for feedback in this community as well:



[How complex are your OData models? Need your Feedback !
](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2015/03/18/how-complex-are-your-
odata-models)





Best Regards,

Andre
author: Andre Fischer

title: How do you write your EntitySet Paging?
text:
Hi There

Recently I have been asked by a couple of customers to help update their ABAP
Development Standards to adapt standards for Gateway developments.



As I see it standards from a high level are about lowering the cost of
ownership, make code easy to maintain, easy to reuse and easy to re-factor.



With that in mind how are you writing your Netweaver Gateway Entity Set
Paging? How are you handling $top and $skip in your ABAP code?
author: John Patterson
John Patterson
text:
I'll start by answering my own question, hopefully it gives context into why i
am asking.



I have and use 3 different techniques



1\. SELECT UP lv_max ROWS. DELETE it_tab TO iv_skip

lv_max = $top + $skip



2\. Use CURSORS, similar Open SQL to above but use OPEN CURSOR, FETCH NEXT
CURSOR etc. to control which entries are returned



3\. Use Native SQL, CL_SQL_STATEMENT with SELECT LIMIT $top OFFSET $skip



Option 1 has some limits when it comes sub queries and joins, but is easy to
read debug and understand as its Open SQL



Option 2 is easy to read and understand but remember having issues getting
customers to adopt, especially if there are SLA's around Cursors etc.



Option 3 the scope of what you can do increases, which makes it harder to
understand, maintain and re-factor and debug, but I see as probably the best
option as we should adopting more SQL and pushing down our code to the DB
anyway



hopefully you see the reason why i am asking the question now, multiple ways
to solve the same problem, which should be adopted as a standard and why?



JSP
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Jason Scott
text:
I've tended to use your option (1). I'd say it's the simplest of the methods
but then most of the services I've built have been pretty simple.

I'm not sure that I'd advocate the direct sql option though only because the
whole purpose of open sql was to generalise such that it will work over any
database. But then.... How often does a customer change DB? Probably to HANA
soon....



HANA is a different story though where SAP advocate "push down".
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: John Patterson
text:
Cheers



Exactly what i was thinking.



Most ABAP standards i read have been adopted from Big 4 consulting standards
of the 90's, there is still a big emphasis on "Open SQL only", also there is
still an emphasis on "One Database Server" and promotes using buffer tables
and avoiding Order By etc.



If you know you are moving to HANA in a couple of years, do you adopt old best
practices on new techniques?



I don't want to advocate using Native SQL, however I think to do OData
effectively in ABAP you need to get closer to the metal.



For example Master Lists in a Fiori-Like application, out of the box the
binding has paging, then you add filters, sorts and grouping all of this aimed
at giving the user the best experience



Most of the time in a Fiori like app the Master List data requirements will
cover BO header / detail / statuses plus dependencies like cost objects,
business partners and HR Infotypes etc.



I feel using Option 1 it is very difficult to achieve effective paging,
filtering, sorting and grouping and the alternatives I see is developers
getting all the related data, then use internal tables and nested looping etc.
which makes code hard to maintain, reuse and re-factor.



Cheers

JSP





FYI seen all three techniques i mention used in standard Fiori applications
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Jason Scott
text:
One thing I have learnt: never ever take sap's fiori apps as following any
form of "best practice". They are mainly a mess in my opinion and full of
bugs. SAP have sent these off to be developed by the lowest cost resources
that are just learning JavaScript. I'm sorry if that may offend any reader but
once you go through a fiori implementation you'll see...



I wholeheartedly agree with you on getting closer to the metal though - these
services need to be as fast as... To help the user experience.

To the extent that I've gone though it's mainly using open sql and avoiding
bapi's, etc. And never use BOL, BOPF as all the layers just slow things down
to much.
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: John Patterson
text:
That's an important point, on a typical ERP installation, my observation is
there are very few Gateway / UI5 applications you can use as a reference for
formulating a best practice. If there are bad practices, loose standards and
inconsistencies these will likely be copied by the developers on customers
sites (like me).



Interestingly i was told that there are very tight UX metrics around the
performance of the Gateway services used by Fiori apps, and some apps have not
made the grade and therefore were not accepted, would be nice if these metrics
were shared.



JSP
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Jason Scott
text:
For an application as a whole I think you'd draw on best practices as those
provided by the openui5 team in examples combined with the fiori templates of
WebIDE.

For the ABAP behind GW services themselves though I think you'd need to be
pretty loose in your standards.

A peer review is probably worth more than a hundred pages of standards anyway.
;-)
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Matt Harding
text:
Hi John/Jason,



Probably worth extending this to filtering and sorting but let's focus
initially on paging.



My 2 cents...If the data set is small, then I just retrieve all data use the
utility classes and hey presto - complex job done.



If it's a large dataset, it will depend on the underlying data you are
retrieving. e.g. In all my examples; I've had to deal with security of what
you can and can't see; hence paging usually involves me retrieving the keys to
all records, then retrieving them until I hit what I am after.



And yes, 1 is my preferred option if that is an option based on the data.



If I was to push a standard, it would be more generically to get the metadata
configured correctly for what you can filter by, sort by, etc; and then only
build what is defined there. Then for paging, only implement non-standard
utility paging if required since it's rarely a simple task and if you can load
the records in 100ms or less, then you might as well page the entityset with
the utility anyway.



In short, the standard for paging should be the utility class; unless the
dataset is too large, or complex to allow that then you should do the most
appropriate paging you can with (1) above being a recommendation if the
entity-set retrieval allows that.



Or, maybe the standard should just say - please use one of your more
advanced/experienced ABAP'ers if paging if required
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/silly.gif)



Cheers,

Matt
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Matt



Now there is a fourth option, a reusable Entity Paging Utility/Engine for want
of a better term.



A lot of times i see the data extracted, say top N and then authorizations and
logic are applied afterwards, depending on the type of authorizations this can
get very tricky,



I used to see this issue with POWLs and FPM List Feeders a lot, the user would
restrict a big dataset to say 100 records and 92 records would be returned and
rightly this would be raised as a defect, similar with Sorting and Grouping,
they would put all entries in a spreadsheet and apply the logic and say this
is the top 100 i expect and it would look nothing like what they are getting,

  

With a feature rich table control to avoid leaks do you turn off the unwanted
features or develop a query engine / SQL to cater for the likely scenarios?



I think your point about Metadata is very important. The common workflow i see
on projects, there are at least 3 developer roles.

 1. Service Designer - responsible for the information arch/ service def based on mock ups

 2, UI5 developer, works on the mock data provided by 1

 3. Gateway ABAP developer works on the dpc/data mgr provided by 1



The metadata is like the glue that binds the understanding between front-end
and back-end developers.





jsp
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Matt Harding
text:
Hi John,



Some extra thinking about this - the UI5 developer typically needs to heavily
influence the build (which impacts the original design) during the build as
sometimes a perfect design is very hard to get all the functionality you need
for the UI. e.g. According to OData, we should use function imports for
changing of states/statuses; but most of the time this is overkill and removes
the automatic binding the would occur if we just change the state/status of
the entity and watch what happens. Similarly, using open search rather than
$filters is really the only way to really get a google like search occurring,
but that can make life difficult for a UI5 developer since it's not an
automated binding, so overloading the definition of a filter (including what
contains means) for a field could be much more efficient (albeit a little
cryptic but the service was built for the UI so tough :-) One example I did
was for employee, and the search for employee with a contains implied
searching for that person's name, their managers name, their position, their
location. Horrible from a purist perspective, but it's the most maintanable
solution once you get past how dodgy it feels.



BTW - I use the io_tech_request_context->has_count( ) wherever I can
(especially since UI5 lists like to ask for the count before ask for the paged
entities), but oddly enough the system I was working on yesterday actually had
a bug and passed back 0 all the time! That was half an hour down the drain
trying to figure out that one.



And just to make sure we're on the same page (no pun intended) - here's an
example of utility code and locked sorting I wrote yesterday:

    
    
     /iwbep/cl_mgw_data_util=>filtering( exporting it_select_options = it_filter_select_options changing ct_data = et_entityset ).
     sort et_entityset by created descending.
     /iwbep/cl_mgw_data_util=>paging( exporting is_paging = is_paging changing ct_data = et_entityset ).

Cheers,

Matt
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: John Patterson
text:
Matt

Food for thought, i have never looked into the OpenSearch before definitely
something to investigate.



Currently in UI5 to get MockData to work for searches, I add a property
"SearchText" to the entity, this is filled with the implied mapped values
similar to OpenSearch but not as nice, then in back end 'SearchText' gets
translated to wildcard search.



for example SearchText could combine

PONumberMaterialShortText



eg MockData looks like

    
    
    PONumber: "4000001234",
    Material: "999999999",
    ShortText: "Foo Bar"
    SearchText : "4000001234999999999Foo Bar"



in UI5 when i set the filter i say "SearchText" Contains "Foo" and it works
with both Mock and Integrated data.



then when it hits the backend the SELECT looks similar to

    
    
    SELECT ..
    WHERE..
     AND ( ekko~ebeln like '%SEARCHTEXT%' OR ekpo~ebeln like '%SEARCHTEXT%' ..)

etc,



I don't believe currently the UI5 MockServer supports OpenSearch yet, but
given the power of HANA with features like Fuzzy etc. I think it would make
sense to have it.



JSP
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Matt Harding
text:
Hi John,



Ah - But that's where the "google" like search makes things more complex as
the query should actually look more like this since the search term could be
"foo test found" which does not necessarily need to be in any order and may be
across different fields (unless you use HANA or database specific text
searches):

Split searchtext by ' ' into t_searchterms.



Loop at t_searchterm assigning field-symbol(<search>).

at first.

 select .. into table t_results

 where ekko~ebeln like '%<search>%' or ekko~ebeln like
'%<search>%'.



if not first (not ABAP key word but you get the idea)

 select..into table t_results for all results in t_results

  where ekko~ebeln like '%<search>%' or ekko~ebeln like
'%<search>%'.

endloop.



Plus from an entity perspective, a non-entity search field is a little dodgy
too but I've done that recently also where I needed filters and search.



Anyway, a little off topic but agree the mockServer is something that should
be heavily invested in - I love developing UI5 apps until my mockserver can't
keep up with the requirements that a back-end provides.



Cheers,

Matt
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: John Patterson
text:
now i understand



    
    
    /iwbep/cl_mgw_data_util=>PAGING
    

it is essentially the same code as Option 1. minus the UP TO
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: Andre Fischer
text:
Hi John,



this is an interesting discussion. Thanks for raising this points.



Have you tried to use the SoftState based query result cache that we have
introduced with SP9?



[Soft State Based Query Result Cache - SAP NetWeaver Gateway - SAP Library](ht
tp://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp09/helpdata/en/5e/d9a953452a3543e10000000
a44538d/content.htm)



It is based on the SoftState feature which I have described in more detailed
in the following document.



[How to use Soft-State support for OData services
](http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-58760)



Though it doesn't boost the initial data retrieval from the database, any
subsequent query request that only differs with using $top and $skip is
answered by a cache that resides on the SAP Gateway hub rather than reading
the next chunk of data from the backend.



Best Regards,

Andre
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Andre

SQRC looks interesting, I think for the use-case of legacy code that cannot
easily be changed it seems like a nice option.

  

I never saw the following code before



> io_tech_request_context- >has_count( ).

  

If a GETLIST BAPI takes a couple of seconds to run, and you need to run the
BAPI to get the $count, would the SQRC scenario allow you to cache on the
first call and not the second ie cache on the $count?



jsp
title: Re:How do you write your EntitySet Paging?

Difference between External service name and Technical service name
text:
Hi All,



When we try registering an OData service, we are prompted to enter Technical
service name and External service name. Could you please clarify the
difference between them. In many of the cases, I have seen that both the
Technical Service name and External Service name are always same.



Also, I am not sure what an external mapping ID would be. Could any one please
explain the same?



Thanks,

Best Regards,

Manvitha
author: Manvitha Challagundla
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Manvitha,



the External Service Name is used for the service as it will be published by
the Internet Communication Framework (node in transaction SICF), for access by
clients. It will be automatically derived from the Technical Service Name when
you register the service in the _Gateway_Hub_ (or embedded Gateway).



The Technical Service Name is the name that you can choose when you generate
the runtime artifacts in transaction SEGW in the _backend_. The creation of
the runtime artifacts in the backend is also called "registering", thats a
bit confusing.



Best regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Difference between External service name and Technical service name

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Ringo,



Just want to mention :

> The creation of the runtime artifacts in the backend is also called
"registering", thats a bit confusing.



Generation of runtime artifacts and registration of service are two different
things. When we register our service to the Gateway hub system, it means that
the service developed in the backend system is now published to the external
world and ready to be consumed.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Difference between External service name and Technical service name

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Normally, when speaking of "registering" you mean the publishing in the
Gateway Hub system, as we both mentioned before. However, the generating of
the runtime artifacts in the development system (typically the backend system)
is sometimes called "registering", too. Most prominent example is the book
"OData and SAP NetWeaver Gateway" by SAP Press.
title: Re:Difference between External service name and Technical service name

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Thanks for mentioning.

I have not heard any usage of registering in context of runtime artifacts
generation. I don't know why they used it in this manner as these are 2 widely
different things. ![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Difference between External service name and Technical service name

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
I have the impression that the external mapping ID is not used anymore.
According to documentation it was used to identify a service if it was to be
included into the model of a new service, in order to create associations to
entity types of the old service without having to recreate those entity types.
Currently, you are being asked for an RFC connection and the technical service
name when you choose SEGW -> RMB on Data Model -> Include -> OData
Service (GW).
title: Re:Difference between External service name and Technical service name

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Manvitha,



There is one more point I would like to share. The technical service name and
external service name are actually serving two different purposes. The
external service name is the one which is used in the outside world. The
technical service name is a combination of 'NameSpace' and usually external
service name. For example: for leave request fiori app, the namespace is
'/GBHCM/' so you will find this namespace added in the technical name of the
service. Since usually we do not use a separate namespace, we find both the
names as same.

BTW, we can also change the external service name. For this, you may be
interested in [Re: How to rename the GW external service
name](http://scn.sap.com/message/15337451#15337451)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Difference between External service name and Technical service name

As far as I am concerned issue is from Configuration part but I don't have any

author: Deepak Kalouni

text:
Go to SAP Support Portal and search for OSS notes for this issue. You'll most
likely have to patch the gateway component on the server or, if you're on the
latest SP already, apply some OSS notes.  Can't help you without knowing the

Lukasz
title: Re:Error in Create operations Services in Gateway.

author: Gaurav Ahluwalia
text:
Hi Deepak,



Check whether your XML stream doesnot contain Special Character which are not
allowed in a XML Stream. You would have to replace those characters



## Predefined entities in XML

The XML specification does not use the term "character entity" or "character
entity reference". The XML specification defines five "predefined entities"
representing special characters, and requires that all XML processors honor
them. The entities can be explicitly declared in a DTD, as well, but if this
is done, the replacement text must be the same as the built-in definitions.
XML also allows other named entities of any size to be defined on a per-
document basis.

The table below lists the five XML predefined entities. The "Name" column
mentions the entity's name. The "Character" column shows the character. To
render the character, the format `&name;` is used; for example, `&`
renders as &. The "Unicode code point" column cites the character via
standard UCS/Unicode "U+" notation, which shows the character's code point in
hexadecimal. The decimal equivalent of the code point is then shown in
parentheses. The "Standard" column indicates the first version of XML that
includes the entity. The "Description" column cites the character via its
canonical UCS/Unicode name, in English.

Name| Character| Unicode code point (decimal)| Standard| Description  
---|---|---|---|---  
quot| "| U+0022 (34)| XML 1.0| double [quotation
mark](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quotation_mark)  
amp| &| U+0026 (38)| XML 1.0|
[ampersand](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ampersand)  
apos| '| U+0027 (39)| XML 1.0|
[apostrophe](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apostrophe) _(apostrophe-quote)_  
lt| <| U+003C (60)| XML 1.0| [less-than sign](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki
/Less-than_sign)  
gt| >| U+003E (62)| XML 1.0| [greater-than
sign](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater-than_sign)  
  
Regards

Gaurav Ahluwalia

Problem with Deep Entity Insert
text:
Hello,





I have a problem in Deep Entity Insert.

I have added data from the request payload for the 3 custom structures created
with a key parameter, how is it possible to check the data entered in the
table structure?



Is it possible to check the data in the header and corresponding item table??







Please Help me with this...









Thank You.
author: Karthik Sridhar
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Karthik,



To check the data that you have received, put an external breakpoint for your
user in the Create_Deepentity method and debug that method.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Karthik Sridhar
text:
Hi Ekansh,





I can check data with the breakpoint at the custom method created at the Data
Provider Class,

But is it possible to check the data in the back-end structure?











Thank You.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Karthik,



If you keep executing by one step in the debugger, you will enter into the
function module and will be able to see the values there also.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Karthik Sridhar
text:
Hi Ekansh,





Thank you for the support.



I can see the Header Values but corresponding item details is not present..

what needs to be done to see the item details in the backend?









Thank You.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Karthik,



If the deep entity method is implemented correctly, you would:

1) receive the values in your input deep structures(having header structure
and item level tables)

2) extract data from this input structure into different tables or structure
so that you can pass those to FM

3) pass these tables and structure to the FM.

So if you are following these steps correctly, you would get data in
corresponding structure or table inside the FM also.

you may like to read [Step by Step development for CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY
operation](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/04/27/step-by-step-
development-guide-for-createdeepentity-operation)



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Karthik Sridhar
text:
Hi Ekansh,





I am getting all the values.





Thank You.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Karthik Sridhar
text:
Hi Ekansh,



One Last question.

I can see the data in the backend with the breakpoint.

I am following the link u mentioned above.

But how can i see the item details in the browser?





Please Guide me with this.



Thank You.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Karthik,



After a document is created with Deep_Entity, Gateway will return the response
only with the header values. You can not send the item values in the http
response of deep entity. It will only send only an entity not the deep entity.





Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Karthik Sridhar
text:
Hi Ekansh,



The item details can be seen olny in the backend by applying an external
breakpoint.

So do we have any method to check the item data ??

does it gets stored anywhere? so that we can access the data entered?







Thank You.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



if you are passing the items details and using it to create some document in
the backend, it will get stored in that document. For example, if we consider
the case of Purchase order, you will send header data as well as item data to
the backend service and it will create a PO in the backend. So now if you
check the created PO number in the backend(through ME23N or directly in EKPO
table), you will see the item level details also.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Karthik Sridhar
text:
Hi Ekansh,



In my case i have an RFC, Header and two item structures, data will not be
stored in structures.

So in this case where can i find the item details.



Please Guide me.



Thank You.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Karthik,



The data will be stored as per your backend business logic. Go through the
business logic and check where this data is getting stored. The database
tables are different for every scenario so one can't say about the DB tables
unless one checks the business logic part.
title: Re:Problem with Deep Entity Insert
Trouble understanding oDataModel.callFunction results
text:
Hello,



I am attempting to write an Fiori POC which calls a function import of a
gateway service to process a record. The function import works fine when I
test it in a browser. I can call it okay from an event handler in my Fiori
app, but I'm having trouble understanding how to get the resulting data back
into my app. I apologize ahead of time for the simplicity of my questions.
I'm a long time ABAP developer who is just getting a chance to branch out a
bit...



Question 1: I found this thread, [How to call Function Import from SAP UI5
and get the return object in table?](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3678967), which
was very helpful. I have a created a function with two parameters; odata and
response. It is called correctly, but I don't understand how I go about
collecting the results from the odata parameter. The example thread above has
this snippet for cardinality 0..n or 1..n values. But what do I use for
cadinality of 1, like say I'm returning an entity that is derived from the
ADRC table?



  1. { 
  2.  "d": 
  3.  { 
  4.  "__metadata": 
  5.  { 
  6.  "type":"Collection(<<complex type name>>)" 
  7.  }, 
  8.  "results": 
  9.  [ 
  10.  /* an array of data records */ 
  11.  ] 
  12.  } 
  13. } 



Question 2. I set an external breakpoint in the ABAP code for my service and
tested my Fiori app in the WebIDE. Both the error and success functions for
my callFunction method are invoked before I hit my external breakpoint. Is
this expected. I thought the error function would only be called if there was
an error and the success function would be called after my service has
returned, but that doesn't seem to be happening.



Thank you very much for any insight you can offer.



Best regards,

John
author: John Richason

Return Table in POST Function
text:
Hi Gurus,



I'm very new to GW services and Service which I'm currently working on is to
Create Invoice. I took the RFC/BOR Route and RFC FM got 2 parameters:



1\. Input Table - Accepts both Header and Item information

2\. Output Table - Returns error or success message (Got 2 columns: Message
Type and Message)



This means 2 entity sets in GW service: one for Input and another for Output
Table.



Through "Map to Data Source" option, mapped the Input table to RFC Parameters
and generated code looks good where the input parameters are aligned with RFC
FM parameters.



Issue is how should I get the response back from the FM as the return table is
another entity set. Can you please suggest.



Thanks,

Karthik
author: Karthikeyan Thangavel
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Karthikeyan,



Your RFC should have the output return table as type of BAPIRET2. You do not
need seperate enetity set for return messages. The auto generated code of
gateway framework will automatically take care of that.

Just to mention another point, if you are creating an invoice with multiple
line items as well as header, you should have 2 entitysets one for header and
one for item. Then define the association b/w them and navigation property.
Then implement the create deep entity method. In this method you will be able
to receive multiple line items as well as header.

[Step by Step development for CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY
operation](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/04/27/step-by-step-
development-guide-for-createdeepentity-operation)



Regards,

Ekansh

Same RFC Destination for Dev and Quality?
text:
Hi Experts,



When we move the Gateway TRs from Quality to Dev Environment the RFC
destination is carrying along with the TR.

Now the problem comes while loading the mapping in Quality. To avoid this
again we have to create another RFC Destination with same name which was
created in DEV. Its violating the Naming Standards.



For Example



Dev_ABCCLNT500 (Dev Environment ) -----> Dev_ABCCLNT500(Quality
Environment)



Could you please revert me if there any options to avoid this.



Regards,

Kiran Adhikarla
author: Kiran Adhikarla
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Kiran,



a usual way of doing it is the following one:



  * Transport the System Alias from Dev to Q or to P in a Customizing Request, but do not include the RFC destination.
  * Create the RFC destination in Q or P according to the naming convention for the respective system.
  * Edit the transported System Alias in Q or P to adapt it to the valid RFC destination for that system. From Gateway SP06 onwards it is possible to do that customizing even in a production system thanks to the concept of "Current Setting" which was introduced exactly for this kind of problem.
  * You have to do the Current Setting Customizing via SPRO. AFAK the path to the customizing activity is NetWeaver -> Gateway -> OData Channel -> Configuration -> Connection Settings -> NetWeaver Gateway to SAP system.
  * If you have a Gateway system prior to SP06, you have to change the settings for that particular Customizing activity to allow for changes in the production system as described in SAP Note 135028.



Best regards & success,

Ringo
title: Re:Same RFC Destination for Dev and Quality?

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Kiran,



has the answer been of any help to you? Just let me know, if your question is
still open.



Kind regards,

Ringo
title: Re:Same RFC Destination for Dev and Quality?

Issue with Gateway Attachments
text:
Dear GW Experts,

We are facing an issue with attachments in Gateway. We are using SAP DMS for
our attachments. since gateway sends the attachment in Binary format and we
are not able to find any BAPI/FM to create DMS attachments as none of them
accepts binary format. We tried to use BAPI_DOCUMENT_CREATE2 but it needs the
path as import parameter and but since the document get attached in background
in the** create stream method** in the DPC class we cannot use a path in front
end like (c:\temp\test.txt), so please advice how to achieve this.

)



Regards

IK
author: Imran Khan
Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Imran,



I understand your requirement as follows - please let me know, whether thats
correct:



  * You developed an OData service that delivers, among other things, binary documents.
  * The documents are administered in the SAP Document Management System
  * The original documents are not contained in the SAP Database, the DMS just contains links to files on a frontend computer, where the orginal document resides.



If thats the case, its a bit tricky. If there are just a handful of frontend
computers which rarely change and are always available in the network, then
you might think of mounting them as drives in the file system of the
application server. Thus, you can read them via file system commands in the
implementation of the create stream method.



However, it is problematic to rely on the availability of a document on a
frontend computer for an OData service. In the long run, the better solution
would be to move the original documents to the SAP Database or to an external
Document Management Server that can be reached via HTTP at any time.



Best regards,

Ringo

file path as input as since we are running this attachment process in
background inside the create stream method, we cannot give the front end path,
so we need to have a dms function module which can take the input in a binary
format and then push that to dms server.



Regards

IK

title: How the performance oData comparing RFC's
text:
Hello Experts,



I am new to SAP Mobile technologies.



My client already using web based .net application and there are many RFC
Function Modules already exist and the same RFC Function Module called from
.net application.



Ex: To fetch open Sales order and changing the status from .net. Actually
inside R/3 RFC Function Module called the standard BAPI and returning result
to .net web application.



Note : Now our client is upgraded into ECC 6.0 from R/3 4.7.



I have come across from scn forum the oData can be used in any programming
language(ASP/.Net/PHP/Phython/Java and etc.)



Can we migrate all RFC's to oData service using netweaver gateway programming.
Below are my basic questions.



1\. What is the advantage using oData comparing RFC's? is there any merits and
demerits using the new oData technology? It is advise to use oData?

2\. Will it support network load since many RFC's are returning around 50K
records to .net.

3\. My client planing to implement mobility and my basic question is what is
the use of Syclo, Agentry and Fiori? is all the three can be used oData
framework? My client proposed to use Syclo Agentry so the oData framework will
it support? I heard the oData is the platform independent and can be connect
any source.



Please advise me. I am waiting for your earliest response and best practice as
well.



Regards,

A Vadamalai.
author: Vadamalai Athimoolam
Vadamalai Athimoolam
text:
Hello Experts,



I am waiting for your inputs. Kindly advise.



Regards,

A Vadamalai.
title: Re:How the performance oData comparing RFC's

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



Using OData makes your business data self explanatory. Any device which can
listen and speak HTTP can consume SAP Data through OData services. OData
services will be RESTful webservices. Using SAP Gateway to connect front-end
to back-end systems also makes an abstraction layer from front end to back
end. Now front end system need not to know about the backend system and how
that data is coming from there. You can use multiple backends connected to
gateway but front end will communicate to only gateway which in turn will call
different backends. So yes, it is advised to use OData services in order to
expose sap data.

Yes, it will support network load. Its pretty fast and supports paging option
as well. So you need not to load all 50k records in one shot instead keep on
loading few records as per pagination.

Syclo Agentry framwork and Fiori support gateway. Fiori is the new UX for SAP
which is built using SAPUI5 and SAP Gateway.

SAP Gateway services can be consumed by any programming language which can
consume REST webservices. SAP Gateway only supports SAP backend systems and
does not support native connection to any other backend like JDBC, ODBC etc.
SAP Gateway can connect to other data sources if they can expose OData or
webservices.



You may like to read these links:

[SAP NetWeaver Gateway - Technical
Brief](http://whealy.com/sap/Gateway/Technical%20Brief/)

[Getting Started with SAP NetWeaver
Gateway](http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-24763)

[SAP Gateway Self-Paced Learning - Technologies - SCN
Wiki](http://wiki.scn.sap.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=318672261)



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:How the performance oData comparing RFC's

connection?

Regards,

A Vadamalai.

  * Fill in the form to download the software
  * Open the e-mail with your device
  * Click the link to install solution. Select ABAP Trial 7.02 SP11 Win 64 bit Version with Gateway 2.0
  * To install please refer to the [Master Guide.](https://websmp210.sap-ag.de/~sapidb/011000358700005412792005E/mg_nw702.pdf)
  * Please refer to the [Installation Guide.](https://websmp104.sap-ag.de/~sapidb/011000358700000378032010E/win_nw702_abapjava_max.pdf)
  * You can also use [Step by Step Installation Guide for SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP 7.02 SP6 32-bit Trial Version.](http://scn.sap.com/community/abap/blog/2012/03/26/step-by-step-installation-guide-for-sap-netweaver-as-abap-702-sp6-32-bit-trial-version)
  *   

So here is the link:

  

[https://store.sap.com/sap/cpa/ui/resources/store/html/Search.html?pcntry=US&a
mp;sap-language=EN&catID=&searchText=abap%20tri](https://store.sap.co
m/sap/cpa/ui/resources/store/html/Search.html?pcntry=US&sap-language=EN&catID=
&searchText=abap%20trial&facetVal=&facetCode=&_cp_id=id-1431506465576-0)

  

You can download NW 7.02 - 7.03 and so on but NetWeaver 7.4 is only in the
cloud, so you can't download this system, only connect on Amazon EC2 server.

How to use OData SDK PHP create an entity in SAP
author: Yuan Yuefeng
Lukasz Grochal
text:
Since this is a POST request, an CSRF token should be sent to the Gateway
server in the request header. I do not know PHP OData SDK so I'm not sure if
the token is meant to be automatically fetched by the SDK before sending the
POST request.

Just in case, send a GET request to the service with the following request
header:

X-CSRF-Token:fetch

Next for the POST request, populate X-CSRF-Token header with the value fetched
above.

You should also attach SAP session ID to the post request which is a cookie
from the get request named like so: SAP_SESSIONID_<syst
ID>_<clnt>.



Hope this helps.



Lukasz
title: Re:How to use OData SDK PHP create an entity in SAP

![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

title: Re:Left and right single quotation mark

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Robbe,



I was not aware of typing  and  in keyboard.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/wink.gif) Then I googled and got
to know about Alt0145 and Alt0146 (for windows).

I tested with this and found that it works fine in 'read' . But when I tried
in update method, it is received correctly by gateway framework (EKANSHSS)
but got changed as soon as the flow entered into FM to update. I too got
EKANSH#S#S in the backend FM.



The reason behind this is the RFC destination that you are using is not
unicode enabled. Change this to enable unicode and run the unicode test. The
target system(backend) should be unicode system. you can check this in
System->status. After changing this to unicode in RFC destination, it would
work fine.



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:Left and right single quotation mark

author: Robbe Wuyts
text:
I found this: [Unicode and Non-Unicode Support - SAP NetWeaver Gateway - SAP L
ibrary](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp09/helpdata/en/85/91915382833f2
7e10000000a44538d/content.htm)



Seems like our gateway system doesn't support unicode.

title: How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?
text:
Hello Gateway experts,



We are developing a number of services to consume by our mobile application
and we first made and test services on Embedded Gateway deployment and
everything worked. Now we install Gateway on a new AS ABAP 7.4 server to act
as a Hub for our DEV, QAS, PRD servers and we go for second option in that
kind of configuration, development on the hub, because we don't won't to
install IW_BEP on every server. But now we need to use RFC for service
development (in embedded configuration we simply use a structure and program
get, put, post methods in *_DPC_EXT class) and when want to register services
we can if we put a destination system to be a local gateway server and rfc
destination NONE but then service don't see our function that is on DEV
server, and when we put a destination system to be DEV server and rfc
destination the one toward that system, it throw an error: Runtime error
CALL_FUNCTION_NOT_FOUND has occurred,

| ..ERROR_INFO Function module "/IWFND/FM_ACTIVATE_SERVICE" not found.  
---|---  
  


Can you please explain how to develop a and deploy a service in this kind of
configuration?
author: Vladimir Erakovic
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Vladimir Erakovic,



I hope you have done the system alias config in the proper way. [All About
System Alias and Routing of Requests in SAP NetWeaver Gateway
](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2013/05/30/system-alias-and-
routing-of-request-in-sap-netweaver-gateway).

While registering the service, you would register on the same server and would
bring the data from different system using system alias. This system alias
would have 'Local App' flag checked because the service implementation is in
the local gateway system. So the gateway framework would search for
implementation in the same system but when it comes to data retrieval part, it
would extract the RFC destination from the system alias and would bring the
data by calling the RFC with destination.



Let me know if you have any doubts.



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?

author: Vladimir Erakovic
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Here are the screenshots.. From system aliases:

[![](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-15993805-714950/64
0-127/pastedImage_0.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-1
5993805-714950/pastedImage_0.png)



The last one, MKGD00, is the one with RFC destination toward our DEV system.
Is this ok?

And then here, where we define system on which we register services, how we
configure?



[![](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-15993805-714951/pa
stedImage_1.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-15993805-
714951/pastedImage_1.png)



Only one is needed but we experimenting with different combinations but with
no success.

Can you explain us how to configure?
title: Re:How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
In the second screenshot, where you mention the Hub system, for GW_HUB:

  * select the proper client of your same Hub system
  * in system alias field, provide 'LOCAL' 
  * RFC destination is 'NONE'.



Try with this setting.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?

author: Vladimir Erakovic
text:
We get: Function call failed, could not find the function XXXXX..



Do we need to add some code somewhere? We only implement Get Entity method in
SEGW with Map to data source and mapping to RFC in DEV system.
title: Re:How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
We get this error when we have used wrong system alias(in Hub to Backend
popup) while registering the service. You needed to use the MKGD00 system
alias for this service as this has local app checked.

Please go through this link once [How To Implement a Remote RFC Function Call
from the Gateway Service](http://scn.sap.com/blogs/ui5-for-abap/2013/12/26
/how-to-implement-a-remote-rfc-function-call-from-the-gateway-service) . Go to
/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE, select the service and check the system alias. If the
system alias is correct, go to system alias config in SPRO and make sure 'For
local app' flag is checked.



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?

author: Vladimir Erakovic
text:
We made it! Thank you Ekansh!



Just for the record, if someone else have a same problem:

SAP System Alias for system in which is RFC enabled function module need to
have:

Local GW - empty, For Local App - X, RFC destination - ABAP connection in
SM59, Software version - DEFAULT (don't work if ECC_604).

Gateway settings in IMG:

Destination system - Gateway system ID, Client - Gateway system default
client, System Alias - the one defined above, RFC destination - NONE.

And we had to enter Username and Password from targeted system in RFC
connection in SM59.
title: Re:How to register a service in a Hub deployment with development on Hub?

title:

unsupported format

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Supriya,



in your screenshot I can see the request header Content-Type =
...;type=**feed**; ...



If I retrieve an entry, I receive a response with Content-Type =
...;type=**entry**;...



You may try it again with type=entry. Even easier, you can shorten the content
type and work only with Content-Type=**application/atom+xml** and nothing more
- for me that works.



The quickest way is to do a request beforehand, where you retrieve a single
entity, e..g. when entity with ID 22222 already exists, then you do a GET for
ZREALTY_SRV/ActivityCreateSet('22222'). Then you have the chance to take
exactly the response body, copy it into the request body, change the field
values accoding to your needs, change the HTTP verb to POST and submit the
request again.



Lots of success,

Ringo

unsupported format

author: Dominik Rosch
Dominik Rosch
text:
Hi Folks,



just for the record: I defined associations in my CDS-Views which referenced
other CDS-Views.

Obviously, if you reference another CDS-View via ASSOCIATION, you have to
reference it by its CDS-Name not by its DDIC-name.



Either way, referencing it by its DDIC-name does not stop you from being able
to allocate your CDS-View as a data source.



Regards,

Dominik

Uploading Web Cam Images as GOS Attachments for Work Orders
text:

from webcam will be sent to the back-end and saved to the GOS.

the format.



**Steps taken : **

  * A similar thing was developed where normal attachments(any extension) were uploaded to the GOS without much challenges.
  * But the same approach failed for the Webcam captured images.
  * We tried various encoding/decoding techniques and conversions in the backend but that did not work.
  * The captured image is in "png" format & UI team converts it into base64 to pass to the back end.
  * We get Base 64 encoded string from the UI which currently we are trying to validate if corrupted.
  * The base 64 is decoded, converted to XString and then to binary and finally uploaded to GOS.



We have Used FM SSFC_BASE64_DECODE to decode the Base64 encoded image data.
However even that seems not to be working.



We will keep trying other ways from our side but if somebody has idea on how
to get this done , that you know of, please help .
author: Kunal Shah

title: How many gateway services used in real project scenario for 1 application?
text:
Hi all,



Lets say i have ui5 app which involves transaction business process so is it
necessary to have one gateway service for one sapui5 application.



My assumption:There may be n no of service depending on the application built
like one service can be to get the f4 help of the input field other to get the
text details used in the screen and another to handle the business process.



Please help me understand.
author: Thivi Deepan
Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
Hi,



in real project scenario, developers may/will develop sapui5 components and
then these components can be integrated into single application (like fiori
launchpad). Now for each component, you could have separate OData service
which will fulfill the requirement of that particular sapui5 component.

again within sapui5 component, there could be separate services for e.g to get
F4 help etc(you already mentioned)



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:How many gateway services used in real project scenario for 1 application?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hello Deepan,



Yes, you can have multiple gateway service for multiple components(as
Chandrashekhar said). Even this is the right approach instead of creating only
one service in the gateway.

Once I have seen that in one project they were using only one gateway service
for the whole application of around 40 screens. The problem in that case was
that the service was also having around 30+ entities and it was so cumbersome
to maintain that service. Every time you need to do even a minor change, it
was taking around 10+ minutes to regenerate the runtime artifacts. Also the
code in Deep_Entityset method also gets complicated.



So I would suggest you to create the multiple services and reuse them in the
application to the possible extent but do not complicate the single service.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:How many gateway services used in real project scenario for 1 application?

author: Thivi Deepan
text:
Thanks, Let's say I have an app for sales order in one screen there two
buttons each button has to do different functionality relevant to order.In
back end each button has to call different respective rfc function module. In
this case can I send one flag as input to service from Ui indicating which
functionality it is and the in backend service based on flag call the
respective function module in generated mpc class update method.is my
understanding correct or is there any other way.I have 10 different
functionality of different module does it mean it is good to create 10service
and generate 10 dpc and mpc classes
title: Re:How many gateway services used in real project scenario for 1 application?

author: Chandrashekhar Mahajan
text:
You need to understand first the different operations done on OData service's
entity such as CRUDQ. For more information, refer my blog [Lets code CRUDQ
and Function Import operations in OData
service!](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/03/06/let-s-code-
crudq-and-function-import-operations-in-odata-service)

for sales order scenario, it will have different functionality such as create
sales order, read sales order, update sales order, delete sales order etc
which can be performed into relevant entity methods of Z*DPC generated class.
you need not to pass any flag from UI but just need to call proper CRUD method
of OData model. Refer [OData Write Support - SAPUI5 Developer Guide - SAP Libr
ary](http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw74/helpdata/de/91/f2a6ac6f4d1014b6dd926db0e
91070/content.htm?frameset=/de/3c/f61c59b2ce423993c3af8218b7817c/frameset.htm)



Also check this blog [Let's code association/navigation and data provider
expand in OData service!](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/09/24
/lets-code-associationnavigation-and-data-provider-expand-in-odata-service)
which explains the association between different entities.



In summary. all relevant entities can be part of single OData service and then
you need to write logic in respective entity, entityset methods as per CRUDQ
scenario.



Regards,

Chandra
title: Re:How many gateway services used in real project scenario for 1 application?

author: Samir Shaikh
text:
Hi Chandrashekhar,



How can we handle cases where one project has more than one service with File
Uploads.

As we know there is only one MPC_EXT class for each project in which in the
Define Method we have to give the entity name with the Field which contains
the File Type.

Is there any way we can provide more than one entities which their respective
field names for File Types.



In my case i have two services and both of them has File Uploads how can i
handle this under one project or do i have to create different projects for
each services.



Thanks in advance,



Samir
title: Re:How many gateway services used in real project scenario for 1 application?

SAP NetWeaver pass function import but couldn't get two or more out table
text:
Hi Expert,



I have rfc function. I send import parameter from sapui5 app.I get a out table
dpc_ext class excetu action method but I want to get two or out table. I try
to create deep structure but I couldn't do it. How can I get tables?



Thnks...
author: Kaan Ozdogan
Didier Bueno
text:
Hello:



For getting more than one table you need to create a deep structure and
redefine the method GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET



Here you have a blog about this:



[Implementing Expand Entity/Entity
Set](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/07/18/implementing-expand-
entityentity-set)





I have used with very good results. Hope to have helped you,

Didier
title: Re:SAP NetWeaver pass function import but couldn't get two or more out table

author: Mithat Cakmak
text:
Hi Kaan,



You can retrieve multiple tables by implementing GET_EXPANDED_ENTITY and
GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET methods. Please refer below thread for more
information.



[https://scn.sap.com/thread/3367787](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3367787)



Also, I would like to mention that using outside-in modelling is not
appropriate for designing a GW service because OData is based on flat
structures, instead you should use inside-out modelling, which you can find
more information in this blog post.



[Improved Inside-Out Modelling](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center
/netweaver-gateway/blog/2013/10/17/improved-inside-out-modelling)



Best,

Mitt
title: Re:SAP NetWeaver pass function import but couldn't get two or more out table

Access Permission Error in OData Service method while Uploading File to SAP
Application Layer
text:
Hi all,



I am trying to upload file from SAPUI5 app to SAP Application layer by using
OData Service.



I am using the SAP function module "ARCHIVFILE_CLIENT_TO_SERVER" to achieve
this requirement.



But when i tried to use this function module inside odata service method, i
didn't get the popup which gives permission to access local file.

Please find the attached screenshot(Access Permission popup). Because of
missing this popup i am getting SY-SUBRC = 1 "Access error on File" from the
function module.



I can successfully upload files when i tried the same in Report program,there
i got this permission access popup.

  

is there any way to set this permission as ALLOW without this popup?  



Can any one give me an advice to solve this?



Regards,

Ranjani Sekar.
author: Ranjani Sekar
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Ranjani,



The calling of OData service or calling a FM inside a OData service doesn't
support dialogs or popups. That is why you are not able to use this FM inside
your gateway service.



You will get the file in CREATE_STREAM method of DPC class, here you can send
it to your wrapper RFC and save the file to the Application server inside that
RFC. To save the file on application server, you can use following keywords
(with different variations):

OPEN DATASET

TRANSFER

CLOSE DATASET



you can convert the xstring of file to binary and then store it in a file on
application server. You will get more details on searching for this.



Regards,

Ekansh
title:
Re:Access Permission Error in OData Service method while Uploading File to SAP
Application Layer

author: Ranjani Sekar
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thank you so much for your valuable reply.

I will try to use OPEN DATASET.



Thanks once again.



Regards,

Ranjani Sekar.
title:
Re:Access Permission Error in OData Service method while Uploading File to SAP
Application Layer

author: Mohd Misnan

title: SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class
author: choong chan hol
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Choong chan hol,



As I can see from the screenshot, you have not implemented the mapping of
GetEntitySet(Query) under Service Implementation node. Whatever import/export
parameters that you have chosen are only for Data Modelling part. That does
not automatically create the mapping between your entity properties and the
RFC. You have to implement the mapping.

This is the reason for your error.



Please check the following links to implement the services:

[Detailed step by step procedure for Creating Gateway Service with all the
CRUD Operations and testing them in Service Explorer
Part1](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/netweaver-
gateway/blog/2013/12/22/steps-in-creating-gateway-service-with-all-the-crud-
operations)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class

author: choong chan hol
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for the reference, its very useful for me.

As for my case, my RFC require to pass in the input parameters and get the
output parameters.

May i know which service implementation node should i create ?
GetEntitySet(Query)?



however, i tried to create the service implementation node in GetEntitySet. it
prompt the following error:

[![GetEntitySet\(Query\).JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadI
mage/2-16047234-731268/450-361/GetEntitySet%28Query%29.JPG)](http://scn.sap.co
m/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-16047234-731268/GetEntitySet%28Query%29.JPG)
title: Re:SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



May I know the use case?



Read call (GET_ENTITY) will return a single record while Query
(GET_ENTITY_SET) will return multiple set of records. So to choose between
READ & QUERY depends on your use case.



If it solves your problem, please close the thread: [How to close a discussion
and why](http://scn.sap.com/community/support/blog/2013/04/03/how-to-close-a
-discussion-and-why)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class

author: choong chan hol
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for your explanation. I added the GET_ENTITY but it having the same
error when i run in gateway client.



basically the Function Module is use as the login proposes which pass in the
user name and password then get the user detail in single record.



is that possible that the error is because i didn't pass in the input
parameters ?



When import the RFC had separate as Login (Entity Type) and
EsTechnDetail(Complex types), how should i create entityset to pass in the
Entity type and return as Complex types?



Regards

Choong
title: Re:SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Choong,



The Read call should be triggered as following:

<http://><server>:<port>/sap/opu/..../<servicename>/<enti
ty_set>(<key1>='<value1>',<key2>='<value2>',<key
3>='<value3>')

In your case

<http://><server>:<port>/sap/opu/..../<servicename>/LoginCol
lection(Username='USER',Password='PASSWORD@123',Ztype='MYTYPE')

This will give you the single record held in your structure as output as per
your mapping.



Make sure that you have generated the runtime artifacts and the GET_ENTITY
method of LoginCollection entityset has the code implemented in the DPC class.



If you still get error, please explain the error in detail and provide the
snapshot of the error which will help us to understand the issue.



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class

author: choong chan hol
text: awesome. It's solve my problem. Thank you.
title: Re:SEGW - Method 'X_GET_ENTITYSET' not implemented in data provider class
Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway
text:
Hi Guys,



Is it possible to integrate SharePoint to SOLMAN system via Gateway(Embedded
deployment) ?



Apart from Duet Enterprise(Not willing to use it), can we use the traditional
REST architecture with CRUD functionalities, create a service and then use it
in the SharePoint interface?



Would like to know your views on it.



Regards,

Chaitanya
author: Chaitanya Muttur
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Chaitanya,



The SAP Gateway also adhers to the REST architecture. You can create OData
services over there which can be consumed by any programming language. So yes,
you can integrate it with sharepoint also.

Apart from Duet Enterprise, there is one more product 'SAP Gateway for
Microsoft'. Have a look [Connect SharePoint 2013 to SAP via Gateway for
Microsoft](http://scn.sap.com/community/interoperability-
microsoft/blog/2014/07/14/connect-sharepoint-2013-to-sap-via-gateway-for-
microsoft)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Chaitanya Muttur
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thank you for your inputs.



One more query, we need to pick files(Word,PDF's) stored in SOLMAN system and
display it in SharePoint(will have input field to search).

In this scenario, we need to create entity type and generate the get_entity
method, so here how to read the files from the database and send it via
gateway?



Thanks,

Chaitanya
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Chaitanya,



You need to make your entities as media type and then implement get_stream
method. Please go through [How To Upload and Download Files Using SAP NW
Gateway SP06](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2013/08/14/how-to-
upload-and-download-files-using-sap-nw-gateway) .





Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Chaitanya Muttur
text:
Thanks Ekansh for your references.



I will try to implement with this information.



Thanks,

Chaitanya
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Chaitanya Muttur
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Can we send multiple files / documents as well using this approach as provided
in the link?



Basically, the gateway service is consumed in the SEARCH field on the
SharePoint screen, so whenever the user searches using a "word" in the search
field, all files related to "word" needs to be shown in SharePoint.



Thanks & Regards,

Chaitanya
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Chaitanya,



As I understood from your requirement, the user will search with some criteria
-> it will display RESULTS -> user clicks on one result -> the linked
file is downloaded at user's end. This complete scenario is possible.

> Can we send multiple files / documents as well using this approach as
provided in the link?

I do not see any use of sending multiple files in the above requirement. On
click of search, a list of RESULTS is returned. Once user clicks on any
result, a request would go to GW to download that particular file (with the
help of keys from results).

There is no sense of overloading the client browser with all the files on
search functionality itself.



Let me know if I did not understand your requirement correctly.



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Chaitanya Muttur
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Yes, you are right with the requirement.



In this case, for the results of the Search, should I create one more entity
type ?



Thanks & Regards,

Chaitanya
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
No, there is no need of creating other entity.

Suppose your entity/entityset is File & FileSet and you have properties:
ID (Key), Desc, FileContent (XSTRING), MimeType, SearchTerm . For getting list
of results on search, you will fire GET_ENTITYSET call with SearchTerm as
input and take ID and Desc as output.

<http://><server>:<port>/sap/..../<SERVICE>/FileSet?$filter=
SearchTerm eq 'word'

and you get results like:

1 abc.docx

2 xyz.pdf



once you get list of results, the user clicks on 1 result to download the
file. You will fire GET_STREAM call to download. It will be like:

<http://><server>:<port>/sap/..../<SERVICE>/FileSet(ID='1')/
$value



PS: this is just to give you an idea. The properties can be totally different
as per your scenario.



Regards,  
Ekansh
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Chaitanya Muttur
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for your inputs, I will try implementing it.



Thanks & Regards,

Chaitanya
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Chaitanya Muttur
text:
Hi Ekansh,



SOLMAN uses TREX Search engine in it, in this scenario, will NW Gateway help
us in integrating it to SharePoint ? Or will webservices be more suitable ??



Thanks & Regards,

Chaitanya
title: Re:Sharepoint integration to SOLMAN via Gateway

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Chitanya,



I am not sure about the TREX thing.

title: Association/Navigation without key properties
text:
Hi Experts,





I'm trying to make an association/navigation to another Entity, but this for a
property without being marked as a key.



Example the EPM test service from <http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-31221>

The model: [http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/102-44073-2-24638
7/Relationen.png](/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/102-44073-3-246387/Relati
onen.png)



I already builded the SalesOrder association/navigation to the SalesOrderItem.

But I cannot seem to create the association/navigation from SalesOrderItem to
the Product, in SEGW I always have to define the referential constraint with
the key of the Entity. In SalesOrderItem, the productId property is not a key,
and I can't imagine that I have to set it as a key.



Thanks in advance





Regards,

Wouter
author: Wouter Peeters
Wouter Peeters
text:
On a sidenote, i've also created the Entity Data Model in Eclipse with all
associations and navigations (by importing SAP's ES1 test service for this),
imported this in SAP SEGW, implemented the read and queries.



But when I try the product navigation, it goes into error with a "Internal
error occurred, contact your system administrator." -
/IWBEP/CX_MGW_TECH_EXCEPTION.
title: Re:Association/Navigation without key properties

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Wouter,



Are you familiar with key relationships in database terms? This is no
different to that.



Only one side of this relationship needs to refer to an entity key and that is
the Product side. On the other side, the key of this product is **referenced
**by another entity, the SalesOrderItem; that side does not have to be a key
value in the context of that entity (although it could be, that tends to be
the case more when the target has a composite key).



There should be no problem in making this relationship.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Association/Navigation without key properties

author: Wouter Peeters
text:
Hello Ron,





I succeed in making the relationship between SalesOrder and SalesOrderItem,
but making the navigation/association between SalesOrderItem and Product is
not working, please provide information how to do so if you know.



I used the ES1 demo service data model (but in ES1 SAP system it's not
implemented in SEGW )

<https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGWSAMPLE_SRV/?sap-ds-
debug=true>



I imported this into my Eclipse GPA, exported it and imported it in SEGW.

After implementing the read and query operations the navigation from
SalesOrder to SalesOrderItem worked, but the Product did not.



I suspect that this navigation needs some extra coding. If not please provide
details how to do the mapping.





Greets,

Wouter
title: Re:Association/Navigation without key properties

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Wouter,



You need some extra coding in the Product 'get entity set' method. To
determine if this is a direct collection reference or a navigation to a
collection, you can check if the navigation path table parameter has an entry
in it - if it does, you need to find which navigation (there could be more
than one to pick from, as a caller-client) is being requested.

You can find the context for 'navigating from' in the key table parameter,
i.e. that should contain the key of the sales order item.



e.g. (not necessarily correct for ES1 in terms of names)



 lt_nav_path = io_tech_request_context->get_navigation_path( ).



 read table lt_nav_path into ls_nav_path with key nav_prop =
SalesOrderItems'.

 if sy-subrc = 0.



 lt_key = io_tech_request_context->get_source_keys( )..

 read table lt_key with key name = 'SoID' into ls_key.

 lv_orderid = ls_key-value.

" ditto for position key.....  

 endif.

  



You can then use these two pieces of information to locate the product of the
item.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Association/Navigation without key properties

author: Wouter Peeters
text: Thanks Ron!
title: Re:Association/Navigation without key properties

author: Abhijit V Patil
text:
Hi Wouter,



I am facing simillar issue.. While modelling the association, it does not
allow to create association between 'non key' or between 'key - non key'
entities..

Were you able to solve this issue? Or just created navigation..



Regards,

Abhijit
title: Re:Association/Navigation without key properties

author: Wouter Peeters
text:
You create the navigation but without referential constraints.

When you implement the read_entity, you will see in the debugger that you have
the keys available in the key table, and then it's your responsibility to code
and retrieve the non-key relevant to those keys.



And then just fill up the entity structure ... the downside is that you have
to code everything manual ...

So if you're designing everything with function module calls ( and mapping ),
this is a small downside.





Regards,

Wouter

EDM name validation failed for value *******
text:
Hi Experts,



I want to create gateway service.

I import two parameter to function and export a value.

Firstly I try mapping data query operation but I couldnt succed.Because I get
error "no output table is mapped in the query operation".

Then I try to mapping data read operation then, I create funcion import and
EXECUTE_ACTION redefination.

But I get error "EDM name validation failed for value *******"





Plss help me,
author: Kaan Ozdogan
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Kaan,



The query operation is meant for exporting multiple values which can only be
handled by table. That's why you get error that no output table is mapped.

Your requirement can be solved by implementing Read operation. You just need
to make those two properties as key(you can not pass any non-key property as
input in Read operation) and pass those two as input and get the third
property as output.



Let me know if I did not understand your requirement.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:EDM name validation failed for value *******

author: Dominik Rosch
text:
Hi Ekansh,



processing read operations by only using key properties is not exactly right.

If - for some reason - you do not want your properties to be key properties,
you can request your data using filters:



[ServiceURI]/[EntitySet]**?$filter=[property]%20eq%20%27[value]**



%20 in a URI represents a blank; %27 represents an inverted comma.



Regards,



Dominik
title: Re:EDM name validation failed for value *******

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Dominik,



Yeah, I agree. But I proposed that Read operation considering he only has 3
properties in the entity.

The filters can be used in Query call which is not possible due to his RFC
signatures.



That's why I asked him to revert if I did not understand
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:EDM name validation failed for value *******

author: Kaan Ozdogan
text: So How can I map to data query operation for single string output?
title: Re:EDM name validation failed for value *******

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Kaan,



If you want to map it as a query, change the RFC parameters in such a way that
it complies with Query operation requirement:

1) one table should be mapped in the mapping for output

2) the key properties must be mapped for output.



You would be better able to decide the operation.

It would be helpful if you can explain the scenario.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:EDM name validation failed for value *******

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Kaan,



Were you able to solve your problem?

[How to close a discussion and
why](http://scn.sap.com/community/support/blog/2013/04/03/how-to-close-a
-discussion-and-why)

Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client
text:
Hi Experts,





We are facing an issue while passing URL as given in the attachment with error
in the conversion routine "CONVERSION_EXIT_EXCRT_OUTPUT".

Please let us know if there exists a sap note to fix the given problem.



Detailed screenshots of the problem have been attached.



Regards,

Saritha
author: Saritha Koroth
Saurabh Gupta
text:
Hi Saritha,



Can you please give a code snap... if possible.



We might have problem with the data type used.



Thanks

Saurabh Gupta
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
This is the exchange rate conversion function, so I expect that you have an
exchange rate element in the entity that is defined as a numeric EDM type - it
probably needs to be made a string. The conversion is trying to SHIFT, which
cannot be done on an elementary number type.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Gaurav Karkara
text:
Hello,



I am also facing the same issue.



@Ron - I tried what you described above but it does not work. If i execute
conversion function independently, its working fine but when executed through
web service, with exact same values/types, it goes for a short dump. What
could be the reason?



Thanks

Gaurav K
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Ron Sargeant
text:
Hi Gaurav,



If you are testing with SE37, the function will work because the test harness
interface is generated appropriately. I would therefore still be checking the
property data type in the model because it is most likely an elementary
numeric. The logic of the conversion seems to be changing an 'internal' value
into a number suitable for list output. You don't necessarily want this to
occur in your feed.

Alternatively, decouple this property from ABAP Dictionary, it is that binding
that is invoking the conversion exit.



Regards



Ron.
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Christoph Birkenhauer
text:
Just faced the same problem. From my point of view it is an error in gateway
framework. It calls output conversion exit for exchange rate and provides non-
character output field as you can see in debugger. If it provided character
like output field (as it should do) everything worked fine. You can not change
this behaviour by entering a different data type for the property of the
entity type.



Did you import the entity type via DDIC structure? This is where it gets the
output conversion info from. If you do not import the exchange rate field from
DDIC but just add it from scratch the error will not show.



Maybe you can suppress output conversion in the first place, but this is my
first day trying it out so I don't have much knowledge about GW or OData.



Regards,

Christoph
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Christoph Birkenhauer
text:
Yes, you can disable output conversion programmatically by overriding
/IWBEP/CL_MGW_ABS_MODEL->DEFINE like that (makes use of some new ABAP
syntax):



METHOD define.  
 super->define( ).  
  
* Disable all output conversion since it is buggy  
 DATA(lt_type) = CAST /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_re_model( model
)->get_entity_types( ).  
 LOOP AT lt_type ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<s_type>).  
 DATA(lo_type) = model->get_entity_type( <s_type>-external_name ).  
 LOOP AT <s_type>-properties ASSIGNING FIELD-
SYMBOL(<s_property>).  
 DATA(lo_property) = lo_type->get_property(
<s_property>-external_name ).  
 lo_property->disable_conversion( ).  
 ENDLOOP.  
 ENDLOOP.  
ENDMETHOD.
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Gaurav Karkara
text:
Hey Christoph,



I also believe its a framework issue. i am planning to open a ticket for the
standard team to check this.



A big thanks for providing this demo code to suppress the conversion. I have
modified it so it disables only exchange rate field & my service works
fine.



Regards

Gaurav K
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Sung-Yen Yang
text:
Hi Gaurav,



I am facing same problem at the moment, what's the suggestion you got from
SAP? Thanks.



Regards,

Nick
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Gaurav Karkara
text:
Hi Nick,



I had disabled the conversion for particular field. I did not open a OSS
message but i think this issue should be resolved in upcoming SPs.



Regards

Gaurav K
title: Re:Error faced while executing URL in SAP Netweaver gateway client

author: Sung-Yen Yang
text:
Hi Gaurav,



Thank you very much.



Regards,

Nick
