Issue with X509 single sign on (SSO) regarding ODATA Gateway Service, Visual
Studio 2012 GWM Trial
text:
Hello everbody!



Weve started a project with SAP ODATA Gateway Service and Visual Studio 2012
with GWM Trial add-in. What we want to achieve is single sign on (SSO) using a
X509 certificate.

The configuration on the SAP side seems to be ok, since we can open the
specific ODATA service within a browser and I see my entityset data. From my
perspective that also means that my client certificate matches the
corresponding certificate on the SAP side.



But it doesnt work from my c# project! We get an exception:

  1. SAP.IW.GWPAM.SSO.SSOException: The system cannot find the X509 user certificate

 bei SAP.IW.SSO.X509CertificateUtil.GetUserCertificate(String[] issuers)



Ive set the keys in the app.config

<add key="SSO" value="X509" />

<add key="RootCASubjectName" value="CN = etc., DC = etc, DC = etc."/>



I copy and paste the string value for the RootCASubjectName key directly from
certificate property and not only the issuer but also the subject name
property. I did this for all nodes in the certificate path.

But still no success. So I got no ideas anymore. Does anybody have experience
with this topic? I would gratefully appreciate any slightest hints.



Thanks in advance



Miles
author: Miles Tone
Miles Tone
text:
Hi guys,

the solution was quite simple, the 'RootCASubjectName' key has to be without
any spaces.

Best regards

Miles
title:
Re:Issue with X509 single sign on (SSO) regarding ODATA Gateway Service,
Visual Studio 2012 GWM Trial
SEGW - Import RFC (1 input parameter and return tables value)
text:
Dear All,



I know the step to create SEGW project by importing RFC/BOR interface.

I try to import a FM which require 1 input parameter and return as tables
value.

[![Import RFC .JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-160
61647-736088/450-110/Import+RFC+.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/
showImage/2-16061647-736088/Import+RFC+.JPG)

ORDER_NUMBER = input parameter

ES_ORDERNUMBER = return single structure

ET_COMPN_HIS[] = return table



[![EntitySet.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-16061
647-736089/450-38/EntitySet.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showI
mage/2-16061647-736089/EntitySet.JPG)

EtCompnHisSet field = ET_COMPN_HIS[]

HistorySet field = ORDER_NUMBER + ES_ORDERNUMBER

  



When i execute the following URL in /iwfnd/gw_client/

/sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST5_SRV/HistorySet(OrderNumber='1231238') = respond
status (OK)

/sap/opu/odata/SAP/ZTEST5_SRV/EtCompnHisSet(OrderNumber='1231238') = respond
status (Bad Request)

[![bad request.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-160
61647-736090/450-241/bad+request.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/
showImage/2-16061647-736090/bad+request.JPG)

I suspect the error showing that the OrderNumber is not exist in
EtCompnHisSet.



But my problem is I need to input OrderNumber as input and return
EtCompnHisSet.

  

May i know how to achieve this?



Regards

Marcus
author: choong chan hol
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



You can achieve this functionality in a single entity and entityset. While
importing the RFC/BOR interface, do not select the checkbox shown adjacent to
the table which selects the entire table rather expand the table and select
all the table columns manually there. This will not create complex type and
all the parameters will be in a single entity(say 'CompHistory' &
'CompHistorySet').



Now you can map this entityset to query operation and then use following in
the URL:

/CompHistorySet?$filter=OrderNumber eq '123456'



you will the table in result.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SEGW - Import RFC (1 input parameter and return tables value)

author: choong chan hol
text:
Hi Ekansh,



It's work like charm. You save me ton of time to figure it out.



Thank you,



Regards

Choong
title: Re:SEGW - Import RFC (1 input parameter and return tables value)

author: choong chan hol
text:
Hi Ekansh,



How if I have 1 input parameters and multiple return table?



If I doing with the same method, it occurs duplicated key since the multiple
return table have same field.



Regards

Marcus
title: Re:SEGW - Import RFC (1 input parameter and return tables value)

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



As I said earlier, selection of key purely depends on the business case and
data.

If you have tables where you have common keys and you still want to
differentiate those in order to display in the UI5 table, you can add a new
property counter and make it as key. You need to populate this property in the
code of GET_ENTITYSET method. When you got the value from tables and looping
on tables in order to populate the et_entityset table, just populate the
counter key as counter = counter + 1.



* you will have to follow the code based approach as the SEGW tool will not allow you to use more than one table for output mapping.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SEGW - Import RFC (1 input parameter and return tables value)

author: choong chan hol
text:
Hi,



Thanks for the clarification that SEGW will only allow one table output for
each request.



Wondering to ask whether the code based approach allow to input as a table and
return output as table? If this is achievable, possible you can give an
example how the /iwfnd/gw_client URL look like?



Regards,

Choong
title: Re:SEGW - Import RFC (1 input parameter and return tables value)

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi choong chan hol,



Nope, you can not pass table as input in either approach.

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:

title: Automatic "GET" calls after "CREATE" - how to avoid this?
author: Kavitha G
Serban Petrescu
text:
Hi Kavitha,



That GET is done to read the new state of the Entity Set (generally because
the data sent to the OData service might not be 100% the data for the new
entity -- because of auto generated IDs, validation, rounding etc).

Anyway, the [documentation ](https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/docs/api/symbol
s/sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel.html)says that you can pass a parameter to the
OData model constructor to cancel this extra GET: bJSON.refreshAfterChange
(which is by default 'true', you would need to set it to 'false'). So your
OData Model would look like so:



    
    
    var model = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel(sPath, {refreshAfterChange: false});
    



The only question is how do you intend to include your newly created entity in
the model? From my knowledge, if you have a table / list of entities, it will
not show the new entity if the GET is not done.



Best regards,

Serban
title: Re:Automatic "GET" calls after "CREATE" - how to avoid this?
How to create WebService which has EntitySets inside EntitySet
text:
Hi, I have an application which creates new employees in a company. For that I
have a form with multiple form containers (sapui5). Each form container
corresponds to a certain abap table in sap system. I would like to know how
can I import and map a WebService In NW GW which corresponds to the following
entity relationships:

    
    
    <EmployeeCollection>
     <Employee>
     <MainDetails>
     <Empfirstname></Empfirstname>
     <Emplastname></Emplastname>
     ........
     </MainDetails>
     <ContactDetails>
     <Email></Email>
     <Workphone></Workphone>
     ........
     </ContactDetails>
     <FamilyMemberCollection>
     <FamilyMember>
     <Firstname></Firstname>
     <Lastname></Lastname>
     ........
     </FamilyMember>
     ........
     </FamilyMemberCollection>
     </Employee>
     .....
    </EmployeeCollection>

I have Employee collection which can have 0...* Employees. Employee has
Entities like MainDetails and ContactDetails AND also Collections like
FamilyMembers which can have 0...* FamilyMember entities.



In SAP I dont have a table for Employees, all employee related details are
held in different abap tables like MainDetails, ContactDetails or
FamilyMembers. The tables are related by Formid field. Now FamilyMember table
can have multiple lines with the same Formid (family members of an employee).



I can map a CREATE operation in SEGW for this, IF everything is singular.

**  
**

**What do i need to do differently in GW or Function module to be able to handle insertion of multiple family members into the FamilyMember abap table? **



**Also, how can I map GetEntity and GetEntitySet oprations so it would output me the kind of structure as i illustrated in the above code? **

GW Redefine - Queries
text:
Hi Team,



Few queries in GW service redefintion



  * Addition filed in GW
    * Is that mandatory to redefine the opertaion methods to populate the value for New fields added in Entity Type(with DDIC structure reference). For populating the value need to redefine the methods in DPC_EXT and copy the existing code and append one line. Is there a way to achieve without the redefine process
  * Changing Function Module for an Entity Type
    * As mentionded in the previous point, need to redefine the method and change the function module name. Is there a way to do the Mapping in Service implementation



Regards,

Satish
author: Satish Kumar
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Satish,



I assume you have created an OData service using SEGW tool and have not
redefined any method in DPC_EXT class. Now if you add a new field in the data
model and click on generate the runtime artifacts, the SEGW will take care of
regenerating all the required methods so that your new property is added
everywhere. The same applies for change of FM, runtime generation will take
care of this.



But if you have redefined any operation method in DPC_EXT and you add a new
property in the entity and regenerate the runtime artifacts, it will add the
property in the model but you will not be able to use that inside your
redefined code unless you manually add that in your code for using it. Since
its already redefined code, just click on edit and add a new line. The same
applies for replacing the FM. This happens because redefinition means that you
want to take control of the code instead of using the auto generated one.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:GW Redefine - Queries

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Satish,



If you found the solution, please close the thread. [How to close a discussion
and why](http://scn.sap.com/community/support/blog/2013/04/03/how-to-close-a
-discussion-and-why)

author: Bharanidaran Venkatachalam
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Bharanidaran,



In the SEGW transaction, You should use the Max Length column for specifying
the maximum length for any property. The precision column is for number of
decimal places.

If you want to pass max 254 length data to your OData service, change the max
length of that property to 254 in gateway and set precision to 0.



PS: you can get more help on what all columns mean by pressing F1 on each
field once you have selected that field by clicking.



Regards,

Ekansh

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Bharanidaran,



We define the max length at the property level in the entity. The process is
same as I described in the first reply. When the maxlength is set for
particular property, it will not accept values exceeding that length. Please
check the properties again. Please make sure you have not defined properties
as internal type string(it will not have any length restriction).

Can you please provide the snapshot of your properties where you are facing
the issue and part of metadata where those properties appear.



Regards,

Ekansh

OData Excel Upload by 'Add File' button in GW_CLIENT gives junk characters
text:
Dear Folks,



Greetings !!

I request your guidance in resolving the "well known" excel upload problem
using GUI_UPLOAD in ABAP. I understand that there are large number of threads
dealing with the excel upload issue, however I have a psecific question to
ask.

I have created an OData service to upload an excel file (Entity type = Media).
For testing the same, I am uploading a test MS excel file in the GW_CLIENT
using the 'Add File' button. The file gets uploaded but appears as junk
characters in the request body. Please refere to the image attached herewith.

I debugged the 'Add File' button and understand that the SAP standard code
uses method GUI_UPLOAD of the GUI frontend services class, with Filetype =
'BIN' (hardcoded) to upload the file. The BINARY data received after the
GUI_UPLOAD is also correct since I tested this by downloading the same BINARY
contents and this creates the same excel file after download. This means that
the excel is read correctly by GUI_UPLOAD.



On more debugging and searching in the SCN forums, I stumbled upon an answer
by [Thomas Jung](http://scn.sap.com/people/thomas.jung) in a post ([Re: Upload
a file excel with web dynpro](http://scn.sap.com/message/8205508#8205508))
stating that the characters uploaded are not JUNK but they are the Native
Binary Excel Format which is a propriatery Microsoft format. Therefore when I
try to convert the XSTRING of this binary to STRING, the contents are not the
excel text contents, instead it is these junk characters.



So, my question is - Is there any way (FM, BAPI, custom code) in ABAP to
convert the native binary excel format into readable text?



Any pointers are highly appreciated.



Thank you.



Regards,

Sud
author: Sudarshan B
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Sudarshan,



I too had the same issue. This is something that we can not convert this
proprietary format to string and we have to move to csv files. I also checked
various forums and had to move to csv. Here is my experience on this [Convert
XSTRING of CSV to Internal Table for mass
actions](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/12/08/convert-xstring-
of-csv-to-internal-table-for-mass-actions)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:OData Excel Upload by 'Add File' button in GW_CLIENT gives junk characters

author: Sudarshan B
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thank you for your comments, CSV file can solve the issue. However, the
problem with using CSV is that I will not be allowed to use comma ',' in the
file. My file has one text field called 'Description' where the user can write
text seperated by comma. If the user input comma in the description, then the
program will seperate this one description field into multiple fields, which
is incorrect.



Anyway thank you for your reply.



Regards,

Sud
title: Re:OData Excel Upload by 'Add File' button in GW_CLIENT gives junk characters

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



Just try my code shared in the above link, I think I had taken care of that.





Regards,

Ekansh

component IW_GIL in Gateway
text:
Hello All,



Kindly help me in knowing what is the use of the component IW_GIL in terms of
SAP Gateway Components.



Why this is being used and how i can check weather this component is installed
in my sap system or not?



Best Regards,

Vikash
author: Vikash Rakshit
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Vikas,



this component provides a generic OData adapter for content based on Generic
Interaction Layer i.e. GenIL. You can find more details on [Integration of SAP
NetWeaver Gateway and GenIL - SAP NetWeaver Gateway - SAP Library](http://help
.sap.com/saphelp_gateway20sp09/helpdata/en/af/1184220e2f486aa4c194076233b539/c
ontent.htm) [Transform GenIL objects into OData services  Fast and
Easy!](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2012/10/18/transform-genil-
objects-into-odata-services-fast-and-easy)



To check the component in your system: go to navigation menu in SAP GUI >
go to system > go to status > click on the icon with a magnifying glass
'Component Information'. This will provide you a list of components installed
on your SAP system.



Regards,

Ekansh

Function Import POST with multi line text
text:
Hi All,



We are developing a GW serice for approval scenario and want to use Function
Import for Confiming Work Item. We followed the Link
<http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway/blog/2014/03/06/let-s-code-crudq-and-
function-import-operations-in-odata-
service#jive_content_id_6_Function_Import_> and created the Function Import
for POST method. On Workitem rejection, comment is mandatory and need to pass
the comments to function module. Need help on how to pass the comments to
function module through the Function import as the comments is an internal
table in function module(can accept any no of lines) and Function import does
not supports request body also.



Regards,

Satish
author: Satish Kumar
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Satish,



Please check this message [POST operation in SAPUI5 |
SCN](https://scn.sap.com/message/14582162#14582162). Here is the code snippet
that worked for our case:



var requestData =| {  
---|---  
| ClearTaskList:'X',  
| NotificationNo:oThisNotifDB.notifNo,  
| Type:"",  
| Group:"",  
| GroupCounter:""  
  
};

var oModel = new
sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel("/sap/opu/odata/sap/MYSERVICE_SRV/",false);

oModel.refreshSecurityToken(null, null, false);

sap.ui.core.BusyIndicator.show();





oModel.callFunction('AssignTaskListToNotification',{

| method: 'POST',  
---|---  
| urlParameters: requestData,  
| success:function(oData, oResponse){  
| | | //remove busy indicator  
| },  
| error:function(error){  
| | | //remove busy indicator  
| | |  
| },  
| async: true  
  
});



the syntax highlighting part did not worked for me this time while posting
this reply.

Here is how I am handling in gateway:



WHEN 'AssignTaskListToNotification' .

 DATA LV_TYPE TYPE PLNTY.

 DATA LV_GROUP TYPE PLNNR.

 DATA LV_GROUP_COUNTER TYPE PLNAL.

 DATA LV_CLEAR TYPE BOOLEAN.





 LOOP AT IT_PARAMETER INTO LS_PARAMETER.

 CASE LS_PARAMETER-NAME.

 WHEN 'NotificationNo'.

 LV_QMNUM = LS_PARAMETER-VALUE.

 WHEN 'Type'.

 LV_TYPE = LS_PARAMETER-VALUE.

 WHEN 'Group'.

 LV_GROUP = LS_PARAMETER-VALUE.

 WHEN 'GroupCounter'.

 LV_GROUP_COUNTER = LS_PARAMETER-VALUE.

 WHEN 'ClearTaskList'.

 LV_CLEAR = LS_PARAMETER-VALUE.

 ENDCASE.

 ENDLOOP.





 CALL FUNCTION 'Z_XXX_NOTI_TASK_UPDATE'

 EXPORTING

 I_QMNUM = LV_QMNUM

 I_PLNTY = LV_TYPE

 I_PLNNR = LV_GROUP

 I_PLNAL = LV_GROUP_COUNTER

 I_CLEAR = LV_CLEAR

 TABLES

 T_RETURN = T_RETURN.

 READ TABLE T_RETURN WITH KEY TYPE = 'E' TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.

 IF SY-SUBRC = 0.

 MO_CONTEXT->GET_MESSAGE_CONTAINER( )->ADD_MESSAGES_FROM_BAPI(

 EXPORTING

 IT_BAPI_MESSAGES = T_RETURN " Return parameter table

 IV_DETERMINE_LEADING_MSG = /IWBEP/IF_MESSAGE_CONTAINER=&gt
;GCS_LEADING_MSG_SEARCH_OPTION-FIRST " Use no/first/last as leading message

 ).

 RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /IWBEP/CX_MGW_BUSI_EXCEPTION

 EXPORTING

 TEXTID =
/IWBEP/CX_EPM_BUSI_EXCEPTION=>BUSINESS_ERROR

 MESSAGE_CONTAINER = MO_CONTEXT->GET_MESSAGE_CONTAINER( ).

 ENDIF.

 COPY_DATA_TO_REF(

 EXPORTING

 IS_DATA = T_RETURN

 CHANGING

 CR_DATA = ER_DATA

 ).



How you want the data to FM is completely your choice.





Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Function Import POST with multi line text

author: Satish Kumar
text:
Hi Ekansh,



I was able to handle the POST with parameters which is not having multi line.
In my case user will pass some comment text on approval or rejection which can
be in multiple lines. We were able to handle such scenario using inline
functionality in Entity POST but in Function Import request body is not
supported.



Regards,

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Satish,



I got your point, that is why I mentioned that how you pass the data to FM is
your choice. I think you can take the user input in a string, pass it to
gateway using above approach, receive it in string, split this string in table
as you need and pass it to the FM.

Let me know if I have been wrong in understanding your case.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Function Import POST with multi line text

author: Satish Kumar
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Did the same way but need to know the max characters allowed for a url
parameter.



Regards,

Satish
title: Re:Function Import POST with multi line text

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Sathish,



We are firing 'POST' method here which normally accepts request till
8M(changeable @ server side), which is definitely not a problem for sending
the comments text in your case.



However regarding the max size, [Andre
Fischer](http://scn.sap.com/people/andre.fischer) can help.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Function Import POST with multi line text

author: Andre Fischer
text:
I have been told that up to 8 kbyte should be supported.

But in order to be on the safe side you can put your call into a $batch
request.

This is also a typical solution for SAPUI5 if client OData calls become to
long from a URL perspective.

When being send in a $batch request these technical restrictions to not apply.

Best Regards,

Andre
title: Re:Function Import POST with multi line text

Erroneous JSON-Timestamps?
text:
Dear fellow developers,



I developed an OData service which contains entity types with Edm.DateTime
properties. Using that service I receive erroneous results for timestamps when
requesting JSON responses, which differ from the result received when
requesting XML.



Did anyone of you ever experience that?



Example request:

..._SRV/MaintenanceNotifications?$filter=ChangeTimestamp ge
datetime'2015-07-10T09:00:00'



XML response:

...<d:ChangeTimesamp>2015-07-14T**09**:22:48</(d:ChangeTimesamp>



JSON response (request sent with header Accept = application/json):

..."ChangeTimestamp" : "\/Date(**1436865768000**)\/"...



The timestamp from the JSON response corresponds to 2015-07-14 at
**11**:22:48, which is 2 hours ahead of the value in the XML response.



2 hours is also the time zone difference between UTC and CET summertime.
System time zone and user time zone are both set to CET.

However, that should not make a difference, as XML responses are already
correct?!



The System is on NetWeaver 7.4 with SAP_GWFND 740 SP 8.



Thank you for any helpful hints,

best regards,



Ringo



Message was edited by: Ringo Liebscher - added missing example request and
responses.
author: Ringo Liebscher
Silvio Haehner
text:
As you implicitly mentioned right the DateTime in JSON is the number of
milliseconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00.000.

But that point in time relates to **UTC**!



DateTime in XML is, as specified: Without a trailing **Z** at the timestamp
the timestamp means system time zone, otherwise ZULU (=UTC) time.

Its different in OData/JSON: Here a timestamp is always UTC and its up to the
FrontEnd-Dev to implement the timezone-adaption. E.g. get the local time zone
from OS (or browser) and adjust the timestamp with JavaScript.



Greets

Silvio
title: Re:Erroneous JSON-Timestamps?

author: Ringo Liebscher
text:
Hi Silvio,



the way you described the processing of JSON timestamps is exactly what I
expected: I wish to be in control of time zone conversions. Unfortunately, I
am not in control and outgoing timestamp values are automatically changed
after my method in the data provider extension class is finished, in my case
they are decreased by two hours.



Setting the user time zone to UTC does not change the result. I am curious
whether changing the system time zone would have an effect, but I wouldnt do
that in a running system.



The problem does not only occur in responses, but also in the interpretation
of DateTime values in request bodies when creating or updating entities. In
that case, the incoming timestamps are increased by two hours. However, in
that case I could solve it by passing values in the format "YYYY-MM-
DDTHH:MM:SS" instead of a milliseconds timestamp.



Setting the property type to Edm.DateTimeOffset does not change the result.



Its very unlikely that Im the only one to have that issue - nobody else
worked with JSON timestamps in SP 8?
title: Re:Erroneous JSON-Timestamps?

SAP Netweaver Gateway Project/Entity/Service with Offline Data
text:
Hello,



I have some doubdts about Odata Services when we need to use Offline Data in
the device.



Its possible to have an individual project for each Service (several
metadatas) that we have to create to get que offline app working? or we have
to use an individual Project for N services with a unique metadata for
serveral services.



Which is the best practice for generate a new version of an Odata for future
maintenance? For example if we have to extend a field in a RFC is prefered to
have a new version of the service? or create a new project to have totally
independent all changes.



Is recomended to have only one project with several services/metadatas for
each application development? (for example a Sales app where we have
customers, materials, prices, stock, open items, etc.).



For now we have each service with an individual project but we are not sure if
this can be like that.

text:
You can have single project with multiple entities which has navigation &
association properties implemented.
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project/Entity/Service with Offline Data

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Max,



A single gateway project can have multiple entity/entitysets each of these
entities have 5 operations (CRUDQ). This also provides you a capability to
define the relations between two entities which can be used for Deep Insert
and $Expand calls.

It is not at all recommended to create separate service/project for any new
entity.



How this is structured is:

1 project will have 1 service and 1 metadata for that service. This service
can contain multiple entitysets. The metadata document belong to the service
and not to the entityset. So metadata is same for the whole service. This
metadata will have all the entitysets that you created for that service.



Hope it clarifies.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SAP Netweaver Gateway Project/Entity/Service with Offline Data

Now consider my sapui5 application has to contact two on premise system

/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_test/testdataset

.



In that how we can differentiate in runtime?

author: Nagesh Caparthy
text:
Hi Vikash,



Are you talking about a scenario like ICD and ISD as your Dev and QA System
where you have PGD as your HUB system. This would be tricky to handle. If you
have such a deployment and if your UI5 app launchpad also has same port then
it would be difficult to handle.



In one of our project, we have similar situation but, we handle it with SAP
Client ID and Launchpad Ports(8080 for Dev and 8081 for QA) in your case ICD
and ISD.



Best way to avoid this to have a different naming convention if possible.

[![answer.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-16154355

author: Jay Prakash Singh
text:
Hi Vikash,



if you want data from both system you can use RFC.

  

Example suppose you have ICD and ISD system , and you are going to create
your odata in ICD , so what you can do you can call RFC from ICD to access ISD
information.

  

So now when you will call your getaways service , through netweaver , ICD and
ISD both will get called.

  

Thanks,

JP
title: Re:Information on SAP Gateway of Hub Architecture

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Vikash,



> In other way my question is how the PGD system is going to call ICD System.



This is handled by the gateway framework and system alias attached to the
service.



**What is system alias:**

System alias is a wrapper around the RFC destination with some other settings.
You can check this for details [System Alias in Netweaver Gateway
](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3670210) .



**Role of Local App flag:**

The gateway framework checks the attached system aliases for the service on
the PGD system and then checks whether local app flag is checked or not, if
this is checked that means the DPC/MPC classes are on the same system and only
data is fetched from the backend system(ICD). So the flow continues to the DPC
class & methods on the PGD system and only data is fetched from the ICD
system using RFC.

If local app is not checked, the gateway framework would get to know that the
DPC/MPC classes are on backend system and thus flow would be transferred to
the ICD system.



**Role of Trust & RFC destination:**

RFC destination is mandatory in order to communicate between two systems but
the trust is not mandatory. You can use untrusted RFC destination as well but
you will always login to the backend system with fixed user. This will make
tracking of user's activity very difficult. Thus trust is recommended
approach.



If this solves your query, please close the thread.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Information on SAP Gateway of Hub Architecture

author: Vikash Rakshit
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Your answer cleared my doubt.



Thank you.



Regards,

Vikash
title: Re:Information on SAP Gateway of Hub Architecture

author: Jay Mercuro
text:
Hi **Nagesh**,



Actually, we are already able to generate PDF from my OData for employee's
POV. We want the same thing to be achieved on manager's POV as it is
applicable for him to select multiple employees then generate a single PDF for
them.

[![PDF.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-16162185-76
9221/450-259/PDF.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-1616
2185-769221/PDF.jpg)



Thanks,

Jay
title: Re:How to Generate PDF Based on Multiple Selection from Query's Hit List

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Jay,



The get_stream method supports read of only 1 file and there is no other
method available in the framework which can allow you to get multiple files.

I think your requirement is to consolidate all individual pdfs for selected
employees and give single pdf. There are two aspects in this:



**1\. Passing multiple values as filter in GET_STREAM:**

you can handle this by making a generic property say 'EmpFilter' of type
string. Concatenate all selected employee ids with some predefined
separator(like '~' or '|') and then pass it to the EmpFilter property. You can
split this string and fill an internal table in the get_stream code in order
to pass to the RFC that will give you the PDF. The URI would look like:

/EmployeeIPROSet(EmpFilter='101~102~103~104')/$value

where 101, 102 etc are employee ids.



**2\. PDF generation:**

This requirement can be handled with smartform. ABAPer can create a smartform
which uses a loop and populate details of the passed employee ids. Otherwise
if you want to use the existing smartforms, you can merge multiple PDFs into
single PDF using ABAP. You will multiple solutions for this by googling.



Let me know if I did not get your requirement.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:How to Generate PDF Based on Multiple Selection from Query's Hit List

.NET application my post to the GW server doesn't work because the edit-link
/self-link is empty.



This is the error message:



_'**xxx**/MeldingSet(ConsumerId='**xxx**',Action='CHECK00',Language='N',KlantN
ummer='0010084320',VerbruiksPlaatsId='0070085438')' does not have a self-link
or an edit-link associated with it. Please make sure that the entity has
either a self-link or an edit-link associated with it._

the upgrade everything worked fine.

author: Robbe Wuyts
Jorge Fioranelli
text:
Hi Robbe,



I have exactly the same problem. Were you able to find a solution?



Thanks in advanced



Jorge
title: Re:Self-link/Edit-link issue

author: Valentin Huber
text:
Hi Robbe,



I'm don't know why a self link (or edit link) is apparently mandatory, but you
could try to add a self link in the POST request body like this:



    
    
    
    
    <entry xml:base=...>
    
    
    
    
     <id>SERVER/CategorySet('Phablets')</id>
    
    
    
    
     <title type="text">CategorySet('Phablets')</title>
    
    
    
    
     <updated>2015-08-21T09:17:07Z</updated>
    
    
    
    
     <category term="SERVICE.Category" scheme="<http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/scheme>" />
    
    
    
    
     **<link href="CategorySet('Phablets')" rel="self" title="Category" />**
    
    
    
    
     <content type="application/xml">
    
    
    
    
     <m:properties>
    
    
    
    
     <d:Name>Phablets</d:Name>
    
    
    
    
     </m:properties>
    
    
    
    
     </content>
    
    
    
    
    </entry>
    
    
    

Here a new Category entity would be created (with only the single property
"Name" and value "Phablet"). The link in bold is the self link. Try to include
a similar link in your POST request.



I hope this helps.



Kind regards,

Valentin
title: Re:Self-link/Edit-link issue
How to handle create request for links (without deep insert)?
text:
Hi experts,



I would like to handle a simple OData create request that shall create a new
entity with a link, but I fail to figure out how to get a hold of the link
information from the request body.



I set up a simple EPM-based OData Service with two entities:

\- Category with single property "name" (as key)

\- MainCategory with single property "name" (as key)

\- Association Assoc_CatToMainCat which assigns each Category its MainCategory
(and a MainCategory may be associated to multiple Categories).

\- Generated ...Set collections: CategorySet, MainCategorySet



I would like to create a new Category "Phablet" for the existing MainCategory
"Smartphones & Tablets". For this I send a POST request to the service's
CategorySet with the following request body:



<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

<entry>

<id>SERVER/CategorySet('Phablets')</id>

<title type="text">CategorySet('Phablets')</title>

<updated>2015-08-21T08:10:09Z</updated>

<category term="SERVICE.Category"
scheme="<http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/scheme>" />

<link href="CategorySet('Phablets')" rel="self" title="Category" />

** <link href="CategorySet('Smartphones%20%26%20Tablets')" rel="<http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/related/MainCategory>" type="application/atom+xml;type=entry" title="MainCategory"/>**

<content type="application/xml">

 <m:properties>

 <d:Name>Phablets</d:Name>

 </m:properties>

</content>

</entry>



With the link in bold I would like to express the fact that the new Category
should be associated to the existing MainCategory (this should be correct
according to the OData version 2 spec).



The Gateway server then calls my redefined CATEGORYSET_CREATE_ENTITY method in
the data provider extension class.



In this handler method I load the input data with



DATA: ls_data LIKE er_entity.  
  
io_data_provider->read_entry_data( IMPORTING es_data = ls_data ).





However, afterwards the stucture variable ls_data contains only the new
Category's name "Phablets", but not the MainCategory's name. When I look at
the IMPORTING parameters of the ..._CREATE_ENTITY method I don't find how I
can figure out that the new Category shall be associated to the MainCategory.
It seems to me that the link in bold is not passed on to the handler method.



Could you provide some guidance on how to handle the creation of new links
between entities?



Thanks in advance!



Regards,

Valentin

title: Change/Enhance Generated Gateway Metadata
text:
Is there a way to change the gateway generated metadata? I understand that
there Model Provider Extension Class which allows to manipulate some values
however here is what I'm looking for.



Smart Filterbar and SmartTable controls require the attribute
sap:filterable="true" or sap:required-in-filter="true". While the gateway
doesn't allow to set or return required-in-filter attribute but it does allow
to set the filter field to true/false. The default is true, so the meta
doesn't return those values:



[![Capture.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1620910
7-783433/450-59/Capture.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage
/2-16209107-783433/Capture.JPG)



The examples from [SAPUI5 Explored](https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/explo
red.html#/sample/sap.ui.comp.sample.smartfilterbar/preview) always contain
embedded metadata with correct attributes set, hence work as expected, but
they do not work with the gateway metadata.



I could modify the metadata and using the mock data make my code work, however
I need to be able to do the same to the generated metadata until sap gateway
team provides a fix or ui5 development interprets the metadata respecting the
defaults.



[![Capture2.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-162091
07-783446/450-93/Capture2.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showIma
ge/2-16209107-783446/Capture2.JPG)



Appreciate any help from the Gateway gurus.



Thank You

[![Capture3.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-162108

author: Peter de Jong

title: How to setup dynamic serving of SAPUI5 applications based on User Agent ?
text:
Dynamic serving is required to be setup where the server responds with
different HTML (and CSS) on the same URL depending on the user agent
requesting the page.



We require redirection to a BSP application based on the User Agent of the
incoming request. For example : If the User Agent is iPad/Android/...any
mobile/tablet device it should open one BSP application say :

sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/mobile_version and if the user agent is laptop/desktop
device then it should open another BSP application :
sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/desktop_version.



The User Agent property is part of the request header.
author: Mayank Jain
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Mayank,



[SAPUI5 Developer Center ](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center
/front-end)

would be the correct forum for your question. But still I would say that you
can achieve this in index.html of your UI5 application and load the
views/controllers as per the user agent.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:How to setup dynamic serving of SAPUI5 applications based on User Agent ?
Recommended System alias Name for embedded deployment?
text:
What is the recommended system alias name for Embedded deployment ?

I am using LOCAL till data in sandbox system ,

Is is a good way to go with system alias as DEV, QUA, PROD for migrating the
TRs ? Can someone help me understand this much better.



[SAP Gateway](http://scn.sap.com/community/gateway)



Thanks in advance,

Kiran
author: Kiran k
Ashwin Dutt R
text:
Hello Kiran,



In your case which is Embedded Deployment, you can create a System Alias as '
LOCAL ' and move to other landscapes along with TR.



Some cases which i have come across involved manual creation of System Alias
as 'LOCAL' after moving objects to Quality, Pre_Production and Production and
assign the same to the service.

This needs opening of the client of the system for some time to assign
manually created System Alias to the service in the above cases.



Regards,

Ashwin
title: Re:Recommended System alias Name for embedded deployment?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Kiran,



I would also suggest the same, to use LOCAL in all the servers. This would
save the time and efforts after transporting to DEV, QA, PROD systems.



Regards,

Ekansh

Recently I am trying out SMP Push Notifications using this documentation <http

Standard Demo Flight Service "**RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT**" starting page 14 in the
document .



I did all the tasks from running SubscriptionCollections via rest client to
running the sample standard program **/IWBEP/R_MGW_PUSH_TEST** in the program
the sending was apparently successful but when I checked tcode SLG1 for the

[![](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-16070394-738739/pa
stedImage_0.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-16070394-

Here are the records in table /IWBEP/D_MGW_SUB

author: Charles Cedric Tan
Charles Cedric Tan
text:
I Solved the** "Wrong format of delivery address:"** message OSS Note 2120880

But I am still getting the** "OData Client - notification to - - failed -
HTTP"** error
title:
Re:"Wrong format of delivery address:" and "OData Client - notification to - -
failed - HTTP" when sending Push Notifications via SAP Backend

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi,



The OData client - notification to - - failed - HTTP error is caused due to
problem in RFC destination pointing to the subscriber from the gateway system.

Please check the RFC destination.



Regards,

Ekansh
title:
Re:"Wrong format of delivery address:" and "OData Client - notification to - -
failed - HTTP" when sending Push Notifications via SAP Backend

author: Charles Cedric Tan
text:
Thanks.



I resolved both issues.



To Fix **"Wrong format of delivery address:"** message I applied OSS Note
2120880 (there's an earlier OSS note as well but for me it was already
applied).



**"OData Client - notification to - - failed - HTTP"**

Yeah it had something to do with the RFC Destination.



I had to do the following:

1: Use user credentials of a Push User in the SMP. I had to ask someone to
help with this.



2\. Change the path prefix in the RFC Destination I created. The tutorial link
specified /Push/ but it's a bit different in ours but I found out the HTTP to
send push notifications is **"<http://><host>:<proxy>/restnotific
ation/application/<application ID from SMP Push>/"**

**  
**

so I had to change it from **/Push/** to
**/restnotification/application/<application ID from SMP Push>/user**

**  
**

The "user" at the end is because I am sending Push Notifications per use. See
"Users per application" section at link <http://help.sap.com/saphelp_smp305svr
/helpdata/en/6a/e1d7aabc2946c68d3c56acd42ec522/content.htm>



Unfortunatley I still couldn't get the sample program to work. Thus we decided
to just use the RFC and create a custom program and use the cl_http_client. It
works.



So we just went with that.
title:
Re:"Wrong format of delivery address:" and "OData Client - notification to - -
failed - HTTP" when sending Push Notifications via SAP Backend

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Charles,



Its good that finally it worked.

Can you please close the thread so that its easy for others to get the correct
solution.

[How to close a discussion and
why](http://scn.sap.com/community/support/blog/2013/04/03/how-to-close-a
-discussion-and-why)
title:
Re:"Wrong format of delivery address:" and "OData Client - notification to - -
failed - HTTP" when sending Push Notifications via SAP Backend

author: Rakshit Doshi
text:

Can you try to post the program here as well for reference.





Thanks,

Rakshit Doshi
title:
Re:"Wrong format of delivery address:" and "OData Client - notification to - -
failed - HTTP" when sending Push Notifications via SAP Backend

author: Charles Cedric Tan
text:
Hi, here you go



*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*

*& Report Z_PUSH_TEST

*&

*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*

*&

*&

*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*



REPORT z_push_test.



TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_user,

 user(100) TYPE c,

 END OF ty_user.



DATA: lt_user TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_user.

DATA: ls_user TYPE ty_user.



START-OF-SELECTION.

 PERFORM start.



* ---

FORM start.



 DATA: lv_status TYPE i,

 lv_error_occurred TYPE flag,

 lv_error_msg TYPE string,

 lv_response_body TYPE string.



 DATA: lv_json TYPE string.



 DATA: lv_url TYPE string.



* get your users from your table

 MOVE: '<specify SMP User or Registration Device>' TO ls_user-user.

 APPEND ls_user TO lt_user.



* MOVE: '<specify other SMP User or Registration Device>' TO ls_user-user.

* APPEND ls_user TO lt_user.



 LOOP AT lt_user INTO ls_user.



 CLEAR: lv_json.



 CONCATENATE '{ "notification": { "alert": "'

 'title'

 '", "data": "'

 'testData'

 '", "sound": "'

 'soundval'

 '" }, "users": [ "'

 ls_user-user

 '" ] }'

 INTO lv_json.



* SMP_PUSH is a configured RFC Destination and must be created

 PERFORM send_json

 USING 'SMP_PUSH'

 lv_json

 CHANGING lv_status lv_response_body

 lv_error_occurred

 lv_error_msg.



* Show result

 FORMAT COLOR OFF.

 WRITE: ls_user-user.

 FORMAT COLOR COL_HEADING.

 WRITE: / 'Response status:', lv_status.

 IF lv_error_occurred = 'X'.

 FORMAT COLOR COL_NEGATIVE.

 WRITE: / 'Error occurred:', lv_error_msg.

 ENDIF.

 FORMAT COLOR COL_NORMAL.

 WRITE: / 'Response:', lv_response_body.

 SKIP 2.



 ENDLOOP.

ENDFORM. "start



*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*

*& Form send_json

*&\---------------------------------------------------------------------*

* text

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*

* -->IV_URL text

* -->IV_JSON_DATA text

* -->CV_STATUS text

* -->CV_RESPONSE_BODY text

* -->CV_ERROR_OCCURRED text

* -->CV_ERROR_MSG text

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*

FORM send_json USING iv_rfc

 iv_json_data TYPE string

 CHANGING cv_status TYPE i

 cv_response_body TYPE string

 cv_error_occurred TYPE flag

 cv_error_msg TYPE string.





 DATA: lo_client TYPE REF TO if_http_client.



 CLEAR: cv_error_msg,

 cv_status,

 cv_error_occurred,

 cv_error_msg.



 IF iv_rfc IS INITIAL.

* No URL passed

 MESSAGE e349(sbds) INTO cv_error_msg.

 cv_error_occurred = 'X'.

 RETURN.

 ENDIF.



 CALL METHOD cl_http_client=>create_by_destination

 EXPORTING

 destination = iv_rfc

 IMPORTING

 client = lo_client

 EXCEPTIONS

 argument_not_found = 1

 destination_not_found = 2

 destination_no_authority = 3

 plugin_not_active = 4

 internal_error = 5

 OTHERS = 6.

 IF sy-subrc <> 0.

 MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno

 WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4

 INTO cv_error_msg.

 cv_error_occurred = 'X'.

 RETURN.

 ENDIF.



* CALL METHOD cl_http_client=>create_by_url

* EXPORTING

* url = iv_url

* IMPORTING

* client = lo_client

* EXCEPTIONS

* argument_not_found = 1

* plugin_not_active = 2

* internal_error = 3

* OTHERS = 4.

* IF sy-subrc NE 0.

* MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno

* WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4

* INTO cv_error_msg.

* cv_error_occurred = 'X'.

* RETURN.

* ENDIF.

*

* lo_client->propertytype_logon_popup = lo_client->co_disabled.

* DATA l_username TYPE string.

* DATA l_password TYPE string.

* l_username = 'smpPushUser'.

* l_password = 'Password101'.

* CALL METHOD lo_client->authenticate

* EXPORTING

* username = l_username

* password = l_password.



 lo_client->request->set_cdata( iv_json_data ).

 lo_client->request->set_content_type( 'application/json' ).

 lo_client->request->set_method( 'POST' ).

 CALL METHOD lo_client->send

 EXCEPTIONS

 http_communication_failure = 1

 http_invalid_state = 2

 http_processing_failed = 3

 OTHERS = 4.

 IF sy-subrc NE 0.

 lo_client->get_last_error( IMPORTING message = cv_error_msg ).

 cv_error_occurred = 'X'.

 RETURN.

 ENDIF.



 lo_client->receive( EXCEPTIONS OTHERS = 1 ).

 IF sy-subrc NE 0.

 lo_client->get_last_error( IMPORTING message = cv_error_msg ).

 cv_error_occurred = 'X'.

 RETURN.

 ENDIF.



 cv_response_body = lo_client->response->get_cdata( ).

 lo_client->response->get_status( IMPORTING code = cv_status ).



ENDFORM. "send_json
title:
Re:"Wrong format of delivery address:" and "OData Client - notification to - -
failed - HTTP" when sending Push Notifications via SAP Backend

How to create a service with table input?
text:
Hi Experts



 I want to create a Gateway service which has only one entity type.



 This entity type is of table type meaning it can have multiple rows of
data.



 EntGroups --> Entity type. It contains 2 fields.

 SerialNumber

 GroupId



 The backend FM has a table type input and updates the record in custom
table.



 How can I develop this? Please help!



Thanks

Gopal
author: Gopalkrishna Baliga
VENU G
text:
Hi Gopal,



Please check the below blog on how to create a Gateway service using RFC. You
have to implement CREATE_  
Entity method for updating a new entries into you custom table.









[Detailed step by step procedure for Creating Gateway Service with all the
CRUD Operations and testing them in Service Ex](http://scn.sap.com/community
/developer-center/netweaver-gateway/blog/2013/12/22/steps-in-creating-gateway-
service-with-all-the-crud-operations)





Regards,

Venu
title: Re:How to create a service with table input?

author: Gopalkrishna Baliga
text:
Hi Venu



 I think you did not understood my Question.



 I have a backend FM which has one input parameter of type TABLE.



 Now in Gateway I want to create a service for this FM. Remember I need to
pass multiple rows of data to the FM as input. Also I am actually updating
records that is being sent in the backend code. Also note that I have only one
entity in gateway. So no association.



 One thing I found is that I have to use Batch update option. That is $batch.



 In the gateway input payload I need to call the UPDATE_ENTITY method
multiple times for as many records that I need to update in backend.



 I would like to know if this is the correct approach. Is there a better way
to do the same?
title: Re:How to create a service with table input?

author: VENU G
text:
Hi Gopal,



To update the Multiple entries in single gateway service call you have to use
$batch functionality. The approach you are following is correct.



I hope you already have information how to use $batch update functionality.



Regards,

Venu
title: Re:How to create a service with table input?

author: Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Gopal,



As Venu suggested, you have to use $batch. Also please check this thread that
may solve your problem of calling UPDATE_ENTITY multiple times:
[UpdateEntity](http://scn.sap.com/thread/3784022)



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:How to create a service with table input?

SAP GW Service Builder - How to recover unintentionally deleted project
text:
Hello everyone



I accidentally mangaged to delete the SRA016_PRICE_AVAIL (SAP Standard Service
for Fiori App) project in SAP Gateway Service Builder. Don't ask me how this
happend exactly. I most probable just misinterpreted something during my 1st
redefinition trials with it.



Is there an easy way to recover the project data for it?



...DPC_EXT and ...MPC_EXT classes are still there.



Unfortunately I don't have a EDMX file of it to reload using the import
function... if that would be the solution.

And unfortunately I even don't have another system to create the $metadata
from it as it happend on our sandbox system.



The only way I can think about it right now is to restore the system from a
recent backup we have. But this would have some other impacts I'd like to
avoid if somehow possible.



Thanks in advance for any help on it!



Regards

Renaud
author: Renaud Desarzens
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Renaud,



If you have registered the service on the gateway system, the service would
still work. Try accessing the service from the gateway system and you would be
able to access the metadata document.

If the service was not registered and only runtime artifacts were generated,
you can still register the service on the gateway and access metadata then.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:SAP GW Service Builder - How to recover unintentionally deleted project

author: Renaud Desarzens
text:
Hi Ekansh



Your answer is very appreciated. Thank you!



Yes, the service was registered and still worked. However, we solved it by
restoring our sandbox system over night.



Regards,

Renaud
title: Re:SAP GW Service Builder - How to recover unintentionally deleted project

text:

author: M S
jitendra kansal
text:
Hi,

Remove Service Builder Project
text:
Hi guys,



I stumbled upon the following issue:

I created a new project in Service Builder and removed it later on, I also
deleted service and model in transaction SPRO but I cannot remove the GW
Service Builder Project in se80, in fact I can't do anything with it! My
intention was to delete the folder containing the project but even reassigning
another package is not possible.



Any ideas?



Regards,

Thomas
author: Thomas Konter
Nils Janssen
text:
I think this discussion needs a push
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/happy.gif)
title: Re:Remove Service Builder Project

author: Thomas Konter
text:
I think so, too, though I managed to at least **move the project to another
folder:**

  * Open Service Builder (transaction **SEGW**)
  * Right click the project and choose '**Object Directory Entry**'
  * Assign your project to another package

This doesn't solve the initial problem but it might help with swapping some
content to another folder in order to be able to remove the first
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/wink.gif)
title: Re:Remove Service Builder Project

author: Nils Janssen
text:
Hi Thomas,



that is a nice idea how to get around it....but unfortunately I already
deleted the project and I am not sure if I can undo this in any way^^.
title: Re:Remove Service Builder Project

author: Thomas Konter
text:
You could create another project with the same name as a replacement, as far
as I remember I had to do that as well
![](http://scn.sap.com/1336/images/emoticons/wink.gif)

Search Operation in Odata
text:
Hello Experts,



I came to a situation where there are 4 search fields and on clicking the
search button the table entries should get filed.



Now the situation is out of this four search fields , two fields belongs to
one entity set and the other two belongs to different entity set ,



I don't want to create a new entity which contains this four fields , then how
i can do the search operation based on the value provided in the



text fields.



Kindly help on this.



Best Regards,

Vikash
author: Vikash Rakshit
Ekansh Saxena
text:
Hi Vikash,



While modelling the gateway service, consider a service entity as a real world
business entity. So your entity must contain all the properties on which you
want to perform the operation. Thus you must have all these 4 properties in
one entity in order to perform a query call on that entity.

Let me know if you have further doubts.



Regards,

Ekansh
title: Re:Search Operation in Odata

author: Vikash Rakshit
text:
Hi Ekansh,



Thanks for the reply.I also felt the same but was not sure.



Regards,

Vikash
title: Re:Search Operation in Odata
Customer Namespace and GW Service not available in SICF
text:
Hi All,



We have developed a gateway service and the same is tranported to customer
system.After importing the TRs in customer landscape we found the namespace
and gw service are not available in SICF. In /iwfnd/maint_service t-code under
ICF node Odata is not active.



Regards,

Satish
author: Satish Kumar
Yueqiang Zhu
text:
Hi Satish,



i have the same issue and i fixed this by modifying the description of the
namespace.

here are the steps for your reference.

1) double click the namespace you want to transport in SICF.

2) Click edit to go to the change mode.

3) modify the Description for instance : from Namespace to Namespace1

 you could choose any description.

4) save the configuration

5) choose the TR

6) Transport the TR then the namespace will show up in the QA system.



regards,

Yueqiang
title: Re:Customer Namespace and GW Service not available in SICF

How to access request object in Model Provider Class?
text:
Dear specialists,



as my previous post is located in the wrong area ([How to access request
object in Model Provider
Class](http://scn.sap.com/message/16252063#16252063)),

I repost my question here:



I want to define the data model of my OData service dynamically depending on
an URI paramter of my HTTP request. But so far I did not find any possibility
to access the request object in the model provider class.



Does anybody has a hint for me?



Many thanks in advance.



Best regards,

Juergen
author: Jrgen Zeifang
Vengaiah Chowdary Pachava Chinna
text:
Hi Juergen,



I did not understand your question clearly. What i understood is , you want
access a data model based on your Http request. If this is right , then
without enhancing any code we can achieve this , option 1 is you can achieve
by creating multiple odata service , create you models based on requirements.
Option 2 create a Model and create multiple entity sets based on single model
in same odata service, use different multiple entity sets in your URI .



This is not your requirement , please give details about your business
requirement , we can discuss further.



Thanking you

Vengaiah
title: Re:How to access request object in Model Provider Class?

author: Jrgen Zeifang
text:
Hi Vengaiah,



correct, I want to create the model depending on the http request. But this
shall be very generic, since there might be new parameter values very often.
To create a new model or a new entity set every time I have new requirements
is not an option for us.



So the idea is to create one model with one entity set which contains just the
key fields (these are always the same). In a customizing table I define the
DDIC structure per URI paramater which contains the fields of the model.

Based on the URI parameter value I will read the name of the DDIC structure
and create the model dynamically. But to receive this I need to get access to
the request in the DEFINE method of the model provider class.



I hope my requirements are a little bit clearer now ;-)



Thank you!



Best regards,

Juergen
title: Re:How to access request object in Model Provider Class?

author: Vengaiah Chowdary Pachava Chinna
text:
Hi Juergen,



I hope I understood your requirement.



1) create a odata service with your ddic structure . redefine the define
method in *MPC_EXT Class with and include the below statement



lo_entity_type->ADD_AUTO_EXPAND_INCLUDE( iv_include_name = '<yourAbap
Structure name>'

 iv_bind_conversions = 'X' ).

  

 Now this will give a new model as soon as you change the ddic structure.

  

2) Go class /IWBEP/CL_MGW_LOCAL_HANDLER, in the class goto method
GET_ENTITY_SET ( provided if are doing get request in your HTTP).



In Line 26 , you can see a BADI
mo_mgw_runtime->/iwbep/if_mgw_core_srv_runtime~read_entityset.

  

 Before this line put a enhancement spot and use the function modules to
DDIF_TABL_PUT and DDIF_TABL_ACTIVATE to update your ddic structure as per
your requirement .

  

First put a breakpoint in the class /IWBEP/CL_MGW_LOCAL_HANDLER in method
GET_ENTITY_SET and see that URI is giving all the required parameters for
appending the ddic structure. Then go ahead with enhancement.  

  

Thanking you

Vengaiah
title: Re:How to access request object in Model Provider Class?
